loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of cooking oil, meat, fish, beans, etc.

loans.name: Nurila

texts.en: Nurila S. is a 48-year-old single mother of three children. She works as an accountant and is described as a benevolent, responsible and very hardworking woman. In 1993, after the breakdown of the Soviet Union and in order to support her family, Nurila began to develop her business of stock-breeding. Today, she has two milch cows, whose milk she sells to the local dairy factory, and three horses. Also, Nurila is engaged in the cultivation of kidney beans and perennial herbs, which serve as forage for her cattle. Nurila plans to use this loan of 70,000 KGS to buy twenty sheep for fattening and reselling and one cow. With her future revenues, Nurila plans to buy a mini-truck for transporting milk products to customers and consumers in different regions. About Bai-Tushum and Partners: Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To buy twenty sheep for fattening and reselling and one cow

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, four of whom graduated while one still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She has operated her juice selling business for over 18 years. She sells to passersby and her neighboring community. Mwanatumu faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the winter rainy season, the demand for natural juice is very low compared to summer season. She hopes to purchase a pick up truck for light transport. 

With the Kshs 80,000 loan she wants to purchase window shutters for her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase window shutters for her rental houses

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Agnes sells provisions at Abura. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a driver.  Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of utility bills.  Agnes will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Juarez Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Juárez" está ubicado en la comunidad de San Andrés Cuauhtempan, Tlayacapan, en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo está conformado por 4 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas. La señora Gabriela A. Garcés es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre, su esposo trabaja en el campo, ella estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado de secundaria, tiene dos hijos se llaman Cesar de 15 años de edad está estudiando la secundaria y Miguel Ángel tiene 8 años de edad estudia el 2º. Año de primaria, ella solicitó su préstamo para comprar abono para el cultivo de maíz, además de sembrar maíz ella tiene un negocio los fines de semana de venta de elotes, chicharrones y patitas de pollo.
Ella compra su mercancía en la central de abastos de Cuautla y en las plazas de Tlayecac y Yautepec, este negocio lo inicio hace 9 años ella no sabía hacer nada pero la necesidad le hizo que trabajara y como nadie de sus vecinos vendía ella decidió vender elotes y chicharrones al inicio vendía muy poco, ahora ya le compran mas, la mayoría en éste pueblo siembra maíz y aunque en la temporada de cosecha del maís sus ventas de fines de semana bajan, ella vende sus elotes en las centrales, su negocio está en su casa en San Andrés Cuauhtempan, Tlayacapan, este negocio lo considera importante porque cada semana le ayuda para los gastos de su familia para la alimentación, su leche, su comida y los gastos de la escuela de sus niños y no le falta el dinero para lo más indispensable, su gran satisfacción es atender a sus clientes por que se distrae, cuando no vende se siente triste, sus cliente son sus vecinos y habitantes de otras colonias vecinas que van a comprar sus elotes, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para comprar el material de la escuela y los uniformes de sus hijos. Tambien con las ganancias aumenta la calidad de los alimentos que le da a su familia.
Gabriela está planeando ampliar su negocio ya que quiere vender dulces, tortas, quiere abrir un local en un cuarto y piensa acondicionarlo abrir puerta a la calle, poner el techo y acondicionarlo para que se vea bonito esto lo piensa lograr con los créditos ya que los va pagando poco a poco, este negocio le ha ayudado a su familia y le sigue ayudando y no lo piensa dejar quiere ir ahorrando para cuando ya sea una persona mayor, "los hijos hacen su vida y no cuidan de los padres cuando crecen", nos dice Gabriela.
Ella está muy feliz con este préstamo porque la aceptaron, ella quiere que sus hijos logren su carrera o una carrera técnica. San Andrés Cuauhtempan, Tlayacapan es un pueblo de clima frio, siembran todavía y hay una fiesta de San Andrés el 30 de Noviembre todos las familias hacen comida y esperan las visitas de personas de otros pueblos. Las integrantes del grupo son: la señora Rogelia M. R. va a comprar con su crédito abono y fertilizantes para su siembra de nopal, la señora Ana Laura S. Díaz va a comprar aceites par sus maquinas, la señorita Marisol C. A. va a comprar maíz para sembrar y venderlos por tonelada etc. La señora Gabriela A. Garcés va a comprar abono, semillas  para sembrar maíz. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y Fundación Realidad “que nos sigan apoyando con más préstamos para mejorar los negocios y las siembras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Juárez" and is located in the San Andrés Cuauhtempan community in Tlayacapan, which is in the state of Morelos, México. This group is composed of 4 members who all know each other and are neighbors. Gabriela A. Garcés is a member of the group. She is 39-years-old and lives in a common law marriage. Her husband works in the fields. She completed her studies up until the 3rd year of secondary school and she has her secondary school certificate. She has two sons named Cesar (15-years-old and in secondary school) and Miguel Ángel (8-years-old and in 2nd grade). She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer to grow corn as well as to plant corn. On the weekends, she sells corn, chicarrones [pork rinds], and chicken feet.

She buys her merchandise in the Cuautla supply center and in the main squares of Tlayecac and Yautepec. She began this business 9 years ago. She did not know how to do anything but necessity made her work and since none of her neighbors were selling, she decided to sell corn and chicharrones. In the beginning she sold very little, but now people buy more from her. The majority of people in the town plant corn and although her sales decrease on the weekends during corn harvest season, she sells corn in the town centers. Her business is located in her home in San Andrés Cuauhtempan, Tlayacapan. She considers this business important because each week it helps her with family expenses such as food and milk as well as school expenses for her children. She is not lacking the most necessary items. The most gratifying thing for her is serving her customers because it distracts her. When she's not selling, she feels sad. Her customers are her neighbors and residents of other neighboring communities that come to buy her corn. She uses her business earnings to buy school materials and uniforms for her sons. With her earnings, she improves the quality of the food that she gives to her family.

Gabriela is planning to expand her business, since she would like to sell sweets and cakes, and wants to open a location in a room that she plans to set up, with a door that opens out to the street. She wants to put up a ceiling and set everything up so that it's an attractive place. She plans to achieve this with the loans since she pays them little by little. This business has helped her family in the past and it continues to help them. She does not plan to stop and wants to continue saving for when she is older. "Children live their lives and do not take care of their parents once they're grown," Gabriela tells us.

She is very happy with this loan because they approved her. She wants her sons to pursue their careers or technical vocations. San Andrés Cuauhtempan, Tlayacapan is a town with a cold climate. They are still planting and there is a festival in San Andrés on November 30th. All the families make food and expect visits from people who come from other towns. The members of this group are: Rogelia M. R. (who is going to buy fertilizer with her loan to plant nopal), Ana Laura S. Díaz (who is going to buy oil for her equipment), Marisol C. A. (who is going to buy corn to plant and sell it by the ton, etc.), and Gabriela A. Garcés (who is going to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant corn). The group members would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad “to continue supporting us with more loans in order to improve our businesses and sowing season."

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a thirty-six-year-old man, married to a teacher with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family wish is to educate his children and improve the daily incomes and savings since he has the duty to provide the basics to his dependents. He has a lorry and has been driving it by himself for seven years which gives him a comparative advantage in maximizing his profits. 

He also supplies building materials. His business aspiration is owning a second lorry and supplying large quantities of building materials. Abubakar needs the loan to buy building materials: sand, bricks, and stones  for resale.

loans.use: Buying building materials: sand, bricks, and stones  for resale

loans.name: Junilla

texts.en:
Junilla M. is from the city of Labinay Ozamiz City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Junilla owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based  services. Junilla has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Junilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junilla is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Segundo Remigio

texts.es:
Segundo de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador que siempre ha luchado para que su familia tenga lo mejor. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado en una actividad que desde pequeño la aprendió por sus padres. 

En la actualidad tiene un taller de calzado en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposa de lunes a sabado elaborando calzado y reparándolos. El quiere seguir trabajando para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 12 años que estudian en un colegio fiscal. 

Para hacer mas calzado él quiere comprar con el préstamo cuero, pegamento. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de calzado amplio y bien construida su casa.
texts.en: Segundo is 53 years old. He is a hard-working man who is always fighting to make things better for his family. He lives in a suburban area called Perimetral and has worked from a young age learning the trade of his parents. Currently he has a shoe shop in the front part of his home. He works with the help of his wife from Monday to Saturday making footwear and doing repairs. He wants to keep working so he can provide for his wife and their two children, ages 14 and 12, who are in school. In order to make more shoes he is requesting the loan so he can purchase leather and glue. In the future he wants to expand his shop and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Purchase leather, glue

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 34-year-old carpenter. He has been running his business for six years with two employees.  He was previously employed in a furniture workshop before he decided to start his own furniture business.  Faulu Kenya has helped him to save his money and this has helped him to develop his business.  He has requested 30,000 KES to buy timber, plywood, cushions, block boards, nails and bolts.

loans.use: To buy timber, plywood, cushions, block boards, nails and bolts

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina D. G. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Cerina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cerina owns & operates a business providing general alteration & tailoring services like office, sports & school uniforms to local community members. Cerina has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cerina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Cerina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Cerina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida, tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su madre en el distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 1 hora la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, específicamente de ganado caprino.  Ella los cría al aire libre y eventualmente les compra pasto para alimentarlos.  Cuando han alcanzado un buen desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y en el mercado de las ciudades de Ferreñafe y Batangrande.

Ella desea adquirir más animales para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas, lo que hará que obtenga una mejor calidad de vida.  Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 34 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in the Pítipo district, which is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises small animals.  Specifically speaking, she raises goats.  She raises them in the open air, and she later buys fodder for them to feed on.  When they have reached a good stage of development, she sells them to the merchants in the area and at the markets in the cities of Ferreñafe and Batangrande.

She wishes to get more animals in order to be able to expand her business and increase her level of sales.  That will make for a better quality of life.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,700 soles from Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Gladys Erika

texts.es:
Gladys, D. 29 años, vive al lado D. su esposo José (30), que es chofer, y D. sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, y esta labor le permite educar a sus hijos con esmero. Realiza su labor durante sus ratos libres y ofrece variedad D.  cosméticos enseñándole a sus amigas el catalogo D. dos marcas reconocidas, luego que ellas le piden, les trae los productos y le pagan al crédito. L. experiencia le ha enseñado a proveerse D. productos en stock y luego también los venD. al precio real por lo que obtiene ganancias extras. Esta muy satisfecha con su negocio, pues le permite no solo obtener dinero además le permite ganar electrodomésticos por L. cantidad D. ventas, y en el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su negocio e instalar un pequeño bazar en una pieza D. su casa. 

Gladys tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. cantidad D. mercadería en productos D. belleza que necesita pues tiene muchos pedidos que espera concretar. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old and lives with her husband José, who is 30 years old and a driver, and their two small children.  Together they work to make progress each day.  

This hardworking woman sells beauty products by catalog.  This job lets her raise her children with great care.  She works during her free time, offering a variety of cosmetics to her friends from two well known catalog brands.  Once they place orders, she delivers the products and they pay her on credit.  Experience has taught her to keep products in stock and then sell them for their real price for additional earnings.  She is very satisfied with her business because not only does it enable her to make money, but she can also win appliances for the number of sales she makes.  In the future she plans to expand her business and install a small shop in one of the rooms in her home.  

Gladys plans to use this loan to purchase beauty products which she needs because she has many orders which she hopes to fill.  

This is her first loan with MFP.  Gladys promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to leave a bad impression with the people who have provided the money that will allow her to continue working and get ahead.

loans.use: Beauty products for her to sell to customers

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es: Yuliana, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia  al lado de su esposo Mario  de 34 años quien es gastrónomo y sus siete hijos, de los cuales dos son adultos y cinco menores; juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante trabajan  a diario. Desde hace seis años, esta empeñosa mujer trabaja como vendedora de comestibles al por mayor y abastece a las tiendas de su zona. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo pues es tranquilo y una vez por semana se dirige al mercado mayorista de su ciudad y se abastece de los productos comestibles. Esta muy satisfecha pues empezó este negocio con algo de temor ya que antes se desempeñaba como obrera en una fabrica y el sueldo era fijo , pero cuando le pagaron su liquidación instaló este negocio y desde entonces no se arrepiente por las buenas ganancias que le ha permitido adquirir. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una buena cantidad de mercadería, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y quiere comprar en una sola vez toda su mercadería pues la ciudad esta algo lejana. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un Internet en un espacio que tiene en su casa, pues por la zona donde vive no hay competencia. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca D. progreso. Yuliana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variada mercadería en comestibles, pues quiere mejorar sus ganancias para empezar con su nuevo negocio de ofrecer el servicio de Internet, pero sin dejar la comercialización de productos.
texts.en:
Yuliana, age 38, lives in her own home with her husband Mario, age 34, who works as a gourmet chef. They have seven children, two adults and five minors. Together and with great eagerness, they strive to get ahead each day. For the past six years, this hardworking woman has sold food products wholesale and distributed them to the stores in her area. Yuliana says she enjoys her work because it is peaceful. Once a week, she travels to the wholesale market in the city so that she can restock her inventory of food products. She is glad that she started this business even though she was a bit hesitant at first. Yuliana was previously employed as a factory worker and earned a fixed salary. Upon receiving her severance pay, she started her business and now has no regrets because it has enabled her to generate a good income. This loan will be invested in the purchase of a large quantity of merchandise since she has several orders to fulfill. She wants to make her purchases all at once because the city where the wholesale market is located is a long distance away. Being an enterprising woman, Yuliana has plans in the future to establish an Internet café in a space in her house since there is no competition in her area.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yuliana promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look back in the eyes of those who made this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of various food products so that she can improve her earnings. This income would allow her to start a new Internet business without having to quit selling food products.

loans.use: To purchase food products for her business.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elba; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, casada y tiene 8 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía en muñequería ella elabora estas muñecas hechas a base de trapo para luego exponerlos en las ferias sabatinas del barrio de artesanos de San Blas, podemos encontrar a la socia desde las 09:00am hasta las 06pm casi todo el dia,ahí la socia vende sus trabajos, la socia lleva ya años en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales ella se siente feliz con su negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar sus trabajos como hilos, agujas, diferentes tipos de telas y colores entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Elba is a member of the Communal Bank “Sacsayhuaman” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 55 years old, married, and has eight children. Elba divides her time between her daily activities and her craft business in which she makes dolls out of cloth. She displays her products at the Saturday craft fairs in the neighborhood of San Blas from 9am to 6pm. Elba has been in this business for several years and it has brought her financial as well as personal satisfaction. She is very happy with her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for her work such as thread, needles, different types and colors of fabric, and other items. Elba is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase thread, needles, different types and colors of fabric, and other items for making dolls.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 35 years old and is a married woman. She has two children aged 8 and 3. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Adelita is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for seven years. Adelita sells her harvest to the market. Aside from farming, Adelita also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She wishes for her farm and store to grow.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Adelita hopes for her children to finish school and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Hojiakbar

texts.ru: Бекманов Хочиакбар житель Яванского района. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Брат находится в России. Сестра, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он занимается животноводством, он в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области два года. Кроме того он занимается изготовлением окон и шкафов из дерева. Целью кредита является закуп скота.
texts.en: Hojiakbar B. lives in the Yavan area.  He is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. His brother is in Russia. His sister works on a small farm.  He works in animal husbandry.  He basically raises cattle at home for resale. He has been doing this work for two years. He also works making windows and wardrobes from wood.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander es un padre de familia de 27 años. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 6 años, Alexander desea adquirir inventario para mejorar la calidad de ropa que ofrece, el realiza las ventas de sus productos de manera ambulante ya que así obtiene más clientes. este crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, entre otros.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 27, is a family man.  He works selling new clothing and has been in the buiness six years.  Alexander wants to the improve the quality of the clothing he sales.  He is a street vendor since he is able to reach more customers this way.

He plans to use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, etc.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals, such as chicken and pork adobo, afritada and bulalo, to customers in the local community. Fely has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Fely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients, food, and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be Fely's sixth loan  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, food, and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La señora Amalia dedicada al servicio de flete de equipó de sonidos parlantes y de otros, esto a grupos musicales y amplificaciones, ella ya lleva mas de diez años en esta actividad, la señora necesita el crédito para compra de material de construcción para hacer construir un tinglado para proteger los artefactos que tiene en casa de el sol y la lluvia, el sueño que tiene la señora es poder armar su propio grupo musical, y contar como integrantes a sus hijos que son personas que se dedican a la canto y música, de ahí también que la Sra. Amalia sabe de espectáculos, es una persona muy amable y dinámica con ganas de seguir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Amalia rents sound equipment, loud speakers and others to musical groups; she’s been in this business for over ten years.  She needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a shed to protect her equipment that she keeps at home from the sun and the rain.  Her dream is to form her own musical group with her children as its members because they are people who are dedicated to singing and music; from this Amalia has also learned about shows.  She is a very gracious, dynamic person with a drive to get ahead for her children’s wellbeing.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to build a shed.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 30-year-old married man. He sells furniture in Mikindani, Mombasa.  His business has been in operation for the last two years. 

Stephen has been a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase raw materials to make sofa sets for his business.    The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and support his family.  His dream is to own several outlets in the future.

loans.use: purchase raw materials to make sofa sets

loans.name: Concilie

texts.en:
Concilie is 36 years old and married with three children. The eldest is 14 years of age and the youngest is 8 years old. They are all in school. 

She owns a shop where she sells soap, sugar, salt, flour and has a small bar. It’s now three years since the business started, therefore the loan will be used to increase capital. She will use the profits to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Lilliam Xiomara

texts.es: Lilliam  de 33 años de edad es casada, labora como docente  desde hace 8 años años consecutivos por encuentro, ademàs trabaja en su propio  negocio una clinica dental la que es bien reconocida en el Municipio, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar; esta solicitando crèdito para  terminar de pagar un solar  y de esta manera lograr su meta propuesta de tener su propia vivienda en el futuro. Lilliam se caracteriza por ser una mujer bien trabajadora y  muy  responsable, y en su comunidad la reconocen como una mujer luchadora y dedicada al trabajo y a su familia. su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y en los caminos de Dios.
texts.en:
Lilliam is 33 years old, married, and has been working as a teacher for eight consecutive years. She also works in her own business, a dental clinic that is well known in the municipality. She has the help of her husband, who takes on the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to finish paying for a plot of land, so that she can someday achieve her goal of having her own home.

Lilliam can be characterized as a very hard-working and responsible woman, and in her community, she is recognized as a woman who fights for and is dedicated to her family. Her greatest dream in life is that her family will remain united and stay on God's path.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Katungulu Development Group

texts.en: Rose, 38 years old, has operated a grocery store in Lugazi for the past 5 years. The happily married mother of 5 says she began this business with the inspiration of her husband. Before that, she farmed. She still engages in farming but it is now subsidiary to her grocery store. Rose says she is able to sell some of the crops she grows on her farm, such as groundnuts and pineapples. She also sells all sorts of snacks, jackfruit, soft drinks, apples, etc. Rose earns weekly sales profits of UGX 150,000. She intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more jackfruit, apples, soft drinks and other green fruits to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more jackfruit, apples, soft drinks and other green fruits to resell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean, 33 years old, is a farmer with her husband. They earn $6 per day income. She has four children. Three of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $7 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorbike for traveling to do farming with her husband. In the future, she wants to feed pigs to sell and sell grocery goods to make more income to support her children’s studying, because she wants to send them to the university so that they can get a good job.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to do farming

loans.name: Frank Yamundu Group

texts.en: Meresi is a 32-year-old married woman with ten children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the produce business, specifically selling groundnuts and beans, for two years. She started out with 200,000 UGX and now has 500,000 UGX as her working capital. Her hardship is the high prices for agricultural commodities, making her fail to purchase enough to meet her customers' demands. Her dream is to own a food store. Meresi needs this loan to purchase beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years and married with three children, ages 15, 10 and eight years old. Tailoring is her primary business, which is located in Githurai 44, at a very busy market. She makes a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings. Grace has been in this business for the past three years. Her husband is a businessman.

This is Grace's third loan from KADET LTD. She repaid the previous loans successfully. She intends to purchase rolls of material for tailoring and to use the anticipated profits to establish and grow her business. 

She hopes to grow the business to 30,000 orders per day and employ more wokers

loans.use: to purchase rolls of material for tailoring.

loans.name: Nancy Estela

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es una clienta recurrente de la Fundación, siempre cumple muy bien con sus obligaciones.
Se dedica a la venta de prendas para damas y caballeros, este es su medio de subsistencia y la de su familia. Ella comenta que todos los días empieza a muy tempranas horas su jornada de trabajo, regresando muy tarde ya a su casa. Dice que este trabajo la ayuda a poder salir adelante y darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa. Quiere continuar con su negocio, por lo que quiere seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá cumplir las demandas de clientes. Agradece a la Fundación, por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the city of Encarnación.  She is a returning client of the Fundación [Paraguaya], and always fulfills her obligations very well.

Nancy sells clothing for women and men.  This is her means of support and that of her family.  She says that she begins her work day very early every day, returning home when it is already very late.  This work helps her to be able to get ahead and give her family a proper and honorable life.

She wants to continue with her business, which is why she wants to continue investing in it.

Nancy is requesting the loan to buy all types of clothes so she will be able to fulfill her customers' orders.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it is offering her, since receiving the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and a father of five children.

Haydar has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $3000 in order to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut, 52 years old, is a fish seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband is a fisher who earns $4 per day. They have four children, one of whom is studying and the other three are working, earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy fishing equipment and a boat for fishing. This family doesn’t want to change their career of selling fish because this career can bring good income and they are knowledgeable about it.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Maira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maira de 28 años de edad, es soltera,  vive junto a sus padres en su casa, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 4 años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad él solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  a sus padres.

Maira observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Maira es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores comodidades a sus padres en la casa que viven.
texts.en:
Maira, 28, is single living with her parents in their house which has electricity and running water and is located in the urban part of Paijan District which belongs to La Libertad Department.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

She’s had a home-based grocery store for four years.  She sells basic staple items and groceries in general to her neighbors and local customers.  She has an established clientele and no other nearby competition.  She is able to cover her expenses and help her parents with this business.

Maira observes that her business is growing favorably and wants to continue expanding it buying more merchandise like foodstuffs and groceries in general.  To do so, she’s felt it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.  Maira is very hardworking and dedicated to her business.  She wants to earn higher income to provide more comfort for her parents in the house they live in.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 32 years old and lives in the Paynesville suburb of Monrovia, Liberia. She is married and has two children, aged two and 12. One attends school, and both live at home. 

For the past twenty years, Tina has been selling soap, tissue, and sugar. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these goods for her business. Her main challenge is that she has fewer goods on her table to sell. 

Tina says she started this business with goods given to her by her sister and learned it from her. She likes her business because it helps her to send her children to school. She hopes to build a house for her children in future.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, tissue, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Mtawali

texts.en:
Mtawali 47, is married to Everlyne and they have six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mtawali has operated a carpentry business, operating from home. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He dreams of establishing another business of selling vegetables.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Mtawali wants to start a new business and purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Bertha, se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y de engorde vive con su esposo quien también le ayuda y se apoyan mutuamente en este oficio, ella vende productos como queso, cuajada y leche los cuales tiene de su ganado. Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de una novilla y concentrado para alimentarlos, establecerá ya que con la compra aumenta el número de reses en su terreno y tendrá alimentación para los mismos.
Ella pretende incrementar sus ingresos y tener una mejor capacidad en su ganadería, por eso se apoyan estos préstamos de los cuales espera generar mejores ganancias y ser una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Bertha raises dairy cows and other cattle and lives with her husband who also helps her.  They support each-other in this work.  She sells products such as cheese, cottage cheese, and milk from her cows.  She’s asking for this loan to buy a heifer and feed.  This way she can increase the number of cattle on her land and she will also have feed for them.

She wants to increase her income and have more livestock.  She hopes that these loans will help support her, increase her income, and that she becomes a good customer.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed.

loans.name: Oluwatogni Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWATOGNI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Fidèle Rachelle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Fidèle Rachelle est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Fidèle Rachelle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Fidèle Rachelle est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Fidèle Rachelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Fidèle Rachelle vend de l’huile à moteur à son domicile. Fidèle Rachelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Fidèle Rachelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOGNI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The OLUWATOGNI group is made up of three people who all live in the same part of town. This is the third time that this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé, in order to improve its business.

The representative of the group, Fidèle Rachelle, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Fidèle Rachelle is 38 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend attend school. She is married to a mechanic named Joseph. They have four children, some of whom attend school. All four children are still in their care. Fidèle Rachelle lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple provides for their family.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Fidèle Rachelle sells motor oil from her home. She buys the motor oil from a market in Benin.

Hoping to be able to increase her sales and revenue, and satisfy her customers, Fidèle Rachelle, along with the other members of the OLUWATOGNI group, is asking for a third loan through ALIDé. The two previous loans were both paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy motor oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Jasinta

texts.en:
Jasinta is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. 

Jasinta operates a drinks retail store where she sells sodas. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located at a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of soda. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more soda to sell. 

Her business goal is to be a distributor of soda within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a single woman, 24 years old with two children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dry goods products to sell to her stall.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods products to sell to her stall

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi H. is the operator of Lomnava Eating Place. She cooks delicious meals for sale to her customers. She is always on time and her surrounding is neatly kept. This has won her the admiration of most people generating loyal customers. She however, has limited capital to cook more to meet this high demand. She is humbly seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to expand her operation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Senora Yolanda has been farming for the past 30 years. Along with her husband, they have been able to provide for the family with their hard work and dedication. She dedicates solely on the cultivation of rice.

Senora Yolanda would like to use this loan to purchase farming implements that will make it much easier for her to farm, and she would also like to purchase all the products necessary to grow rice, from sowing to harvest. She would also like to make improvements to her home.

Senora Yolanda is 54 years old. She lives in a house made out of wood and cement. She lives with her husband who has been farming for the past 43 years. She has 4 children who are all adults. She aspires to be more profitable in her farming, so that she can improve her living conditions, work conditions and family security!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda tiene trabajando en sus tierras desde hace 30 anos, en donde junto con su esposo han podido salir adelante gracias a la persistencia y dedicación que poseen. Se dedica netamente a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de arroz.

La Sra. Yolanda quiere invertir el préstamo en la compra de insumos agrícolas, donde gracias a su experiencia le serán de gran ayuda, para de esa manera cumpla con todas las necesidades que exige el cultivo de arroz, desde la sembrada hasta la cosecha. Además de mejorar su vivienda.

Yolanda tiene 54 anos de edad, su vivienda es de estructura mixta donde vive con su esposo que también se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 43 anos, en la cual han llegado a tener 4 hijos, todos actualmente con mayoría de edad. Su aspiración es llegar a superar sus índices de ganancias gracias a la inversión que realizara netamente en la agricultura, para así mejorar sus condiciones de vida, condición de trabajo y seguridad para su familia

loans.use: Rice cultivation & agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. C. is just twenty years old but has a bright future. She is just one month from finishing her complete high school education and getting a diploma as a bilingual elementary school teacher in her two languages, Ixil and Spanish. Next year she'll be sent to a remote village to teach kids who are getting and education and thus their first chance to break the cycle of poverty here in the Guatemalan mountains.

Rosa's business is weaving – she weaves the traditional women's top called a huipil and also several other items of traditional women's dress. A huipil takes her about two months to weave and will fetch about US$65 in the local market. With this loan, as she has for the last two years, she'll invest in yarn for her weaving.

Rosa lives with her mom in a two-room block house with a good roof. Her two older brothers send money to help with their living expenses, including Rosa's tuition, which has been more than US$12/month for many years.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase product variety and quantity.

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Mrs. Abiola O. is 42 years old, married with 3 children, and she hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She rents chairs, canopies, and tables for celebrants of all types of ceremonies. She has been in this business since 1997, and needs the loan of $400 to buy more chairs, canopies, and tables for rent.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, canopies, and tables for rent

loans.name: Sabari

texts.en: I am a mother of five: four boys and one girl. I live with my family in a brick house in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I need a loan of  $350 for my husband‘s blankets and rugs business. He buys these items from Peshawar, a city in north of Pakistan that is famous for its cheap items and Faisalabad, a city famous for its textiles in Pakistan. He then sells these products on his bicycle in nearby villages and here in Lahore. With your loan he will buy blankets in a high quantity for this busy season.

loans.use: Buy blankets in a high quantity

loans.name: Omosunmwen

texts.en: Omosunmwen is the leader of her union. She is into the sales of foodstuff sand beverages, etc. She is 42 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan of $1200 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She has been in the business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has a restaurant in the town of San Martin, El Dorado province, San Martín department, where she serves delicious foods typical to the region. She started the restaurant one year ago to help fund her two children’s education; her older daughter is at a university in the city of Tarapoto. Virginia is 43 years old and divorced and receives no financial help for her children’s education from her ex-husband. Virginia is a smart and hard-working individual. She started the restaurant with a few tables, chairs, a refrigerator, and $100. She now has a full kitchen and beautiful decorations covering the walls of the dining room. Her sales have steadily increased and she has hired her niece to help her out. She attributes her success to hard work and friendly service.

Virginia is part of the community bank Los Girasoles and is requesting a loan of $300 (S/. 800) to repay over a period of 6 months. With the loan, she will buy meat, beer, and sodas and improve her location. She is confident these investments will improve her business and increase sales. Virginia is happier and more confident and has big plans for the future. She has the goal of opening a new restaurant serving pollo a la brasa (rotisserie chicken) and french fries. The town of San Martin doesn’t have this type of restaurant but the food is very popular. She will continue to save until she can afford the grill required to prepare this food.

loans.use: Will buy meat, beer, and sodas and will improve her location

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with one 5-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of two other people, aged 25. Veronica is a clothes seller; she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 4 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Veronica has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Chery

texts.es:
Business Description and Loan Use

Chery is the owner of a small motorized vehicle used for urban transport services and additionally for the sale of local foods in the city's central working areas. Her total dedication to working for her beloved family has given her much satisfaction. Her desire to continue working to benefit her household has led her to seek a loan for the purpose of repairing her vehicle and also for purchasing ingredients to continue preparing her delicious juanes, a regional specialty.

Personal Information

Chery is 24 years old and mother of a two-year-old named José, who is the source of her inspiration and daily motivation.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio y Uso del Préstamo

La Señora Chery posee una pequeña moto para realizar servicios de transporte urbano y adicionalmente oferta el plato típico de su ciudad por los lugares céntricos de labor diaria. Su total entrega al trabajo a su amada familia le ha otorgado hasta el momento muchas satisfacciones y su deseo de continuar con su labor en beneficio de su hogar la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para reparar su vehículo e invertir una parte también en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para seguir preparando sus deliciosos juanes.

Información Personal

Chery de 24 años de edad, es madre de 01 hijo de 02 añitos de edad de nombre José, quien es su inspiración y motivo de esfuerzo diario.

loans.use: Repair of work equipment and purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris S. is a 36 year old teacher. She is single and has one son who is married and works as a driver. Since she was young, she has worked as a teacher in her village. She has worked for the ministry of education for 9 years in a rural area. She travels daily leaving at 630 am and returning at 700 pm. She is a high school graduate but could not continue her studies due to problems with her son. She would like to better herself by studying to be a certified teacher. When she has free time at school, she does a bit of handiwork and on weekends she helps her sister in making suits, all in order to earn more income.

Damaris has her own home and with this loan, she will whitewash four walls and tile the living room. She does not want to move to the city because the teachers in rural areas earn more than those in urban areas. Parents of her students and the students themselves are very happy with the attention she gives them, and are generous enough to provide her with food. This helps her substantially since her salary barely pays for her transportation costs.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Damaris S. es mestra tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que es casado y trabaja como conductor. Desde muy joven inició el trabajo en la docencia por medio de la alcaldia de su pueblo, trabaja para el ministerio de educacion con 9 años de servicio en la zona rural, viaja diario a las 6:30 a.m. y regresa a las 7:00 p.m., es graduada pero no pudo continuar sus estudios por problemas de su hijo, trabaja en la zona rural con multigrados. Tiene el deseo de superarsen y piensa estudiar la Lic. en Pedagogia, en los ratos libres en su escuela realiza labores de manualidades y los fines de semana trabaja con una hermana en la sastreria, esto lo hace con el fin de obtener otros ingresos. La profesora Damaris tiene su casa propia y con este crédito desea repellar 4 paredes y embaldozar la sala. No pretende trasladarse a la ciudad porque los profesores del campo ganan un poco mas que los urbanos. Los padres de familia y sus alumnos se sienten muy contentos con la atencion brindada por la profesora, de tal manera que ellos asumen su alimentacion, lo que a ella le favorece porque su salario le rinde mas, ya que solo paga el transporte.

loans.use: Whitewash the walls and tile the floor of her home

loans.name: Ret

texts.en: Mrs. Ret S. lives in Trapaing Skun village in Kampong Speu province. She is a garment worker. Her husband, Mr. Mean Mi, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ret S. is 22 and recently married. She wants to start a cow breeding business to improve her standard of living. She is asking for a loan to buy a cow for this purpose. Her husband is also shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow in order to start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Umedjon Y. is a businessman. He has been selling women's clothing for the past five years. He is married and has one child. He has a spot on the market where he trades. Umedjon would like to prepare his shop for the school fair. He needs money in order to bring in more school uniforms. The sales season lasts through July and the beginning of August, and therefore, all businessmen are trying to make the best of this opportunity. Umedjon would like to receive a loan and use it for his business. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Якубов Умеджон бизнесмен. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей женской одежды. Женат , имеет одного ребенка. Имеет торговую точку на рынке . Хочет подготовить твар к школьной ярмарке . Но для этого нужны деньги , которые он может использовать для ввоза школьной формы. Месяц июль и август начало торгового сезона и поэтому не каждый бизнесмен упустит возможность заработать. Поэтому Умеджон хочет получить кредит и использовать его в бизнесе. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Yovana Ambar

texts.es:
Yovana is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her life partner. Yovana has a stand in the Santa Clara market that she inherited from her grandmother. She sells seeds, vegetables, flowers and ojotas (sandals with soles made from used car tires) that are worn by the local campesinos. She buys her products in the city of Lima and she also receives shipments from suppliers after she makes payments at the bank. She works every day from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.

Yovana needs a loan of 2,000 soles – money that will be used to buy seeds, alfalfa and carrots.

Her dream is to build her house, have a car and establish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Yovana es conviviente y tiene 26 años, Yovana tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara, que fue heredado por su abuelita, Yovana vende semillas de verduras, flores y ojotas (sandalias elaboradas de neumáticos usados de carro) que son utilizadas por los campesinos de la zona, sus productos los compra de la ciudad de Lima y también le envían sus proveedores previo pago en el banco, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Yovana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas alfalfa, zanahoria.

Los sueños de Yovana son construir su casa, tener un carro y estabilizar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, alfalfa and carrots

loans.name: Yolanda Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda Bertha, tiene 44 años, está casada, estudió laboratorio clínico, hizo sus prácticas en Huamachuco durante 07 meses, después tuvo su bebe, renunció a su trabajo, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a trabajar hace 02 años en el negocio de cosmetología, la socia estudió 01 año  cosmetología y trituración. Tiene año y medio trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su hermana la impulsó para que inicie un negocio para que salga adelante por ella misma, ella decidió participar en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” porque quería implementar el negocio y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró tintes, secadora, líquidos, máquina para cortar el cabello, etc. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la implementación del negocio.
La empresaria sueña con comprar ómnibus, medios de transporte porque es más rentable además contrataría personal y ella lo administraría.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda Bertha is 44 and married. She studied Clinical Laboratory Science and did 7 months internship in Huamachuco. After she had her baby, she quit work, and now lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo Province, La Libertad department. In order to help herself economically, she started work 2 years ago in cosmetology. She studied one year of cosmetology and has worked in the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half. Her sister gave her the impetus to start a business so she could get ahead by herself. She decided to participate in the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA (Hope for Tomorrow) because she wanted to start her business. With the first loan of $110, she bought dies, hair products, a hair dryer, a hair cutter, etc. With this loan of $225, which she will repay in 4 months, she plans to invest in the running of the business. This businesswoman dreams of buying a bus, a means of transportation that is more profitable, she would rent it personally as well and administrate it.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Running the business, including tools and products

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua K., who is 37 and has four children currently in school, trades in maize in the local market of Odumase in Koforidua, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana. She belongs to the community group called Hyebenehi Trust Group, whose members support one another both in their requests for and repayments of loans.

She is seeking a loan to buy a larger stock of maize to grow her business and increase sales. Afua says her major challenge is the children’s school fees, which she works hard to provide. She hopes to increase her savings to further support the children’s education in order to give them better future career opportunities.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of maize

loans.name: Maria Lídia

texts.pt:
Maria Lídia C. é natural de Maputo e tem 45 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 15, 12, 10 e 5 anos respectivamente. Todos ainda estudantes e Apenas sustenta os filhos.

Maria Lídia estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando se juntou, desde a infância até ao casamento sempre viveu com os pais aos 19 anos se juntou, o marido é mineiro trabalhando na africa do sul.

Maria dedica se ao negocio de venda de frangos, trabalhando sozinha. Ela aprendeu com um primo a 6 anos atrás, compra pintos por 16,00mt e vende por 90,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 4000,00mt. Vive numa casa própria. Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva.

Maria tem planos para futuro construir mais aviários e ampliar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo, Mozambique, Maria Lídia C., 45, is married and has four children (ages 15, 12, 10 and 5), all enrolled in school. Her studies were interrupted after 4th grade. She lived with her parents until the age of 19, when she got married. Her husband works as a miner, in South Africa. In order to help support the family, she started a poultry raising business--an activity she learned 6 years ago, from a cousin, and does on her own. She currently buys baby chicks for 16,00 and sells the adult chicken for 90,00 mt. Her monthly profit is of 4000,00 mt. This is her first with Hluvuku and Kiva, and she will use it to buy more baby chicks. In the future, she hopes to be able to build more chicken coops to grow her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul R., age 49, has run his own food store in the small village of Sabirabad City since 1998. Rasul has 10 years of experience in selling foodstuffs. Rasul is married and has three children who all study at school.

Unemployment and financial hardship pushed Rasul to start a business by opening his store. Now he is doing well and his store brings him a stable income. Rasul is also a farmer and keeps livestock. Rasul successfully repaid his first loan. Now he would like a new loan to purchase more foodstuffs, such as cookies, candies, sugar, and macaroni.

loans.use: Purchase more food for his store

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna M. is a group leader of three who all live in Reussie Srok Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Veasna M. sells bananas, but he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy bananas to resell. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Veasna M. decided to ask for a loan. His wife, Mrs. Sim Ranin, helps him with the plantation. Mr. Veasna M. is 20 years old and the father of a child who is one year old.

Mrs. Sisara Choun, who is a group guarantee, is also presented in the picture with the group members. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bananas to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 36 años de edad con 4 hijos, su esposo es mecánico, tiene 6 años de socia en la Institución. 

Recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles con los cuales compro artículos de primera necesidad,  perfumes ,talcos , cosméticos para venderlos entre sus amistades.

La señora con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 amplio su casa y también invirtió en mas cosméticos, perfumes, talcos, champú, etc.  para su venta.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su consideración y hacerla sentir una mujer que puede realizar una  empresa , se siente útil, porque antes era solo ama de casa, ahora puede realizar lo que ella desea y ayudar con la economía de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the communal bank "Juntas hasta el final "(Together to the end) for six years. She is a 36-year-old mother of four and her husband is a mechanic. With the first 300 soles loan she received she bought basic necessities such as perfumes, talcums and cosmetics to sell amongst her friends. With the 3000 soles loan she expanded her home and also invested in more cosmetics, perfumes, talcums, and shampoos, etc. for selling. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for working with her and making her feel like a businesswoman. She feels useful, because prior to this she was just a homemaker and now she can make her dreams come true and support her household economically.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invested in more cosmetics, perfumes, talcums, and shampoos, etc. for selling.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally C., 32, and her husband, Mr. Boun Lay, 34, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1995 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are in school and the other two are still too young.

Phally has been selling flowers for fourteen years. She buys them from the villagers in her village for re-sale at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for seventeen years, a skill he learned from his neighbors. The couple also does farming in the village. Phally is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to use for growing bananas and green beans.

loans.use: To use for growing bananas and green beans

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa Sidibé  est une femme mariée, née le 26 Août 1956 à Tougan (Burkina faso) et  mère de 4 enfants (2garçons et 2 filles) qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le village de Nimbougou, chef lieu d’une des communes rurales de la sous préfecture de Loulouni (région de Sikasso république du Mali).
Matrone de son état,  Awa Sidibé  fait le commerce depuis 15 ans. Expérimentée en raison des années d’exercices dans le commerce, elle le mène conjointement en harmonie avec son metier de matrone.
Elle est à son deuxième prêt indidividuel avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt anterieur c’est bien dénoué. 
Madame  Awa Sidibé  compte acheter avec ce prêt,  200 kg de tissus de draps de lit et 1 tonne de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina faso pays frontalier de la république du Mali et dans la commune de Nimbougou et environnants. Awa Sidibé vend au comptant et  à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elle ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa Sidibé is a married woman who was born on August 26, 1956 in Tougan (Burkina Faso). She is the mother of four (two boys and two girls) and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and their children in the village of Nimbougou, the seat of the rural communities in Loulouni sub-prefecture (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). A matron, she has been in commerce for fifteen years. Experienced in commerce from years of work, she does commerce jointly and in harmony with her job as a matron. She is on her second individual loan with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loan was settled.

Ms. Awa Sidibé intends to use this loan to buy 200 kg of cloth for bedsheets and one tonne of corn. She acquires her supplies in Burkina Faso, a country bording Mali, and in and around the community of Nimbougou. Her sales are made retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women and men.

She envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for the most part to increase her working capital. Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedsheet cloth and corn

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina, 36, is married and has three children.  She has two yeas of experience in elei printing and fabric paints. Elei is the art of drawing patterns on a plate and then cutting it into shapes. It is then attached to the fabric and painted over with different colors.

Susitina sells to the public five days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 83 Tala. SPBD loans are Susitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Susitina is a new member, she just joined SPBD with the initiative to start up her elei business.

loans.use: Purchase elei board, brushes, color painting and materials

loans.name: Eusebio Maximo

texts.es:
El sr. EUSEBIO; Es natural de la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los Inkas, está a 1 y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es de profesión albañil y comparte en sus ratos libres la administración de un pequeño negocio de licores, ubicada en su vivienda, el es casado y tiene 57 años de edad, el socio tiene una sola hija que ya tiene su propia familia y vive a unas cuadras de su casa, el dice que es bueno dedicarse a todo en la vida y mantenerse ocupado, eso a el lo mantiene joven.

Nuestro socio esta muy agradecido y valora el esfuerzo y apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eusebio was born and raised in Urubamba, a province at the center of a region that was sacred to the Incas, about an hour and a half from Cusco city. He is 57 years old, married, and has one daughter who already has a family of her own and lives a few blocks away. Eusebio is a builder by trade and in his free time he also runs a small liquor business from his home. He enjoys staying active, saying that being dedicated and keeping busy keeps you young. Eusebio is very grateful for this loan, and is committed to making his payments responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for a liquor store.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing produces and sells ice blocks in her shop. She is 30 years old and happily married with three children.

Blessing is requesting a loan for the of amount of N50,000 to purchase one deep freezer. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for her ice business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet S. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are currently studying in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the eastern region of Ghana. Janet works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells fresh eggs and clothing materials. She buys her stock of eggs from the poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She distributes the eggs to coffee sellers, food vendors and canteen operators. Janet has been in business for four years.

Janet wants a loan to buy fresh eggs on a large scale so that she can cut down on cost due to frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

Janet is a member of the community group called Nyame Asem ("God’s word") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Nesrin

texts.en:
Nesrin is  22 years old and lives in Bekaa. She has owned a bakery since 2007. She bakes “saj”and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where you bake the saj bread. A traditional Lebanese cooking dome is used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Nesrin requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and raw material for her bakery. This is the first time that Nesrin has requested a loan. 
Nesrin is well known for her good and tasty mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When Nesrin first started her business, she had some financial issues. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation and she also wanted to have an independent job. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Nesrin will use the loan to purchase merchandise and raw material for her bakery.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through senior high. Her husband is a trader.

Grace sells clothes and bags at Hohoe, which she has done since 2004. She uses her income in payment of the fees and utility bills of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more of the shoes and bags she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Sokina

texts.ru: Сокина Очилова   торгует на рынке нижним бельем. Первый кредит получала на расширения бизнеса. Так как нет мужа она сама вынуждена содержать семью.  Тогда она еще продавала носками , платками и детскими нижним бельем. Сейчас постепенно перешла на   торговлю женского нижнего белья. Она меняла свою торговую точку 2 раза. За прежние места она платила дорогую арендную плату.  От чего и оставалась маленькая прибыль. Но кредит ей помог найти более достойное и удобное для торговли место.
texts.en:
Sokina O. sells undergarments at the market. She received her first loan for business expansion. Because Sokina has no husband, she has to support her family by herself. Previously, she also sold socks, scarves and children’s undergarments. Since then, she gradually transitioned to sales of women’s undergarments. Sokina moved her retail store twice because leases on previous spaces were very expensive. This is why her profits were small. However, a loan helped her find a more affordable and convenient retail location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's undergarments

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
LILIBETH M. has 4 adult children,is separated from her husband and lives in Brgy. Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental. 

As a single parent, she has been earning a living for the past 12 years by operating a General Store with a twist - she also offers Over-the-Counter Medicines and other health products to her neighbors. Since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999, Lilibeth has continously invested her loans into her business and added more variety to her product offerings, and it nets PHP 5,000.00 per month.

For her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 19,500.00 to purchase more goods to sell in her General store and to add to her working capital.

Lilibeth is working industriously not only to support her family but also to save for her future economic security.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL & INVENTORY

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
