El Sra. Angélica E. S. S. tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos.
Desde hace 11 años atrás empezó con el negocio de venta de Artículos de Bazar y Ferretería, entre las cosas que comercializa en su bazar citamos: ropas para perros, casas de madera para perros, cintos y collares, cuadros, artículos varios para el hogar, además de artesanías hechas de cuero.
En principio comenzó con la madre, pero la misma tuvo que hacer un viaje en el extranjero por motivo de salud, por lo tanto la Sra. Angélica quedo a cargo del negocio, la cual tuvo mucho éxito y fue aumentando mes a mes su venta.
Con el crédito desea alquilar una Góndola en una de las mayores expo-ferias del país, que se realiza cada año. En esta expo-feria vienen personas de distintas partes del país e inclusive extranjeros. Es una excelente oportunidad para ella poder vender sus productos, especialmente los de cuero, que son bastante apreciados por los turistas.

loans.use: Para alquilar un puesto en una Expoferia.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
“Patience and hard work must be maintained to become successful in life,” said Jenelyn G.. She is the loving wife of Noli Christopher. They are gifted with a child named Princess Jhen, who is already 1 year old. The couple wants to give their child a better future by giving her the best education they can afford despite their difficulties of life. This couple also strives hard in order to overcome their poor living conditions.

Jenelyn is engaged in selling snacks like native cakes, banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) and also cooked sweet potatoes, in the public market of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband works as a carpenter/laborer in Nueva Vizcaya State University.

Jenelyn hopes to obtain a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders for the development of her vending business. With her interest in earning a higher income, she is patiently doing her best and is sacrificing a lot just to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To use for business expansion

loans.name: Santa's Group

texts.en:
Santa is the gorup coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Hondonada. Her story representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Hatian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR) and Dominican clients. The group is based in L. Alcarrizos a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure maD. of wooden walls and a tin roof which she owns but does not have title to. She lives with her husband and one child. 

She has come to Esperanza with the goal of growing her business of supplying salons in her neighborhood with hair products. With this loan she intends to purchase more hair products including shampoo, rinse and hair gel. She believes that this will allow her to supply more salons and to distinguish herself by always having what is needed in stock and providing high quality products. With her augmented profits she intends to purchase notebooks, books and to proviD. the figurative "milk" for her children. In the long term she would like to continue growing her business with Esperanza to the point where she can sell more products, reach more clients and eventually have the profits to purchase her own home.

loans.use: Shampoo, Rinse and Hair creams

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is thirty–five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Lydia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She buys bags of rice from nearby towns. Lydia has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
el so Andres H. C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de pulpería "San Antonio" rubro que mas resalta en nuestra sociedad, el es soltero pero le brinda el estudio y todos los gastos a sus dos hermanas,  cubre a un 100% los gastos de la alimentación para sus dos hemananas y su madre, ya que su padre fallecio y él era el unico hijo varon y se quedo viviendo en el mismo terreno de su padre pero en casa diferente, ya que el posee su propia vivienda.
Andres nos comento que se siente muy feliz por estar ayudando a sus hermanas, lo que el desea es que ellas sean unas buenas profesionales, quiere graduarlas de la universidad para que se puedan defender en la vida cuando esten grandes.
Andres solicita el credito para poder abastecer su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y a veces se le termina el producto.
texts.en:
Andres H. C. sells popular consumer items for a living. His business is called pulpería (a small store located in one’s home) "San Antonio" which is a resonate name in our society. He is single, but takes care of his sisters’ education and all of their expenses. He covers 100% of his sisters’ and mothers’ expenses and food since his father died leaving him the only son. He lives on his father’s land, but in his own home. Andres says that he is very happy to be able to help his sisters. He wants them to be professionals and to graduate from college so they are able to take care of themselves when they grow up. Andres is asking for a loan to supply his business since his customers order a lot which causes him to run out of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap to wash clothes, lard, oil, soft drinks, donuts, beans, tortillas, bread , TP, coffee, pasta, cereal, salsa, eggs, corn meal, flour, cheese, and butter

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Remedios is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Remedios raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional pigs to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Remedios from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides tiene 25 años de edad y vive con su cónyuge quien se decida a operario de construcción.  Tienen una menor hija de tres años de edad.  Él tiene una amplia experiencia como operario de construcción ya que se inició en esta labor desde muy joven.  Actualmente cuenta con un ingreso rentable ya que está laborando para una ONG en la construcción de un colegio en el lugar donde vive.  Su cónyuge támbien es una persona que labora temporalmente en fundos agrícolas.  Actualmente no está laborando por cuidar a su menor hija.  Ellos cuentan con casa propia de material rustico.  Alcides es un joven con muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es tener sus propio maquinarias.  El dinero que solicita es para completar la compra de un trompito el cual le está costando en promedio S/. 5800.  Se financiará la diferencia ya que él cuenta con el dinero producto de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alcides is 25 years old and lives with his wife, who is a construction worker. They have a three-year-old daughter. He has extensive experience as a construction worker because he began working in this field when he was very young. Currently he has sufficient income because he is working for an NGO, building a school in the area where he lives. His wife also works as a temporary agricultural worker. At present she is not working in order to take care of her young daughter. They have their own house made out of rustic materials. Alcides is a young man with many objectives and goals, one of which is to own his own construction equipment. This loan will be used to complete his purchase of a cement mixer which will cost him about 5800 Soles. He will finance the difference from his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Retoño 2009 Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento:  EL RETOÑO se encuetra ubicado en el Barrio  Carlos Laborde, esta en su  1er  ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, es un grupo nuevo en la institucion; tiene como integrantes en su mesa directiva a: PRESIDENTA  YINA,TESORERA  MONICA  Y DE SECRETARIA  ROSA MARIA, son las que van ha llevar en adelante la responsabilidad del grupo. En el grupo hay señoras y señores  que se dedican a la  venta de Ropa ,Zapato , Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrote, recaudador ,Costurera ,Tramitadora,Venta de  Cosmeticos y taxistas, etc. estan conformes de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitacion  se les informo, haciendoles una proyeccion de sus  ahorros ,y asi incentivando a los socios al ahorro  en bolivianos cada quincena.			
La Sra YINA, es la Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 años de antigüedad en la Venta de cosmeticos, en la cual va a continuar incrementando su capital de trabajo y va  ir destinado este credito ; le dedica 12 horas al dia, Tiene 2 hijas pequeña que todavia esta en colegio. La Sra es  fundadora del grupo   y  a la vez ya tiene experiencia en el manejo de ser presidenta a travez de la capacitacion  se la observo como cliente  responsable , trabajadora y cumplida  y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la  defraudara. 			
La Sra MONICA, es la Tesorera del B.E.; se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa y a la vez a la venta de  cosmeticos  de manera ambulante por la zona de Las Americas Lleva 3 años de antigüedad en ese mismo rubro y sin dejar de ser una ama de casa trabajadora , trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 10  horas al dia, su meta es de seguir Trabajando y ampliando su negocio con la ayuda de  Emprender.  Ella vive en la casa de su madre en el barrio Las Americas  hace 3 años, tiene 2  niños que estudian en la escuela del barrio y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en sustento del hogar
texts.en:
EL RETOÑO communal bank is in the Carlos Laborde neighborhood. It's in its first cycle, composed of 10 members. It is a new group within the institution. Its governing board is made up as follows: President, Yina; Treasurer, Monica; Secretary, Rosa Maria. These three will be responsible to guide the group to meet their responsibilities. In the group are men and women who have various lines of work such as: sales of shoes, clothing, cosmetics, prepared meals, groceries, collecting, seamstress, facilitator, sales of cosmetics, taxi driver, etc. They are satisfied to work with Emprender because they learned during training what their savings would be if they were motivated to save every two weeks. Yina, group president, has been selling cosmetics for the last 3 years. She will use the funds to increase her stock. She works 12-hour days. She has two daughters, the youngest still in school. She is a group founding member and has prior experience as group president. During training it was noted that she was a responsible, hard-working, polite client and she can be counted on not to waste the opportunity that Emprender offers. Monica, treasurer, sells clothing and cosmetics in the Las Americas zone. She has been in this line of work for 3 years while not neglecting her housewife duties. She works 6 days a week, 10 hours a day. Her goal is to continue to work and see her business grow with Emprender's help. She has lived in her mother's house in the Las Americas neighborhood for the past three years. She has two sons that are students in the neighborhood school. Her earnings help to support the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital Increase.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Juliana works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader who trades in all kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc., on a table top at the market square. She says she buys her goods from nearby communities. Juliana has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) She is 41 years old and the mother of five children. She owns a beer parlor where she sells various kinds of drinks. She also sells groceries. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase drinks to attract more customers. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es: Rosa Cándida P. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales son estudiantes D. educación básica. Rosa se dedica a venta D. ropa, la cual la comercializa D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Ciudad Arce, obteniendo ganancias diaria, Rosa sale D. su hogar cada mañana con la esperanza D. poder vender una mayor cantidad D. ropa que el día anterior, ya que a pesar que su esposo cuenta con un trabajo fijo, su salario es bastante bajo, situación la cual llevó a Rosa a desempeñar su propio negocio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se diviD. entre los quehaceres del hogar, el cuido D. sus hijos y su negocio, todo este esfuerzo lo realiza con la esperanza D. poder tener una vida mejor. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar diferentes tallas, estilos y colores D. ropa, tanto para mujeres como para hombre y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa Candida P. D. M. is 40 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, and two young children who are in elementary school. Rosa earns money by working every day as a traveling saleswomen selling clothing in the streets of Ciudad Arce. Rosa leaves her home every morning with the hope of selling more clothes than she did the day before. It is important since, although her husband works and has a regular income, it’s quite low. This is the reason that Rosa decided to have her own business. She is very hardworking and divides her time among her household chores, taking care of her children, and her business. All of this she does with the goal of a better life. Rosa requests a loan so that she can buy clothing in different sizes, styles, and colors, both for men and women, and in this way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy different sizes and colors of clothing

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga es separada vive en casa propia en la compañía Almada de Caacupé, se dedica a la producción y ventas de ladrillos desde hace tiempo, solicita un crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, para la compra de arcilla en cantidad para asegurar su producción permanente y así satisfacer la demanda del producto a sus clientes, asegurando el ingreso permanente a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga is separated and lives in her own home in Almada de Caacupé. She has a business making and selling bricks that she has been at for some time. She is asking for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy large quantities of clay (mud) to insure production and satisfy her customer's demands. This also insures her continuing income and family unity.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mud to make bricks.

loans.name: Digmelia

texts.es:
Digmelia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, y con sus hijos que ya son independientes, motivo por el cual se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio.

“Son como mis hijos”, manifiesta cuando ve a los niños que atiende en su guardería y es que se ha encariñado tanto con ellos que los quiere como tales. Ella atiende su guardería desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiempo en el cual muchas madres le dejan al cuidado de sus hijos por diferentes motivos como trabajo, estudio, etc. Entonces Digmelia, con gran paciencia y dedicación y ayudada por dos jóvenes que trabajan para ella, atiende a los niños instruyéndolos al aprendizaje con diferentes juegos y lecturas que los estimulen. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo y le encanta realizarlo, es por ello que en un futuro quiere ampliar el espacio de su “Cuna- Escuela” para así poder albergar a mayor cantidad de niños.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Digmelia con MFP y nunca defraudó a esta institución, por el contrario ha sido muy puntual con cada uno de los pagos. Ahora, con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos materiales que le hacen falta para equipar su guardería y que los niños se sientan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Digmelia, 47, lives with her husband, who is a teacher, and her children, who are now independent; this allows her to focus full-time on her business. "They are like my own children," she states when referring to the children that attend her child care center. This is because she has become so attached to them that she loves them as if they were her own. She tends to the center from 8am until 6pm; a period of time when many mothers leave their children with her to be cared for. They have several reasons for doing so: work, study, etc. So Dogmelia, very patiently and with much dedication, assited by two young employees, tends to the children initiating them into the learning process with various challenging games and readings. She enjoys her work very much and loves doing it. This is why she would like, in the future, to enlarge the space of her "Cuna-Escuela" so that she can house more children. This is Digmelia's 7th loan with MFP; she has never defrauded the institution. On the contrary, she has been very punctual with every one of her payments. Now, with the requested funds, she will buy some materials that she needs for her child care center so that the children will feel more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's educational materials.

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Тавбаев Бобомурод проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Bobomurod T. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives together with his parents. Bobomurod is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle to re-sell it for meat. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Also, the development of this sphere provides markets with fresh meat. Bobomurod has been in this business for 8 years now. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a married, 42-year-old woman living with her husband and children. She lives in the town of Hikkaduwa. Her husband operates a transport service for employment.

Lani prepares food to be sold to local shops and markets, which helps to support her family's expenses. Every day, her husband goes to small restaurants to help sell her food.

Two years ago Lani started this business. She is a very hardworking, active and honest lady and she hopes to continue to see success.

Lani has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to buy supplies for her food-preparation business. Ultimately she hopes to use her increased income to renovate her family's house.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita L., 48, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Constaniano L., a vendor, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been buying flour and rice sacks, which she cleans and sells back for a profit.

Expedita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her buy and sell business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of sacks, so that she can maximize her income.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s health. She wants them to be healthy for it is in health that they will start to have their very own foundation for success.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: Alma Nubia tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y atiende un kiosco. Este negocio lo inicio hace más 7 años, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarles a sus hijos lo que más necesitan. Ella disfruta mucho de este negocio, pues cuando inicio no tenia este pequeño Kiosco ahora tiene un puesto para ofrecer sus productos y así sus clientes puedan disfrutar. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, frutas, jugos, gaseosas y sopas en cajas. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para tener una fuente ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia, 42, has 3 children. She operates a food stand, a business that she has worked at for more than 7 years. For all that time, she has thought of little but providing her children with the things that they most need. She likes the business very much. She didn't have the food stand when she first started but now she has a place to sell her dishes and where her customers can come to enjoy them. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, sweets, fruit, juices, soft drinks and boxed soups. Her goal is to continue investing in the business so that she can establish a steady source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en: Lhagvajav D., 42, lives with her husband in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband has recently returned from working in Korea. Lhagvajav operates a tailoring business. She is a professional in her business, having earned a certificate in sewing in Russia in 1987. Lhagvajav has been operating her business since 1992, and has gained significant experience over the last 18 years. She has a good personality and great communication skills. Lhagvajav is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu S. is married and has five dependants. She has been through junior high school. Salamatu sells waakye and rice with tomato and pepper sauce in Abura. To prepare waakye she gets beans, rice and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become a little tender. She then adds the colored leaves to give the boiling water of the beans a wine color, then she adds her rice to get a mixture of the rice and beans in the water. She cooks until the rice becomes tender to eat. Waakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (smoked cow hide), gari (couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish of any kind, and meat of your choice. She has been cooking food to sell for the past eight years. Salamatu's husband is a mason. Salamatu uses the revenue she generates from her sales to help her husband with the general welfare of the family. She will add this loan to her own capital to buy more rice, beans and other foodstuffs to increase her production and expand her sales. Salamatu plans to reinvest the new profits from her extended business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Twenty-four year old Maricel Enriquez wishes for a life that is comfortable for her family, and takes care of them from the profits she earns from her “sari-sari” store and rice retail business, in addition to the income of her 26 year old husband, who is a hired laborer. Presently, Maricel and her husband Jimmy have one child. Despite her early marriage and motherhood, Maricel is very protective of her son. She doesn’t want her child to suffer different forms of oppression due to poverty, just like her and her husband, because they knew how it feels to live a life with so many boundaries. Maricel is still in the process of getting to know herself and her potential in a wider perspective.
 
Her membership in ASHI is one of the best things that happened to her life. Through ASHI she has able to improve the social aspect of her personality because in every ASHI activity she meets a lot of women from other villages and municipalities. The loans she received since 2009 have enabled her to enhance her capability to become productive. Small proceeds from her business somehow enable her to support the needs of her family.

Through the loan Maricel is requesting presently from KIVA through ASHI, she hopes to sustain the operation of her “sari-sari” store, which is just a small store. The inventory is composed of a few varieties of grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages. Someday, she hopes that this will turn into a mini-grocery store which can sell large volumes of grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages. Unlike “sari-sari” store, which can only accommodate resales, a mini-grocery store has the capacity to sell wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, varieties of foodstuffs, rice and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Soeurng Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has fourteen people who are villagers in Trapeang Leuk village, Takeo province. Mrs. Phalla S. is a village bank president who was born in 1961. They all will use portion of their loan for different ways in which it can improve their living. Mrs. Phalla S. owns a general store in local village where she can sell groceries to earn some profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sovan Nuon, is a bicycle repair. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Phalla S. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resale. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other one is studying in local school, and the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resale

loans.name: Yolanda Monica

texts.es:
Yolanda de 48 años, , vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), ella trabaja en su carro haciendo taxi y expreso todos los días. 

Cuando llego a vivir a Duran comenzó a trabajar en su carro para tener dinero adicional para sus hijos, trabajaba haciéndoles expresos a sus vecinas pero como ya comenzaba la época escolar decidió hacer expreso a los niños de una escuela. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha venido trabajando desde las 06h000am hasta las 17h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para su carro, en el futuro quiere comprar una furgoneta para convertirlo en un expreso grande, y así asegurar el futuro de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old and lives in the Primavera de Duran (a semi-urban zone with a deteriorating ecosystem). She works in her car, providing taxi and chauffeur service every day. When she moved to Duran, she started to work from her car in order to make extra money for her children. She worked providing rides to her neighbors, but when the school year started, she decided to transport children from school. Since that time, she has been working from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM. She will use the requested loan to buy spare parts for her car. She wants to buy a van in the future, to expand her business and thereby ensure the future of her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts

loans.name: Jeejaan

texts.en:
Jeejaan is the resident of a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen. She is a housewife but she also helps her son in his milk-selling business. She is the mother of three children. Her eldest son is involved in a dairy business and the other two work in private companies on monthly wage. Jeejaan has a single dairy cow at her house and she takes care of her with her son. 

She owns a three-room brick house in this city. She moved here after her marriage with S. P. 30 years ago. Her husband started the milk-selling business but now this business has shifted to his son as the father has grown old and can’t work. 

Jeejaan’s son wants to buy another buffalo because he wants to increase the quantity of his milk. That’s why Jeejaan has applied for a loan from Asasah.  She hopes that her son will be able to successfully upgrade his business by purchasing another buffalo and the living standard of her family will improve. Jeejaan is  a regular client of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Mega

texts.en: Mega N. lives in the Lugala Kosovo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her brother. Mega has a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years, and works six days a week. Mega sells retail products from her home. Mega has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. She generates additional income by selling firewood. The main business challenges for Mega include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big and starting to sell wholesale only. Mega lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mairamhan Tashpolotova's Group

texts.en:
Mairamhan T. is the leader of the group. She is married and has two children. Her son (28 years old) earns money by working as an accountant (his salary is 4000 KGS per month). Her daughter (19 years old) is a dressmaker. Mairamhan’s spouse works in Bishkek. 11 years ago the family started their own cattle-breeding business by purchasing a calf. Since they started the business, they have been able to build a house and arrange their son’s wedding. Mairamhan hopes to get a loan in order to buy a calf for fattening. In the future, the family wants to organize their daughter’s wedding and to increase their cattle stock. 

Hilolahon J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 29 years old and married. Her spouse is an auto mechanic. The couple is raising two children; the older one is in school. With her portion of the loan, she intends to purchase furniture and lace for curtains in order to decorate the house. In the future, the family is planning to save money for their son’s wedding and to purchase a lot on which to build a house. 

Sirojidin D. is 51 years old and married. Together with his wife, who works as a salesperson, he has three children. The oldest one works in Russia, their daughter is married and lives separately, and the youngest son works as a baker. The family's primary source of income is from their own business: they sell foodstuffs by retail trade. Earnings from their business helped to pay for their daughter’s wedding. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more goods in order to increase their inventory. In the future, Sirojidin wants to build a house for his sons. 

Oltinoi J., 36, is divorced. She has two daughters: one is in school and one is not yet attending school. Ten years ago with the initial investment of 5000 KGS Oltinoi started growing cotton and potatoes. With money received from the loan she wants to improve her living conditions and purchase a refrigerator. In the future she wants to provide her daughters with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en:
Bidala is a married woman with three children all of whom graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchasing of business license.

She has operated her restaurant business for over seven years, selling to passersby and the neighbouring community. Bidala faces the challenge of theft cases in her business. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase three sacks of beans, a bundle of maize flour and cooking fat to be used in the restaurant. She decided to work with Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of beans, a bundle of maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. Beatrice is a hairdresser at Abura. She has been doing this for five years. Her husband is a farmer. Beatrice uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Beatrice will use the loan to purchase more and variety of hair products for her customers hair at the beauty salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to save to educate her children.

The picture shows Beatrice in her salon where she works.

loans.use: Beatrice will use the loan to purchase more and variety of hair products for her customers hair at the beauty salon.

loans.name: Vida Plena (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Vida Plena esta conformado por 13 mujeres y un hombre, quienes se dedican a un trabajo especifico que es la venta de productos naturales, con este trabajo han logrado mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de C., esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, su gran variedad de gastronomía, su gente y su cultura.

La Señora Martha P. vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de C., este es su primer crédito y ha sido invitada por su suegra. Tiene 18 año,  vive en unión libre y tiene un hija de 3 meses de edad, su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.
Nuestra socia por el momento se encuentra al cuidado de su hija, pero va a iniciar con su crédito  la venta de productos naturales como son los productos de Omnilife. su meta es   salir adelante con su negocio.

La Señora. Carmen Pérez vive por la estación de cumbe, tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad que esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con sus padres  y comparte los gastos del hogar.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo. Se dedica a la cría de animales como borregos, gallinas, cuyes, también posee ganado de leche es vendida a los carros distribuidores de leche, su primer crédito lo va a invertir en iniciar el negocio de la venta de productos naturales como son los productos de Omnilife. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

NOTA: En la foto se encuentra el Sr. Eulogio Rojas que es el coordinador de la Fundación en la regional Azuay.
texts.en:
The "Vida Plena" [full life] Communal Bank is made up of 13 women and one man, who sell natural products, and have thereby improved their household incomes. They live in different places in the city of C., which is known for its beautiful landscapes, its four flowing rivers, its great gastronomic variety, its people, and its culture.

Mrs. Martha P. lives in the Uncovia area of C.. This is her first loan and she was invited by her mother-in-law. She is 18 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has a 3-month-old daughter. Her husband works as a security guard. They don't have their own house, so she lives with her in-laws.

Our associate, for the moment, is caring for her daughter, but with her loan she is going to start selling natural products such as Omnilife products. Her goal is to improve her situation with her business.

Mrs. Carmen Pérez lives by the station at the top of the mountain. She is 38 years old, single, and has a 14 year old son who is studying at a school in the city. She does not have her own house, so she lives with her parents and shares the household expenses.

This is her first loan through the communal bank. She was invited by her sister to be part of this group. She raises animals such as sheep, hens, and guinea pigs. She also owns dairy cows, and the milk is sold to mobile milk distributors. She is going to invest her first loan in starting a business selling natural products such as Omnilife products. Her dream is to have her own house.

NOTE: Also pictured in the photo is Mr Eulogio Rojas, who is the Fundación coordinator in the Azuay region.

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products.

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en: Peragia M. is in her early thirties and is married with two children. Peragia opened her own charcoal and water business six months ago. The business is open between 6:00 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. and earns Peragia a low monthly profit. This will be Peragia's first motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Peragia aims to use this loan to buy a new water tank where she will store her water. Peragia will share this loan with her loan group Makoko, which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. In the picture, Peragia can be seen wearing white, first on the right by the tree.

loans.use: To buy another water tank

loans.name: Silveriano

texts.en:
Silveriano C. is from the village of Victoria. He is 52 years old, married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Silveriano raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Silveriano has been engaged in his business for over 32 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Silveriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silveriano is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Silveriano's 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos S. C. es uno de los albañiles (Constructor) mas populares de Canalete de Alajuela.
Desde muy joven, trabajo en construcción con su padre y aprendió todo lo necesario para ser uno de los más buscados en la zona, ya que su trabajo es de gran calidad. Para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes Don Carlos necesita ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones) para la compra de herramientas  y materiales que necesita para trabajar, por ejemplo una máquina de batir cemento, entre otras.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carlos S. C. is one of the most popular builders in Canalete de Alajuela.  He has worked in the building trade with his father since he was a young boy.  He learned all he needed to learn to become one of the most sought-after builders in his area as he does good quality work.  In order to provide his customers with a better service, Carlos needs 598,000 colones to buy tools and materials for his work such as, for example, a cement mixer.

Carlos is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete' (Canalete Communal Credit Company) which is one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 32-year-old member of Faulu Kenya.   He runs a cereal shop to earn a living. His business is located in the Kibera slums so most of his customers are low-income earners.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and grow his business.  He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale sales in five years.  He has requested 40,000 KES to buy maize, rice and beans.

loans.use: To buy maize, rice and beans

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S., 36, is married and lives with four of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who typically makes about US $1 each day, and she is supported by her husband who works at a rubber plantation. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have resulted in a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chhay S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
From Phnom Penh City of Cambodia, Chum N. is a 44 year-old. She is a housewife. She always does her housework as a daily duty, such as cooking, cleaning house, washing clothes, caring for her four kids, and other improvements in and around her house. 

She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field, earning a profit of approximately $5 each day for paying the whole family's expenses. The couple has four single children, two of whom are working in different jobs, and they often contribute their profits to Chum N. every month. 

She says that her two kids always need to hire a taxi to go their working place because they don’t have a vehicle, so she is taking out her loan to buy a motorcycle which will be used by her children to ride to their job location.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her kids to ride to their job location.

loans.name: Willian Enrique

texts.es:
Willian de 48 años, empezó hace 10 años atrás con su negocio  de venta de bisutería. Haciendo pulseras con materiales de madera, tagua. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y fue conocido porque el mismo hacia las bisuterías. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm en un puesto vendiendo artesanías de madera y tagua con ayuda de un familiar. También realiza grabados de nombres en las artesanías de madera al instante. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y haciendo diversas bisuterías. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hilos, tagua, madera para hacer diversas bisuterías. Su meta de aquí en los próximos años es tener su propio local ya que ahora tiene un puesto en la calle.
texts.en:
Willian is 48 years old and started a business ten years ago selling trinkets. He makes bracelets made of wood and ivory palm nuts. His business has grown over time and he is now known because of his trinkets.

Willian currently works from 8am to 6pm at his vending post where he sells wood and palm nut trinkets with the help of a relative. He also does on-the-spot engraving of names on the wooden pieces. Willian has aspirations for his business because he wants to continue working and making different trinkets.

Willian will use this loan to buy thread, ivory palm nuts, and wood for making different trinkets. His goal within the next few years is to open his own shop since he currently has a vending post on the street.

loans.use: Purchase thread, wood, and ivory palm nuts for making trinkets

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Guillermina; La socia es casada,  tiene 55 años D. edad, y tiene 4 hijos todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica a la elaboración D. tortas, ella hace este negocio a pedido,  la socia también realiza tejidos, ella hace bellas chompas a palitos y crochet, la socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para poder comprar materiales, ella quiere comprar lanas para hacer dos que tiene pedidos para sus amigas y necesita comprar las madejas D. lanas y botones. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. lanas y botones para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” Communal Bank located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The member’s name is Guillermina.  She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 independent, adult children.  Her business is making cakes on order.  She also makes clothing.  She crochets and knits beautiful sweaters.  She is requesting the loan at this time to buy materials.  She wishes to buy wool to complete two orders for her friends and needs to buy skeins of wool and buttons.  She is requesting this loan to purchase wool and buttons for sale.  

Guillermina is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making the payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase wool and buttons for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores. Viven en el caserío Nueva Esperanza en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 11 años, se dedica a la venta de gasolina y gaseosa. Su negocio está instalado en su domicilio. Solicita un crédito para ampliar su negocio e invertir en la compra de más gaseosas. También desea comprar galones de gasolina al precio actual antes de que lo encuentre demasiado caro. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con la inversión, podrá aumentar sus ventas y lograr una mayor utilidad lo cual le permitirá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y solventar sus gastos familiares. Rosa es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones anteriores de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old, single, and has two minor children.  They live in Nueva Esperanza in the district of Las Lomas which is an agricultural area in the province of Piura.  This is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Region.

For over 11 years she has been selling gasoline and sodas.  She runs her business out of her home and is in need of a loan to expand and purchase more sodas as well as buy gallons of gasoline at the current price before it gets too expensive.  For this reason she thought it was a good idea to request a loan in the amount of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  With the investment she can increase sales and earnings so she can continue her work and cover household expenses.  Rosa has had loans before with Edpyme Alternativa and has always paid them back on time.

loans.use: To purchase sodas and gasoline

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 21 and the youngest is 3.

Lyn is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for seven years. Lyn earns through selling her harvest to the market. Lyn also opened a sari-sari (variety) store to add to the family's income. She sells items like canned goods and detergent.

Lyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more drugs to stock her pharmacy

loans.name: Anania

texts.en: Anania is 38 years old. She lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is married with three children, ages 6, 10 and 12. Anania works with her husband on their farm and grows rice. She also owns a sari-sari store in her place. This has been her business for six years now. It earns her family 5,500 Philippine pesos per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ngeng

texts.en: Mr. Ngeng has been earning a profit from farming in Kompong Cham province. He is a widower and makes around US $2.50 each day to use for the family’s needs. He spends most of his life planting crops. He doesn't have a life partner as his wife passed away many years ago. Currently he lives with five children:  one is married and the other four are single. To fulfill the family’s needs – which often increase – one of his single kids is employed as a garment factory worker and has a fixed salary every month. She always contributes her monthly salary to Mr. Ngeng. This is a good time for planting rice crops (it is rainy season). Therefore, Mr. Ngeng is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian tiene  46 años de edad, el es soltero,  tiene 02 hijos menores de edad. Vive con unos familiares en el distrito de Pampa Grande, en un caserío llamado  Callayuc provincia de Cutervo el cual esta a unos 30 minutos caminando desde la ciudad, es un caserío pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse., no cuenta con luz eléctrica ni agua potable.

Julian se dedica realizar labores de agricultura,  especialmente al cultivo de café, en el lugar donde vive el siembra y cosecha hace 8 años, tiempo que le ha permitido obtener  experiencia en el manejo de  cultivo de café, el cual ha venido dando muy buenos resultados, la plantación está bien manejada.

Los terrenos que el trabaja están en temporada de mantenimiento por lo que Julian  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000  nuevos soles para que el pueda pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para que su cultivo pueda estar en las mejores condiciones, para el próximo.

Julian es una persona trabajadora, con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Las
personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Julian tiene  46 años de edad, el es soltero,  tiene 02 hijos menores de edad. Vive con unos familiares en el distrito de Pampa Grande, en un caserío llamado  Callayuc provincia de Cutervo el cual esta a unos 30 minutos caminando desde la ciudad, es un caserío pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse., no cuenta con luz eléctrica ni agua potable.

Julian se dedica realizar labores de agricultura,  especialmente al cultivo de café, en el lugar donde vive el siembra y cosecha hace 8 años, tiempo que le ha permitido obtener  experiencia en el manejo de  cultivo de café, el cual ha venido dando muy buenos resultados, la plantación está bien manejada.

Los terrenos que el trabaja están en temporada de mantenimiento por lo que Julian  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000  nuevos soles para que el pueda pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para que su cultivo pueda estar en las mejores condiciones, para el próximo.

Julian es una persona trabajadora, con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Las
personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.

loans.use: Pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para que su cultivo.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 45 years old and married with two children. Her husband works at farming and raising cattle.

For nearly 10 years, she has run a small street-side restaurant selling meals, soups, and noodles in the local community. 

She now intends to get a loan to repair her street-side restaurant and purchase cattle for resale. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To repair her street-side restaurant and purchase cattle

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu, a 45-year-old married mother of two living in the Philippines, has operated a retail shop that sells clothing such as t-shirts and blouses from NATASHA & AVON for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell. In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 26 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Ann sells sea cucumbers in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sea cucumbers and lobsters to sell. Mary Ann has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as lobster and sea cucumber.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumbers and lobsters to sell.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 30s, is married and has one child who still goes to school. She has been running a cosmetics business for one and a half years. She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Pili's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more cosmetics and has repaid all her loans successfully. Pili hopes for a loan to increase her cosmetics stock. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Ustawi" which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To increase her cosmetics stock

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Despite life's difficulties, Flordeliza is still aiming to see her family lifted up from their status of living. She wants to give their children a better future someday through their farming business. She is 58 years old and a mother of three children. 

Her husband has been a farmer and raised livestock for almost 39 years. They earn an average income of PHP 40,000 after four months of raising their crops and livestock. They use the income for food, clothing and house improvement.

Flordeliza is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and farm machinery to increase crop yields in farming. She is hoping that they will produce a good harvest each cropping to earn more income for the future sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and farm machinery

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Hasifa has a business of selling used clothes.  She works 7 days out of every week.  Hasifa sells her products in a shop.  Hasifa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.  She will use it to buy bales of used clothes. She also generates additional income by sewing table cloths.

The main business challenges for Hasifa include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build rental rooms and also to sell at wholesale only. Hasifa lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
La Señora Arminda es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ella tiene una despensa muy bien surtida en la esquina mismo del asentamiento de esa ciudad . La misma manifiesta que tiene una muy buena clientela porque tiene casi de todo en su despensa y le trata muy bien a sus clientes. Ella esta acompañada con el Señor Anibal, el mismo trabaja como mototaxista y así se ayudan mutuamente con los gastos que hay en la casa. Dice que uno de sus sueños es poder agrandar su despensa y algún día poder tener un supermercado, con el cual podrá atraer a mas clientes
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y otros para abastecer su negocio. También comenta que está muy agradecida con la Fundación por haber confiado en su persona porque esta oportunidad que le da la Fundación es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
Arminda is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She has a well-stocked store on the same corner as the settlement of that city. She states that she has a good customer base, because her store has almost everything and she treats her customers well. Her partner is Anibal. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver, and they help each other out with the household expenses. She says that one of her dreams is to expand her store and to one day be able to have a supermarket, with which she could attract more customers.
She is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, vegetables and other goods to stock her business. She also comments that she is very grateful to the Foundation for having confidence in her, because this opportunity from the Foundation is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder, de 38 años de edad, originario de Estelí, esta casado, padre de 3 hijos, el es comerciante, es dueño de una mini tienda. Anteriormente el trabajaba en una abarrotería pero después se decidió poner su propio negocio, donde vende mercadería de todo tipo como ropa, zapato, cosméticos,alimentos  con la ayuda de su papa dirige el negocio que hoy en día además el tiene venta de paleta de todo sabor muy deliciosas y demandas por sus clientes. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar mercadería nueva de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y productos alimenticios en general para abastecer su mini tienda. Con esta inversión pretende mejorar sus ventas, ofrecer productos de mejor  calidad, lograr mejorar su negocio pues tiene como meta lograr convertir su mini tienda convertirla en una tienda de venta de mercadería en General que le permita emplear a mas personas dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Wilder is 38 years old and originally from Estelí. He is married, the father of three children, and a merchant who owns a small store. Wilder previously worked at a grocery store, but afterwards he decided to establish his own business. He sells all types of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and food with the help of his father. Today his store also sells popsicles of all delicious flavors in order to meet the demands of his customers.

Wilder is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and general food products to keep his small store stocked. With this investment he intends to improve his sales, offer products of better quality, and achieve better results in his business. His goal is to convert his small store into a general merchandise depot where he can employ more people from his community.

loans.use: to buy new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and general food products.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty will use this loan to buy hair treatments and chemicals for her business and will use the rest to pay school fees for her child in college. She is 41 years old, married to David, and together they have three children who are all going to school. She owns a salon and has been in the business for the past two years. She makes a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings from the business. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. Anticipated profits will be used to support the family's financial budget and also to pay school fees for the children. Her dream is to see all her children educated to university level.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments and hair chemicals

loans.name: Damba

texts.en: Damba is 22 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Currently, his wife is looking after her daughter. He started his private taxi service business in 2009 by purchasing his own sedan. Now that their daughter is old enough to join kindergarten, his wife is a cook at a private bakery company. Damba also operates a grocery retail business. He is a strong and diligent man who says, "Now that we're parents, we need more income to support our daughter." He is requesting 250,000 MNT to purchase more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Irene Edilberta

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos.  Tiene  estudios de educación secundaria.
	
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de tres años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  la venta de chifleria y bordados.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco bolsas de detergentes de diferentes tamaños, la señora dice que cada bolsa cuesta a S/. 120.00 nuevo soles, su esposos tiene un trabajo independiente.

La señora desea continuar con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y el intercambio de palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the department of Puno.  She is 38 years old and lives with her partner and two children.  She has a secondary education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for over three years now.  Her first loan was for 200 nuevos soles, which she invested in selling medicinal herbs and embroidery.

With this new loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will buy five bags of detergent in different sizes.  She says that each bag costs 120 nuevos soles.  Her partner has his own independent work.

She would like to continue with her business and improve her earnings.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality, responsibility, and the interaction with other members.

loans.use: to buy five bags of detergent in different sizes.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, a 29-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she has had a shop that sells detergents, soaps and noodles for the past five years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she has equested a loan for PHP 8,000 to more goods for her shop. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soaps and noodles.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man who started his business with the help of his family seven years ago. He runs a mini market that sells mostly snacks and some basic food products such as sugar, salt, etc. Now he has applied for a loan to buy more food products so he can expand his business and is able to serve more people.

loans.use: to buy more food products for his store.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business of sewing clothes. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete her orders on time and earn more income.

She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month due to her good quality work. She is very dedicated to her work and loves to do sewing.

Allah is married and has four daughters and a son. Her husband lives abroad and works there.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that an investment will help her to make more profits.

Note:  In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Antonio Nazario

texts.es:
el señor Antonio Nazario es casado, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, roperos, mesas, sillas, etc. inició este trabajo como operario, lleva 10 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de madera, tintes, barniz, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Antonio Nazario is 41 years old, he is married, he finished primary school, and he has 1 child who goes to school. He engages in building items of furniture such as wardrobes, tables and chairs. He started as a worker and he now has a 10-years’ experience in this filed.
He is requesting a loan to buy wood, stains and varnish. In the future he hopes to run a far-reaching activity.

loans.use: To buy wood, stains and varnish for his furniture building activity.

loans.name: Lovette

texts.en: Lovette is 23 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with two children ages 4 and 7. Her children are attending school and live at home. Lovette has been selling coal by bags for the past four years. She started this business with money she saved, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it sends her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal for her business. In the future she wants to send her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 39 years old and married to Mary, who is a business lady providing some income for the family. They have seven children. He runs a spare parts' shop and he has been in this business for 15 years. Right now his monthly income is KES 12,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 20,000, which he intends to use to purchase more tires for sale. He will repay his loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: to boost his business by purchasing more tires for sale

loans.name: Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda

texts.fr: Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda âgée de 25 ans n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Eder. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certain scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda vend divers produits (pâtes dentifrices, savons etc.) de façon ambulante depuis cinq ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Evèdo Z. Princesse Linda sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Love My Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 45 years old and she is married with 1 child.
 
She has had a retail business selling sim card and payment card for mobile phone for 5 years.
Hiền lives in Ha Trung district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more sim card and payment card for mobile phone to resell.
In 2014, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Love my life" group, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more sim card and payment card for mobile phone to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business of selling eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en: Celestine G. is 46 years old and has 4 children. She lives in Yopougon, a township in north Abidjan. Celestine, who was a typist in a textile company in north Cote d’Ivoire, lost her job in January 2004. She came to Abidjan and opened a cosmetics store with a micro-loan from AE&I. Since then Celestine has continue developing her activities and she is the main financial provider for her family, as her husband died in December, 2006. Celestine is a solid performer and a dynamic woman.

loans.use: Purchase goods and diversify her cosmetic products offer

loans.name: Porfiria Faustina

texts.es:
Porfiria works at home selling fruits and vegetables that she buys in the city market. She's 36 years old and married with 5 children; her husband grows maize. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 6 group; with the loan, she hopes to renovate the part of her house where she sells her produce so that she can display the fruits and vegetables better and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

PORFIRIA, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa la cual compra en el mercado de la ciudad, es casada tiene 5 hijos y 36 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la siembra del maíz. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 6, con el préstamo espera acondicionar mejor el lugar de su casa donde vende sus productos y así al tener mejor presentación de la fruta y verdura aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca comes from Apodaca in Nuevo León, is married and has two children. Due to the country’s high unemployement rate, Francisca and her husband had no source of income, so they decided to start their own business, elaborating and selling cakes for special events. In the beginning, they worked only by orders but, thanks to their clients’ recommendations, the demand for their products grew and they soon incorporated a delivery service and opened a bakery store.

Francisca wishes her business will continue growing. In order to provide a good service to her clients, she needs a $1200 loan, which she’ll invest in the purchase of a bigger oven, that will allow her to increase production. She promises to repay the loan in six months. Take part in the development of this business. Francisca and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ante la falta de empleo del país, Francisca y su esposo se encontraban sin ninguna fuente de ingresos, así que decidieron emprender su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de pasteles para eventos especiales. Al principio sólo fue sobre pedidos, pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes, la demanda por sus productos se incrementó mucho y pronto incorporaron la entrega a domicilio e iniciaron una panadería.

Ahora Francisca desea que su negocio continúe creciendo y para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes necesita de un crédito de $ 1,200 dólares, que empleará en la compra de un horno más grande, lo que le permitirá incrementar su producción. Ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio; Francisca y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty lives with her in-laws on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Obispo Bosque district of the city of La Paz. Betty is already a member of Kiva and a previous loan was used to increase her investment capital. The loan helped increase her earnings by helping her offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She owns and operates an auto repair shop selling spare parts. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to acquire an even greater variety of products providing her with a new opportunity to grow her income. Betty’s favorable payment history with Impro qualifies her to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty vive en casa de los suegros en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Obispo Bosque de la Ciudad de La Paz ; ella ya es parte de Kiva y el crédito que se le concedió anteriormente lo utilizo para aumentar su capital. Actualmente mejoró sus ingresos, tiene mas productos y mas clientela por que surtió su mercadería, ya que ella tiene un taller de repuestos; el crédito que solicita ahora es para seguir surtiendo su mercadería y de esta manera mejorar aún más sus ingresos. El antecedente Histórico con Impro la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use:
Merchandise purchase

Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Oishahon

texts.en:
Oishahon is a creative person who has one cherished wish: to purchase a car for her husband.

When she heard about the KIVA program she said that it is Christmas wonder, because she had saved money to purchase a car and hoped to do this the night before New Year for her lovely husband, as he has always supported her in their family life and in her business.

But in the beginning of September her eldest child needed an operation and she spent the biggest part of her saved money on him. Now he is getting better and Oishahon and her husband work hard to make the best holiday for their children.

Yesterday she came to the MicroInvest office and asked to take part in KIVA's program with the purpose of increasing her assets to make a big purchase of new perfumes. She said that it will help her to get max profit and she can purchase a car for her husband. P.S. In the photo you can see Oishahon with her husband.

loans.use: Oishahon would like to increase the volume of her goods before the New Year so she can purchase a car for her husband.

loans.name: Nabweru South C-2082(I) Group

texts.en: Margret is 37 years old and divorced with six children. She sells soft drinks to earn a living. She intends to use the exra business profits to complete her house that is under construction. Sophia and Nasimbah both have retail shops and want to add inventory. Sharifah has a beauty salon, she wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another fridge.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John S. is a carpenter by profession. He is married and has one child. His business is doing very well and he wants to invest more in his wood manufacturing business.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more wood for furniture production.

loans.use: To buy more wood for furniture production.

loans.name: Kaundime

texts.en:
Kaundime is divorced with a 5-year-old child. She owns a small clothing shop, which she opened in 2007. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $140.

Kaundime is applying for a loan of $175 to buy more clothing items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: 28-year-old Khiev S. lives in Kampong Chnang Province, where she runs a grocery store selling oils, ice, wines, and other food stuffs. She makes approximately $4.50 U.S. per day while her 39-year-old husband earns $3 per day as a high school teacher. They have two children, both of whom are students. With a loan of $350, she plans to purchase a piece of land to build a new house on as well as more grocery products to expand her inventory.
