loans.use: To buy land and grocery products.

loans.name: Aida Merith

texts.es:
Aída is a member of Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, and is located at Jr Coronel Porillo 256 in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has one child. Aída invested her first loan of $100 in a business selling iced drinks.

Today, she continues running this shop, getting up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her son, after which she works until 7pm.

With this loan of $550, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy gas canisters, empty bottles, mineral water, sausages, etc.

Aída is very pleased with all her achievements in life. With her own effort and perseverance, she has been able to move forwards with her son and come out winning. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos can give to her business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aída pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 256 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 1 hijo, es así que Aída con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. venta D. bebidas heladas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda D. venta D. bebidas heladas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. su hijo, D. allí se dedica a la atención D. su negocio hasta las 7 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: cajas D. gaseosas, botellas vacías, agua mineral, embutidos etc. Aída esta muy contenta y satisfecha por todos los logros que ha tenido en su vida pudo salir adelante junto con su hijo solo con esfuerzo y perseverancia logro salir triunfadora por eso esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Halima N.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Halima M.. She is married and has two children, aged seven and two. She has four dependents, who live with her because they are relatives. In 2006, Halima established her used clothing business. Halima requires a loan in order to buy more clothes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To buy used clothing in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married with three children. All her children are currently in school. Grace is a food vendor and she prepares "waakye" (cooked brown rice with beans eaten with vegetable sauce) for school children and workers in her neighborhood. She has been selling waakye for four years and she wants to buy more bags of rice and vegetables to avoid price hikes in the commodities.

With this loan, Grace hopes to increase her savings towards her children’s future. She is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, frozen fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Rosa De Lima

texts.es:
Rosa started her business a little bit before she separated from her husband, and decided to take care of her six children washing, ironing and caring for children since her income does not cover the expenses of her household, so she decided to dedicate herself to selling makeup, an activity she has done for ten years taking her children forward. Thanks to this, she has had a very honorable way of taking care of herself.

She needs a $500 loan which she will repay in six months to buy merchandise, with your support she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa, inicio su negocio poco antes de que se separara de su pareja, y decidió mantener a sus 6 hijos lavando planchando y cuidando niños ya que no le alcanzaba con sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus casa, entonces ella decidió dedicarse ala venta de hamacas y cosméticos, actividad que ha realizado durante 10 años sacando a sus hijos adelante, y gracias a eso ella ha tenido una forma muy honrada de mantenerse.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel  a sus 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora que ha podido salir adelante con su  familia, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Edgar Munguia, procreó tres hijos  de 9, 15 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando la secundaria, actualmente doña Isabel  trabaja en un comedor, y en sus horas libres vende cosméticos, pues se vio en la necesidad de tener más ingresos ya que es madre soltera, son tres años de  estar laborando en la cocina. Sus hijos la apoyan en la cobranza ya que vende los cosméticos al contado y al crédito. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para estar más cómodo, para eso necesita comprar piedra, arena cemento y hierro.
A largo plazo es tener mas productos que ofertar a sus clientes, lograr mejores condiciones para seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa así como ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios a que puedan seguir preparándose para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel, in her 54 years of age, is a working woman and an activist who has been able to move forward with her family. She lives in a neighborhood called Edgar Munguia in the capital city of Managua. She has three children, who are 9,15 and 16 years of age and are studying high school. Mrs. Isabel currently works in a diner and sells cosmetics in her spare time for the additional income, as she is a single mother. She has worked for three years in the diner. Her children rely on the collection of money because she sells the cosmetics for cash and credit. The loan application is to help with the construction of a room to make it more comfortable. For this, it is necessary to purchase stone, sand, cement and iron.

In the long run, her goal is to offer more products to her customers, achieve a better position to continue making home improvements, and help her children with school to enable them to continue preparing to be honest and good men.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Nurkhanim

texts.en: Nurkhanim F. is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. Nurkhanim’s husband is unemployed, and her business is the only source of income for the family. She has been running a store for more than 15 years, selling a variety of foodstuffs as well as accessories for girls and women's socks. Nurkhanim is very dynamic and takes good care of her family. As much as possible, she tries to cover the school expenses of her children, because she hopes for both of them to become well-educated. Currently, Nurkhanim wants to expand her business by purchasing new goods for sale. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000. With the help of the loan, Nurkhanim hopes to generate additional income and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Mrs. Nai C., 41, and her husband, Mr. Buntha Chem, 37, live a long National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1993, and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are in school and other two children stay at home.
 
Nai is a fruits pickler and fresh fruit seller. She sells many type of pickled fruit such as mangoes, jujubes, and other types of Cambodian fruits. She buys fresh fruit from the market, pickles it, and sells it in front of a garment factory near her village. Her husband is a taxi driver. He needs to repair his taxi but lacks the money.

Therefore, Nai is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair and purchase wheels for her husband’s taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new wheels and to repair her husband’s taxi.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
48 year old Everlyn S. is a hardworking and sociable mother of 5 children. She is married and a business woman by profession. She sells ladies and childrens wear in the Buwenge market zone on a retail basis. She has been operating this business for 25 years. She keeps her business running by keeping good records of her daily sales to determine the sales and profits realized. 

Everlyn will use this loan to purchase ladies suits, baby shawls, childrens dresses, and scarves, among other items, to meet  the needs of her customers. She hopes to use the profits from the business to establish a wholesale garments shop specifically for childrens wear within the Buwenge area. With a wholesale business in operation, she hopes to send her children to the best schools in the country.

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of ladies suits, baby shawls, children’s dresses, scarves and others items.

loans.name: Eth

texts.en: Mrs. Eth M. was born in 1967 and lives in Ou Chrok village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. This business is doing well, so she has decided to expand it by applying for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her husband, Mr. Pheak Seak, is a farmer.  They have four children, three of whom help their parents in their businesses while the youngest child attends a local school. Her husband is seen here with her in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell from her store.

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que la ayudan en lo posible. La casa que habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos de plástico como tapers, buyones, sillas, entre otras variedades, los que vende en un puesto del mercado desde hace 3 años. María le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo por brindarle lo justo y necesario a sus hijos, los mismos que desde ya se sienten agradecidos con ella. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus clientes con quienes comparte muchas ideas, además le es muy rentable porque no sólo tiene su puesto en el mercado, sino que también su esposo se encarga de vender los mismos artículos pero por los caseríos de su zona. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y con dinero que solicita se implementará con más productos de plástico y también ampliará su pequeño local de venta.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives with her husband in a house they own. They have three children who help their parents as much as possible. Maria has been selling plastic goods from a stand in the market for 3 years. She works hard at her business to provide for her children, and they appreciate her efforts. What she likes about her work is that she interfaces directly with her customers, sharing ideas and conversation. Her business does well because she not only sells from her stand in the market, but her husband is in charge of selling their plastic goods around the city as well. This is the first loan with MFP, and with the money requested they will invest in more plastic goods to sell as well as expand their small stand in the market.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more plastic goods to sell, and expand her small stand in the market

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun S. is 43 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a professional tailor and has opened a tailor shop in her home to earn a living, and is able to make about US$2 of profit every day. Her husband works as farmer growing rice and vegetables. On average, he makes US$2 per day. She and her husband have four children and all of them are in school. Mrs. Oeun S. has requested a loan to purchase another sewing machine to make her business run more smoothly.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie A. is a 47-year-old mother of two.  Her husband is a laborer.  One of her children is still in high school, and the other is a college graduate.

Merlie has a well-established pig raising operation, and recently started a business selling fish.  She's been learning about buying and selling fish from a friend who has experience in the trade.  Merlie sells fish to people in her neighborhood.

Merlie plans to use most of this loan to develop her fish selling business, and will use part of the loan to buy more piglets and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy materials to develop her fish selling business, and to buy three piglets and two sacks of feed for her hog raising venture.

loans.name: Gerardo Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo V. posee su propio negocio de venta de bisuterías y frutas en la ciudad de León de Nicaragua. Como todo padre responsable, busca la forma de cómo obtener el dinero para brindar el mantenimiento  a su familia compuesto por su esposa y su hijo.

La razón por la cual hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de las frutas y bisuterías y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo V. has his own business selling costume jewelry and fruit in the city of León, Nicaragua. Like any responsible father, he looks for any way to get money to support his family, which includes his wife and son. The reason he has come today to Ceprodel is for a loan to buy fruit and costume jewelry to be able to further develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry and fruit

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia cuenta con 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tienen hijos, ambos viven en su casa acompañados de muchas mascotas. Después de haber trajinado por diversas chacras realizando uno u otro cultivo, encontró por fin tierras cultivables que reúnen las condiciones necesarias para sembrar diversos productos, sin la necesidad de abonar con fertilizantes químicos, por ser terrenos muy fértiles. Ahora, su preocupación es quitar las malezas y arbustos que cada cierta temporada interfieren en el desarrollo de sus plantas, la idea de Silvia y de su esposo, es sembrar sin el uso de productos químicos, ya que a la larga se empobrece la tierra. Por ello, esta pareja se ha propuesto mantener y cuidar sus tierras sembrando de manera orgánica y una vez que cosechen sus frutos, ofrecerlos a los mercados grandes de la ciudad de Lima. Silvia está muy ilusionada y contenta, además de convencida que este tipo de productos, con el tiempo, resultarán ser muy demandados y rentables. Silvia viene trabajando dinámicamente y con responsabilidad en su banco comunal; este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, donde ha pagado con muy buena predisposición cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de los terrenos fértiles que acaba de encontrar.
texts.en:
Silvia is 37 years old and lives with her husband. They don't have children but share their home with many pets. After having rushed about various farms working on this or that crop, she finally found cultivable land that had the conditions needed to plant diverse products without needing to enrich it with fertilizing chemicals; it was fertile enough on its own. Now her worry is to get rid of the weeds and shrubbery that interfere with the development of her plants every season. The hope of Siliva and her husband is to plant without using chemical products since in the long run it impoverishes the land. For this, the couple propose to maintain and care for their lands organically, and once they harvest their fruits to offer them at the big markets in Lima. Silvia is very excited and pleased. Furthermore, she is convinced that this these kinds of products, with time, will result in very high demand and be very profitable. Silvia has been working dynamically and responsibility with her community bank. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has always been very good with her payments. The money she is requesting will be use to purchase fertile land that she happens to find.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land

loans.name: Neema's Group

texts.en:
Neema Abudallah, age 26, is single with three children ages, 18, 16 and 12 years.  She has a  clothes and a pharmacy business which she started a year ago. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $100. 

This will be Neema’s second’s   loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open a small pharmacy and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants to get her second loan  to increase on the pharmacy  business.

Neema  will share this loan with subgroup c of the Mandela group. The subgroup has 6 members, who sell second hand clothes, sell food, video cassettes and new clothes. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Neema is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To increase on her pharmacy

loans.name: Salma Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is a very responsible and hardworking lady. She pays all her duties in a very effective way. Her family feels proud of her because she prepares good food for them and takes care of their health. Her husband's name is A. S.; he runs an animal selling business. He takes orders from the butchers and earns income. Salma baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to resell.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy woods to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zainab baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Another Zainab baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to resell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 32-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mouhamad has been working as a bird breeder for five years. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase birds for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financiA. situation. Mouhamad is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place for his birds. Mouhamad decided on doing this business because of his experience in breeding birds. In the future, he plans on improving his business by increasing the number of birds.

loans.use: To purchase birds for his work.

loans.name: Destine Sisters Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman with three children.  Her oldest child is 13, her second oldest is 8, and her youngest is 5.  All 3 children attend private schools in Monrovia.  Theresa’s dreams center around these children.  She would like them to have a nice house to live in and she would like to be able to send them all to school, up to university.  

Theresa is a fish seller.  She is taking her first loan to restock her fish supply.  She says that with her loan she will be able to buy 3 bags of fish from the beach. Theresa will compete with all the other fish sellers by drying her fish with red wood. This will generate a nice smell and that will attract the customers.

loans.use: To buy three bags of fish for resale

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn M. is a 25-year-old caring and loving mother to her two children and husband, Cristopher. She is determined to help her husband, who is a jeepney (small bus) driver, earn money to sustain the needs of their children, especially for their children’s education, and to stop the cycle of poverty in their family.

Genalyn wanted to save and invest for the future of her children. Thus, she joined ASHI in 2005 to have access to business capital through loaning. She then started cooking and selling food, buying and selling charcoal and selling ice.

Eventually, she thought of other businesses as her loanable amount in ASHI increased. Aside from her previous business she thought of raising livestock such as chickens, pigs, and cattle in their backyard. She lives in a mountainous area of the province of Antique, Philippines, and they have a wide, verdant space in their backyard that is good for raising animals. Some of these animals, after a certain period of time, will be sold and others will multiply. Her loan previously received is intended for this purpose. 

Out of the profit she will have in her businesses, she envisions that someday she will be able to build a stable house to shelter her family, and that she will become a successful entrepreneur someday, and she will be a mother that her children can be proud of.

loans.use: To purchase a pig, cattle and chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102241&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, ha incursionado en otros negocios, se ha puesto a vender comida por las noches en su casa, también vende cerveza y gaseosa.
Sonia necesita  un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de una vitrina, quiere poner en su casa su bazar.
Los préstamos le están ayudando a crecer en el negocio, cuenta con mas capital.   
El sueño de Sonia es  tener un puesto propio de bazar.
texts.en:
Prior loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102241&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Sonia is a member of the communal bank Nino Divino. She has worked in various businesses and has been able to to sell food, beer, and soft drinks from her house at night. Sonia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy a window, which she would like to put in her house. These loans have helped her build her business, and she relies on this continued source of capital. Sonia's dream is to have her own shop one day.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a Window

loans.name: Jose Cipriano

texts.es:
José tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de San José, una zona exclusivamente dedicada a la pesca, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la pesca artesanal, lo que logra pescar lo vende en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Santa Rosa y allí compra un tipo de pez cartilaginoso llamado raya para luego procesarla y venderla salada en los pueblos aledaños.

Su familia depende de este negocio para sustentarse y debido a que lo que perciben no es suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades, está solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas pescado para ampliar su negocio.

Su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos un mejor futuro y seguir creciendo como comerciante hasta poder establecerse permanentemente en algún mercado cercano y desde allí vender su producto a sus clientes.

José es muy conocido por los vecinos de la zona que lo consideran un padre trabajador y que siempre quiere saca a su familia adelante, en la foto el está remendando su red para hacerse de nuevo a la mar y seguir ganándose el sustento diario.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children in the district of San José, an area dedicated exclusively to fishing, which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

José has spent most of his life fishing. He sells his catch from the fishing terminal in the city of Santa Rosa, where people by a type of shark called “stripe” that is salted and processed for resale in the surrounding towns. His family depends on his business to sustain themselves, but they don’t believe it is enough to meet their needs. Therefore, José is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more fish so that he can grow his business.

He hopes to provide a better future for his children and continue to grow as an entrepreneur. He would like to have a permanent establishment in the nearby market where he can sell his products to his customers. José is well known by his neighbors in the area. They consider him to be a hardworking father who wants his family to succeed. In the photo, he is seen repairing a fishing net so that he can return to sea and continue his livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish for processing & resale

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en: Consejo P. is now 57 years old married to Rogelio P.. Ana Rose is their only child who is now 15 years of age. Because of the lack of means of income their only child Ana Rose only attains a primary level of education. This situation is the reason why Consejo think to expand her existing business which is a variety store that sells different things that mostly needed by a typical family. Her business starts when she joined in Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). Although her business earns income, it only support their daily needs in the house, but it can’t support the other expenses of the family like the education of her daughter. She really dreams of her only daughter to gets a degree on college through her hard working and of course with the help also of her husband. That’s why she decided to loan again in Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), this was her second time to loan money. She will be using it for the expansion of her variety store. She wants to buy more items like softdrinks, canned goods and different kinds of groceries to sell in her store to get a more income for them. Also she plan to get into buy and sell of different kinds of clothes that she will get in Divisoria, a place in Philippines that sell different clothes in lower prices, so that she will earn a much higher income. She really wants a better life for them as a family that’s why she never stops seeking for way to fulfill it.

loans.use: Will be used to buy items for her variety store

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El socio se llama Abrahan y pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de santa teresa la convención; y actualmente reside en la  urb. Independencia R-1 Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene  47 años de edad, el es casado y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestro socio visita librerías y casa en particular para ofrecer diversos libros, el socio deja los libros en cuotas para pagos mensuales, cada mes va a cobrar y tiene muchos clientes desde médicos y estudiantes, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para implementar más sus libros y así continuar con su pequeña empresa.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago en las fechas estipuladas.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is forty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Comfort is a trader. She trades in ready – made wears such as ladies’ dressed. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Comfort hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for over eighteen years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ready-made wears

loans.name: Buya

texts.en: This is Buya K. from northern Sierra Leone. Buya is thirty-seven years old and married with six children. His children are all attending school, three in junior secondary school and two in primary school. Buya is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to purchase house-building materials.

loans.use: Buy house building materials

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun P., 42, is a widow with one son. She lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her son has been a construction worker for one year; he is a farmer as well.

Chanthoeun has been a silk weaver for over ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Chanthoeun is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to help her son by providing capital for his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and capital for her son's farming business

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna es una mujer muy trabajadora de 32 años, vive con su madre en su casa propia, donde tienen su negocio.
Desde hace 5 años dirige su propio centro educativo, el cual instaló en su propia vivienda, ya que siendo de profesión profesora, vio por conveniente plasmar todo lo aprendido en un negocio propio, en el cual pueda enseñar a los niños además de lo académico, los valores humanos. 
A Giovanna le gusta mucho su trabajo es por eso que se dedica netamente a él, al igual que su madre, con la cual están siempre pendientes de las necesidades de los niños en cuanto a infraestructura, equipos, etc. Por tal motivo, piensa que aun debe mejorar la infraestructura para albergar a más alumnos y así brindar mayor comodidad a los niños.
Por ello su siguiente meta es construir un piso más para ampliar los ambientes de estudio.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos en los créditos anteriores, es por ello que afirma volverlo a hacerlo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará pintura y materiales para hacer realidad su sueño de hacer crecer su colegio.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 32, is a hard-working woman, who lives with her mother, in her own house, where they conduct their business. She has had an educational center for the last 5 years which she installed in her own home. As a teacher, she saw that it would be appropriate to invest her knowledge in her own business, one in which she can impart to children not only academics, but human values too. Giovanna likes her work very much; this is why she is so dedicated to it, as is her mother. They are always watchful of the needs of the children with respect to infrastructure, equipment, etc. For this reason, she believes that she must improve the infrastructure to accommodate more students and provide more comfort for the children. Her goal, therefore, is to add a floor to enlarge the classroom space. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has been very punctual with repayments of her previous loans. She insures that she will continue to be so. With the funds requested now she will buy paint and building materials to see her goal of enlarging her school come to fruition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to enlarge her school.

loans.name: Renovación De Las Aguilas Group

texts.en:
Jessica is the coordinator of her group Renovacion de las Aguilas (Renewal of the Eagles), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, a town famous for agricultural production of tobacco and beef, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home alone in a simple structure.

Jessica is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza to begin growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing pants, polo shirts and women's underwear to sell in her community. She will use the profits to begin saving to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Pants, polo shirts and women's underwear

loans.name: Mainor

texts.es:
Mainor R. F. tiene 28 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Platanares con su familia de 6 miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener mas posibilidad de vender mas crías. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de granos basicos complementado con la ganadería.  Es la primera vez don Mainor se financia con FUDECOSUR.  El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El espera que pueda salir adelante y que la familia se pueda tener un ingreso. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mainor R. F. is 28 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in Platanares with his family of six members. This loan will be used to purchase cows to raise for milk production. Mainor wants to slightly increase the number of animals he owns so that he has more opportunities to sell the offspring. This the first time Don Mainor has received financing from FUDECOSUR. He has no other loans with formal banks. He hopes to get ahead so that his family can have an income.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 41 years old and married with four children. His wife is a petty trader. His children are still dependent on him and they go to school. He is a commercial motorcyclist. He has two motorcycles. He rides one of the motorcycles and he hires another person to ride the other motorcycle.

James hopes to own a big transport company in the future. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a motorcycle to enable him to hire another person to convey more passengers to their location. He says that this will help increase his profits. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
C., 38, is a low-income person who lives with other family members in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married with two school-aged children. Her husband helps to support the family by farming rice. 

C. sells sugar. She buys palm sugar in bulk from palm climbers and she then delivers the sugar to the market where she sells it retail. She is able to generate an average of $6 each day to pay for food for her family. 

Because sugar prices are especially low this season, C. wants to buy a larger quantity of palm sugars to store in her home, and then sell when the price rises. To make that possible, C. decided to take a loan of $500 from HKL, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of palm sugar

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: Tamer is a 21-year-old single man who lives with his parents and four siblings. He started working as a home painter in 2006, and he services a wide range of clients in the village and its neighborhoods. With the help of the loan request of $1,200, he will buy additional painting tools and special painting machinery to develop his work and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional painting tools and special painting machinery

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos de 15 y 11 años, en su casa propia.
Por el progreso de su familia nunca dudó en dedicarse a diferentes labores con tal de lograr buenos ingresos. Felizmente encontró la estabilidad en la venta de cerveza, actividad con la cual lleva más de 4 años, resultándole muy rentable. Ella suele vender esta bebida en las diferentes actividades que existen en la zona en la que vive, ya que siempre solicitan de su servicio por ser una persona confiable. Además, todos los sábados, se instala en la cancha de fútbol de su localidad, donde siempre hay muchas personas por los partidos que ahí se juegan, logrando buenas ventas. Gloria espera seguir trabajando para consolidar su negocio y en un futuro hacerlo más estable, ha estado pensando en incursionar en otra actividad paralela, pero aun no ha decidido en cuál, pero sabe que a lo que se dedica le pondrá muchas ganas y voluntad.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y es considerada una cliente puntual y muy responsable, al igual que sus compañeras, con las cuales forma un grupo muy unido. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, Gloria quiere comprar más cajas de cerveza para aumentar su mercadería, puesto que en esta época de verano las ventas son muy buenas y sabe que logrará buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old. She lives in her own home with her partner and their children who are 15 and 11 years old. She never thought twice about working at different jobs to make a good income in order for her family to get ahead. She happily found stability selling beer. She has worked in this for 4 years and it has been very profitable. She usually sells this beverage at the different activities in the area where she lives. They always request her service because she is a reliable person. Every Saturday she also goes to the local soccer field. There are always a lot of people due to the games that they play there and she makes good sales. Gloria hopes to keep working to consolidate her business and make it more stable in the future. She has been thinking about tackling another parallel job but she still hasn’t decided in what. But she knows that whatever she does she will use her desire and willpower. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is considered to be a punctual customer and very responsible like her friends. They form a very close group. With the money she has applied for, Gloria wants to buy more cases of beer to increase her stock. The sales are very good this time of the summer and she knows she will make a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard E. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Richard owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling dried fish in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Richard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding his business. Richard is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sêdé

texts.fr: H. Sêdé est née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cela fait déjà sept ans que Sêdé vit à Saint martin, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à HOUNSOU, Sêdé est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Sêdé n’a plus d’enfants à charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Sêdé seconde son mari pour s’acquitter des charges familiales. En effet, pour participer aux dépenses du foyer, Sêdé mène comme activité principale, la vente de poissons et de piments séchés. De façon secondaire, Sêdé vend des conserves de tomâtes. Sêdé achète et vend par la même occasion ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Sêdé n’a pas été à l’école mais possède quatre années d’expériences dans son domaine. Sêdé a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt chez ALIDé, prêt qui a été bien remboursé. Sêdé souhaite renforcer son activité mais ne dispose pas d’assez de ressources financières pour y arriver, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
H. Sêdé was born in 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  For seven years already, she has been living in Saint Martin, a district of Cotonou.  Married to HOUNSOU, she is the mother of two children, who have both had schooling.  She no long has children to support.  The couple live together with their children.  She backs up her husband in covering family expenses.  Basically, to take part in covering household expenses, Sêdé runs her main business selling fish and dried chili peppers.  Secondarily, she sells canned tomatoes.  She buys and sells these goods in the same trip to Dantokpa, the international market of Benin She did not attend school but has four years of experience in her domain.  She once benefited from a loan with ALIDé that she has repaid.  Sêdé wishes to bolster her business but lacks sufficient financial resources to do so.  This is why she is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fish and chili peppers

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi O. de 41 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, municipio ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 6 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de su madre. Ana trabaja como costurera, y posee su taller de costura en su propia casa de habitación, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a solicitar su servicio, desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se dedica a este trabajo, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos, por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable quien se ha esforzado mucho por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo hilos de diferentes colores, botones y todo lo necesario para atender mayor cantidad de clientes. Ella depende en gran manera de este trabajo por lo que desea mejorarlo ya que es el que le permite contar con el dinero necesario para la manutención de sus hijos.
texts.en:
41-year old Ana Deysi O. lives in Soyapango, a municipality located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her three children aged 17, 15, and 6 years. They all attend school, thanks to the great effort of their mother. Ana works as a seamstress and runs a workshop out of her own home. Her customers can go there to ask for her services. She has been doing this work for many years so her customers and neighbours are happy to provide good references; she is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman who works hard to give her children a better future. Ana is asking for a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of fabric in different colours and prints, as well as thread in a range of colours, buttons, and all that is required to serve the needs of more customers. She depends in large part on this job so wishes to improve the business and thus provide the income necessary for the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread etc for making clothes

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años realiza tejidos a mano, utilizando palos de tejer o crochet, de esa manera produce bellas piezas de vestir, como: gorros, bufandas, de acuerdo al pedido del cliente. Sarita tiene familiares que constantemente viajan a la ciudad para comercializar su mercadería, es cuando aprovecha para que lleven las prendas que ha tejido, entre 4 a 5 bufandas y gorros. Siempre esta en la búsqueda de nuevos diseños que salen en revistas y también en Internet para tejerlos. Este negocio le es rentable por que tiene clientes que valoran mucho su trabajo, puesto que los años de experiencia que tuvo, le ha ayudado ha elaborar hermosos tejidos, por tal motivo desea que sus trabajos sean exportados a otros países. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de lanas al por mayor, así como variedad de color y calidad.
texts.en:
Sarita is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in the home that they own. For more than 6 years she has been making hand-woven goods, using either knitting needles or crochet hooks. Utilizing these methods, she produces beautiful articles of clothing like hats, scarves or anything her customers order. Sarita has family members who are constantly traveling to the city to sell their merchandise, and she takes advantage of their trips to have them bring the garments she has woven, between 4 and 5 scarves and hats, as well. She is always looking in magazines and on the Internet for new designs to weave. This business has been profitable for her because she has customers that place a high value on her work. Her years of experience have helped her to make lovely knits, and for that reason, she would like her works to be exported to other counties. This is her seventh credit with MFP. She is very responsible with her payments, and in addition, she considers that this contribution will be very useful in the progress of her business. The credit she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale wool and wool in a variety of colors and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool in a variety of colors and quality.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 39 years old. Jaime is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Jaime owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Jaime has been engaged in his business for over 4 years.

Jaime joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jaime has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Jaime from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
El señor José es un hombre trabajador, padre de familia de seis hijos, tiene la edad de 56 años, y para el no ha sido fácil poder apoyar  a su familia, pero hace lo posible para lograr que estén bien, su negocio es la venta de ropa, y utensilios de plásticos el cual lleva varios años en las ventas. Negocio que inicio con fondos propios de ahorros de su trabajo en los Estados Unidos.

Con este préstamo comprara: ropa para dama, caballero y utensilios de de cocina de plástico ya que tiene poco inventario, es por eso requiere liquidez de dinero para lograr aumentar su comercio y proseguir con sus ventas. El cual ha logrado estabilidad en su negocio mediante el equilibrio a través de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
José is the hard working father of six children. He is 56 years old and it has not been easy for him to support his family, but he does what her can to make sure that they are well. He sells clothing and plastic utensils and has been doing this for several years. He started this business with the money he earned from working in the United States. He will use the money from this loan to buy women’s and men’s clothing, and plastic kitchen utensils, because his inventory is low at the moment. He needs this working capital in order to be able to increase his inventory and continue his sales. He has been able to stabilize his business with the help of past loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en: Bahrom A. is engaged in the farming business. He tills a piece of land that he inherited from his parents. Because of his farm, it is easy now for him to feed and clothe his family. Bahrom says, "I am the head of the family, I need to work better for the future of my children.” Bahrom needs a loan of 7,500 Somoni. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm. The loan will truly give Bahrom a better yield so that he can continue to support the needs of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena D. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Nena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Nena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilian Akinyi

texts.en:
Lilian Akinyi is 28 years old, married, and a happy mother of three children. Previously she owned a tailoring business, but due to increasing family size she realized that the income was very meager and could not adequately sustain her family's needs. 

In the year 2000 she started a retail shop in Nyamasaria so as to widen her income base, a venture she describes as very rewarding. Her quest to expand it has been met with inadequate capital, and that is why she has applied for loan worth 30,000 KES through K-MET, in liaison with KIVA lenders, to enable her to expand her business. 

Her future goal is to own a wholesale shop and be able to provide her children with a better education.  She lives in Nyamasaria and normally purchases her stock every three days at Kibuye market.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El Sr. L. S. Rodrigo de 44 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus pequeños hijos. Tiene casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en Lujaraja perteneciente al del distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como auxiliar de campo en una empresa agrícola. Su esposa es obrera eventual, pero mayormente trabaja en su negocio de internet que tienen en su domicilio. El Sr. Rodrigo es una persona muy emprendedora que gracias a su empeño a logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Rodrigo esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
44-year-old L. S. Rodrigo lives with his wife and small children. He owns his own home, which is located in Lujaraja in the district of Santiago. He works as a field assistant in an agriculture company. His wife is a temporary laborer, but principally works in her internet business that she has at home. Mr. Rodrigo is an enterprising person that, thanks to his effort, has managed to construct part of their home. He needs the loan to finish building their home. His dream, as he tells it, is to finish constructing this home in order to have a better quality of life. Mr. Rodrigo is very thankful for the support that we can offer him through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat C., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. C. sells groceries for an income of USD 1.50 per day. Her husband is a cameraman, earning an income of USD 2 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban vive en anticrético cuyo domicilio está ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz en la zona de Pasankeri. Tiene  dos hijos y su esposa realiza bordados de trajes de baile. Esteban trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa como chofer propietario. Está es su principal fuente de ingresos. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de un motor y caja de cambios para reparar su vehículo. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Esteban lives in a rented home located in the city of La Paz in the Pasankeri neighborhood. He has 2 children and his wife works embroidering dance outfits. Esteban works in public transportation as a driver. He has his own vehicle and drives on routes organized by the Eduardo Avaroa union. This is his main source of income. With the loan, he will buy a motor and a gear box to repair his vehicle. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motor

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen G. is from the village of Bavra in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is the proud father of a 4-year-old daughter and a 2-year-old son. Shahen and his wife have been engaged in raising cattle for the past 15 years.  Shahen also financially supports his brother’s family.  

Shahen is looking for a loan to purchase calves and feed.  According to his business plan, the proceeds from the loan should increase the family income by 20%.  Shahen dreams of saving enough money for his children to attend college and purchasing a tractor for the family business.  He considers himself fortunate to live in the clean environment of Bavra, close to extended family and friends.  Shahen looks forward to continuing his business in the place of his birth.

loans.use: purchasing calves and feed

loans.name: Twuzuzanye Group

texts.fr: Deogratias AG., un des membres du groupe Twuzuzanye ces membres sont tous commerçants, il est mariée, il a 26 ans. Son niveau d’étude est tronc commun secondaire, il a 1 enfant de deux ans et demi. Il est commerçant avec experience dans ce domaine de 4ans. Deogratias et son groupe s’organisent pour augmenter leur force financière, et valoriser leur business. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business quant à lui c’est pour acheter l’huile, savons, sucre,... le profit venant de leur commerce une partie est réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et une autre est épargnée afin de préparer pour le bon futur des familles.
texts.en: Deogratias AG. is a member of the Twuzuzanye group composed of entrepreneurs, is married and 26 years of age. He has finished the general academic part of secondary  school cycle. He has a child 2.5 years old. He is an entrepreneur with four years of experience. Deogratias and his group join their forces to strengthen their financial capital and grow their business. The group has taken out [one] loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to restock goods needed in their business—in Deogratias’ case, this means oil, soap, sugar etc. A part of the profit is reinvested in order to maintain financial stability of the group and the other is put away in savings in order to plan for a better future for their families.

loans.use: Purchasing oil, soap, sugar etc to retail in his store

loans.name: Yaa Kwaa Gladys

texts.en:
Yaa Kwaa Gladys M. sells 'Fante kenkey' (fermented corn dough, a staple food) and serves it with fried fish and pepper sauce at Abura. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa has been in this trade for some time now. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be added to her initial capital to help her expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop to sell provisions.

She has displayed to the left of her table with a few "Fante kenkey"s for sale.

loans.use: add to her initial capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the pottery capital of Antique, Bari, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is 36 years old, a widow and the mother of three children. Her eldest child is 15 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. They are all students.

Like other mothers she is always hoping for the betterment of her children and the whole family. When she became a widow, she had difficulty in providing for the needs of the family, but she is the kind of mother who does not give up, especially in providing the needs of her children.

Because of her personality and abilities, she was elected as center chief of Bari center 6 of the ASHI Antique Southeast Branch. As a member, she maintains her good performance because she believes that a leader must be a good follower.

She earns an income through buying and selling pottery. The income that she earns from this business really helps her to sustain the basic needs of her family, especially the educational expenses of her children.

For her next loan, she wishes to apply for 25,000 PHP. This amount will be used as additional capital in her pottery business.

Her greatest dream is that all of her children will finish their studies so that they can get a better job. She also dreams of getting a bigger income out of this business so they can own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: To buy more pottery to sell

loans.name: Pedro Toribio

texts.es:
Pedro de 45 años, vende cangrejos en un mercado. Vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 9, 8 años  en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Comenzó con las ventas de cangrejos como vendedor ambulante frente a un Banco con dos sacos de cangrejos, después de un tiempo le dieron la oportunidad de tener un puesto fijo donde se comercializa mucho mariscos desde ese tiempo ya tiene 13 años en el puesto vendiendo cangrejos a los compradores. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Diariamente comprar 25 a 30 planchas de cangrejos  (en cada plancha viene 24 cangrejos) para venderlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cangrejos para tener mayores ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener más clientela y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old and sells crabs in a market. He lives with his wife and 4 children - 12, 10, 9 and 8 years old in a district called Playas, one of the tourist spots in Ecuador with a diversity of seafood.

He began selling crabs door to door outside a bank with 2 sacks of crabs. After a time he was given the opportunity to have a fixed stall where he sold a lot of seafood. Pedro has had this stand for 13 years, selling crabs to the buyers. He works from 7am until 7pm every day. He purchases 25 to 30 sacks of crabs each day (there are 24 crabs in each bag) to sell.

With this loan Pedro wants to purchase crabs to generate better earnings. In the future he wants to have more customers and wants his children to finish studying with success.

loans.use: Purchase crabs

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa G. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Elisa sells fish like sardines, mackerel and milk fish caught by her husband. She also makes and sells Filipino snacks like buchi, siakoy, waffle and biko. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used as working capital and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, es una madre de familia dedicada, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. El negocio al que se dedica Rosa, es la venta de accesorios de ferretería, ofreciendo este servicio de manera delivery.  Es así que siempre esta en constante actividad, entregando los pedidos y realizando los cobros progresivos de los créditos que da a sus clientes, quienes aún confían en su negocio, a pesar que en un inicio fracasó su comercio de ferretería cuando lo ejercía en su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la comunicación que tiene con sus clientes, además le resulta muy rentable. Es así, con el pasar del tiempo, vende accesorios de ferretería de acuerdo a lo que le piden, exceptuando los materiales de construcción. Su mayor anhelo, es volver a reaperturar su negocio y de esa manera llevar un vida más sosegada. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar a tiempo sus cuotas  para acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más mercaderías entre brocas, clavos, enchufes, entre otras herramientas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, is a devoted mother living in her own house with her husband and daughter.  Rosa’s business is selling hardware accessories that she home delivers.  She is in constant activity this way delivering orders and collecting progressive payments from her customers who trust her business despite her having failed when she installed a hardware store in her home.  What she enjoys most about the work is the communication she has with her customers.  Besides it’s quite profitable.

This is how with the passage of time she’s been selling hardware accessories according to orders she gets excepting major building materials and supplies.  Her greatest hope is to reopen her business in order to have a more calm existence.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and knows that she has to pay on time in order to access future loans.

She will use the loan to increase stock merchandise like: drill bits and electrical plugs, among other things.

loans.use: To buy more tools and accessories to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44  ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et d’amitié, elles font le commerce de tissus et de condiments tels la pâte d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                          
MAH K. compte acheter quelques sacs de 100Kg d’arachide au marché de Barouéli, après transformation en pâte d’arachide, elle vend au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Tiessiri are all married and average 44 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in Barouéli City, Barouéli prefecture, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship and friendship. They do commerce in cloth and in condiments, such as peanut butter. The group members are now on their sixth solidarity loan.  

Ms. MAH K. intends to use her loan to buy a few 100-kg sacks of peanuts at the Barouéli market. She will then process them into peanut butter. She accepts cash or credit in her sales to a customer base composed essentially of women.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying peanuts

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov K. is 20 years old and lives with her young child and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife, stays at home and cooks for her family members. Her husband works at a rubber plantation, and typically makes US $4 per day. To earn more money, Pov is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a plot of land to grow yams. (Pov K. is pictured with her husband and her young child.)

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Phork N., 63, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish in the river next to his house. He catches around eight kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. 

He has no life partner because he was divorced from his wife years ago. He has eight children, four of whom are single and working in various jobs, while the other four are married and live independently. 

Mr. Phork N. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, hooks, and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, hooks and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La sra. Estela P. de 35 años de edad está casada hace 17 años con el señor Ever Cristaldo de 39 años, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 17 y 8 años respectivamente, el primero terminará este año su secundaria y el otro va empezar el tercer grado.
La señora Estela empezó el negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo, quien se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, con eso compró ropas usadas y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.
La señora quiere que su negocio crezca cada día  y con el crédito aumentará sus ingresos para que el día de mañana pueda hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria y que  en el futuro sean unas personas de bien.
Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pantalón, short, zapatos, blusas, conjunto para criaturas, camisa, remeras, zapatillas y materia prima para su marido que está en el rubro de carpintería y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela P., 35 years old, has been married for 17 years to Ever Cristaldo, 39 years old. This marriage has produced two children who are 17 and 8 years old. The first will finish high school this year, and the other is going to start third grade.

Estela started her business five years ago with a little bit of money that her husband gave her. He builds furniture. With the money she bought used clothing, and over time she turned this into a clothing business.

She wants her business to grow each day, and with this loan she will increase her revenue so that someday she can pay for her children to go to college and be successful people.

She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as slacks, shorts, shoes, blouses, children's outfits, shirts, t-shirts, and sneakers, as well as materials for her husband who does carpentry so that she can offer a variety of items to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's jeans, shorts, shoes, blouses, children's outfits, shirts, t-shirts, underclothes, sneakers, and perfumes.

loans.name: Deth's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Deth is the leader of this group loan. She has been selected by five members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to  improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Deth was born in 1962. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Young, is a construction worker. They have two children who are seamstresses in garment factories.

Currently, she faces an obstacle because her roof is leaking. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Deth is requesting a loan to buy zinc to build a new roof.

loans.use: To buy zinc to build a new roof

loans.name: Chroeng

texts.en: Chroeng K. is a 50-year-old rice farmer who lives in the capital, Phnom Penh. She doesn’t have a life partner because her husband died of senility, many years ago. Chroeng K. is blessed with four children who are no longer in school. To help support the family’s needs, two of her kids work in construction, while another one is employed in a garment factory. Chroeng K. has a plot of farmland, located away from the watering system. For this reason, she cannot irrigate her crops easily. In order to deal with this problem, Chroeng K. is requesting for a loan to purchase a machine that she can use to pump the water for her crops. She will also buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop to grow well. She hopes to use the remainder of the funds to buy a sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine and a few sacks of fertilizers for her crop growing well.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia en una comunidad rural en el distrito de La Matanza, en el norte de Perú. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos menores. Este préstamo permitirá que Alejandro trabaje más tranquilo  sin  tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento tanto comercial como familiar. 

Alejandro es muy trabajador y responsable. Es cliente recurrente  para Edpyme Alternativa y ha cumplido con sus otras obligaciones de manera puntual. Es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home with his family in a rural community in the District of La Matanza in northern Peru. He has been raising small animals for two years. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, he offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where he lives.

Alejandro is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN to help pay the school expenses of his young children. This loan will enable him to work more peacefully without having to resort to informal lenders who charge very high rates that would impact his daily liquidity and slow the growth of both his business and his family.

Alejandro is very hardworking and responsible. He is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa and has fulfilled his other obligations in a timely manner. This father is devoted to his family and always looking after their welfare and development. The people who know him have great respect and affection for him. His greatest wish is to continue working so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To pay the school expenses of his young children.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sangaré est une femme mariée de 30 ans et mère d’un enfant. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire, avec son enfant chez son époux dans le  quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni.
Pendant des années elle fréquenta l’école coranique, qu’elle abandonna suite à la pauvreté de ses parents. Afin de s'insérer  dans la vie active, elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique qu’elle a appris auprès de son petit frère. Avec une expérience de 2 ans, elle maîtrise son activité et est très sollicitée.
Fatoumata, qui est à son premier prêt, intègre le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa belle mère. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter d’importante quantité de marchandises pour sa boutique. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Bougouni, et effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Sangaré is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She lives in a nuclear family with her child at her husband’s place in the Dougounina district of the city of Bougouni. For years she attended Koran school but dropped out when her parents were stricken by poverty. In order to join the working world, she became interested in revenue-generating work, especially the buying and selling of various shop goods. She learned this business from her younger brother. With two years of experience, she is mastering her business and is much in demand.

Fatoumata, who is on her first loan, joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso through her mother-in-law. She intends to use her loan to buy a major quantity of merchandise for her shop. She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Bougouni. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a diverse and varied customer base.

With this loan, she plans on making a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA. With the profits, she envisions expanding her shop.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items for her shop

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 39 years old. She has six children who are between the ages of 3 and 16 years old. They are all in school. Epiphanie sells sorghum on a wholesale scale. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her family and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make more profits in order to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy sorghum.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years-old. Jenny is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling bananas, coconuts and fire wood in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jenny joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
