HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts.

location.town: Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a talented 49-year-old mother. Mariam and her husband Waleed still have three young children to support. Waleed works in shoe business, but that is not enough for them. Mariam started a small business five years ago making wooden and metA. masterpieces using her talent, creativity, and her ability to do so. She bought all the tools and equipment that she needed and began to create her first artistic piece.

At first she decorated her house with those pieces so when people visited they would ask about them and then ask her to make one for them. That’s how she started. Now she has been running her business for five years, but it is still in a small area at home.  Now Mariam has applied for a loan to rent a workspace and shop outside of her home so she can grow her customer base and sell more crafts.

Since Mariam is a conservative person, her husband Waleed agreed to appear in the picture with some of her work behind him.

loans.use: To rent a workshop to make her crafts more accessible to her customers.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 35 years old. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have been running a small cafe selling beverages and food to people in the local community since 2004. They have requested a loan to buy furniture and a variety of different foods for the cafe in order to attract more customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture and stock for her cafe

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 44 years old and he lives in Aknaghbyur village of Tavush area.  Rashid lives with his mother and his brother’s family. 
Rashid and his family engage in cattle and chicken breeding, beekeeping and land cultivation. Rashid’s mother is retiree, but she also helps her sons with their farming. Thanks to profit from their occupation they solve their family’s needs.
Rashid asks for a 700.000 AMD loan to improve his harvesting process and will use the funds to buy a fuel for his harvesting machine, to pay for mowed hay transportation from field to his farm, and also to pay a rent to village administration for a plot of land, because hay from his own field doesn't enough for his farm animals, as well as to buy 3 or 4 bee families.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for harvesting machine, to pay a rent for a plot of land, and to buy 3 or 4 bee families.

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan is the leader of her borrowing group. Eight years ago she opened a kiosk, where she started to sell foodstuffs and detergents. Her monthly profit is 7,000 soms. 

Uulkan is 45 and married to an electrician, whose monthly salary is 12,000 soms. She and her husband have three children -- two sons and a daughter. The family lives in Tamchi, a small village near Isykul Lake. The first son makes money by renting parasols on a local beach, the second son is a student, their daughter helps Uulkan in running the family business.

Uulkan applied for this loan because she needs more money to buy foodstuffs for her kiosk, with the hopes of increasing her turnover and sales at the kiosk. In the future Uulkan hopes she might earn enough to open a grocery store of her own.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to sell at a kiosk

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La  Sra. Elsa es D. la ciudad D. Santani, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada con el Sr. Eleuterio D. 49 años D. edad, tienen 2 Hijos, todos mayores D. edad, los cuales trabajan D. forma independiente.
Se dedica a la venta ambulante D. Artículos D. Mercerías, comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le genera un buen ingreso. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Por medio del trabajo que ella hace ha logrado mantener a sus hijos y D. paso ayuda a su marido en los gastos D. la casa. Dice que su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sigan una carrera universitaria y se vuelvan buenos profesionales.
El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra D. artículos D. mercería, como ser cubiertos, ropas, souvenires y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Elsa is from Santaní.  She’s 46 years old and is married to Eleuterio, 49.  They have two children who are both adults and work independently.

She is a general merchandise vendor.  She comments that she has a well formed clientele which generates a good income.  She defines herself as a very hard working, enterprising woman.  Through her work she’s managed to support her children and along the way has helped her husband cover household expenses.  She says that her greatest wish is that her children study university careers and become good professionals.

She is asking for the loan to buy general merchandise like: cutlery, clothes, souvenirs, etc.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Te, 58, is a farmer. With her husband, their income is $2 per day. The couple have two children, one of whom works in a factory for $2 per day. Each month, Te has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a cow for feeding with the plan to sell its baby. In the future, she wants to feed chickens and pigs at home because it is an easy career from which she would be able to make a good income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for feeding with the intention to sell its baby.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos D. 24 y 28 años D. edad, ella trabaja en la Universidad desD. hace 14 años, con un horario D. 7:00am a 6:00pm, uno D. sus hijos  estudia en la Universidad, por el momento inicia un nuevo ciclo D. estudio, doña Ana, no tiene la solvencia económica para pagar la inscripción, por lo que a través D. un préstamo pretenD. pagar no solo la inscripción, sino que todo el ciclo D. estudio.
Esto ayudara para apoyar a su hijo y que este pueda cursar las materias indicadas, sin tener atrasos, logrando avanzar en su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and has two children, ages 24 and 28.  She has been working at the University for 14 years.  Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  

One of her children currently attends the University and is starting a new period of studies.  Ana does not have the financial solvency to pay for the enrollment.  She intends to use the loan to not only pay for enrollment, but to also pay for the entire course of studies.

This will help support her son so that he is able to take the subjects listed without have any delays.  That way he will move forward in his professional career.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
La señora  Bonifacia   tiene  treinta y tres años de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de ropa  desde hace siete años y a  la venta de cosméticos desde hace tres años  con su esposo , Rolando   tiene la edad de  cuarenta años quien se dedica  mas a la tienda de ropa.
Es una  señora muy trabajadora  le gusta  ayudar  a su esposo  en lo necesario  cuando  ella  
No tiene tanto trabajo  con los cosméticos y la ropa  le ayuda a su esposo en una tienda de  abarrotes que tienen en su casa .
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  una  mujer  Michel y dos varones Cristopher  y Rolando.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar  más  mercancía para su tienda mas ropa ya que en  ocasiones sus clientes  le piden ropa por  mayoreo  y no cuenta  con los recursos necesario para  hacer el pedido.
Esta muy contenta  con su negocio  cada día gana más clientes  tanto en la ropa  como en cosméticos.
Uno de sus sueños  es hacer su tienda de ropa mas grande para  ofrecer un mejor servicio  a s sus  clientes.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is 33 years old. She has been selling clothing for seven years and cosmetics for three years along with her husband, Rolando. He is 40 years old and he mostly sells the clothing.

She is a very hardworking woman and she likes to help her husband with things when she isn’t too busy with the cosmetics and clothing. She helps her husband with a small grocery store they have in their house.

She requested the loan to buy more merchandise for her store, more clothing, because sometimes her customers ask her for wholesale quantities of clothing and she doesn’t have the resources necessary to fill those requests. She is very happy with her business. Each day she gains more customers, both for the clothing and the cosmetics. One of her dreams is to have a larger clothing store so she can offer improved service to her customers.

She thanks the Fundación Realidad for the support it gives to people to want to have their own business and get ahead in order to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2001. He works independently on his farm. His work consists of purchasing cattle, feeding them and reselling them to cattle farms, butcheries etc. He is the only income provider of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more cattle for his farm. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for his farm

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
San Sebastian se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, desde el año 2010, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la Señora Julia contactó con la asesora para pedirle una reunion para el nuevo grupo que estaban conformando en el barrio, logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Julia, es quien se encarga de la parte financiera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, y otros. Mediante esto ella logra tener los ingresos necesarios para mantener a todo su familia. Comenta que lleva un tiempo en esto por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, remeras, y otros, para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da a su microempresa.
texts.en:
San Sebastian is the name of this excellent group of women.  The group was founded in the city of Ita in 2010, thanks to the current Finance Director, Señora Julia.  She contacted the counselor to ask to set up a new group which was put together in the neighborhood.  She managed to bring together 17 women who find themselves enjoying their work.  They are in their third lending cycle, and are united and committed to each other through the program.

Señora Julia is in charge of the financial affairs of the group.  She works selling all types of clothing, such as trousers, shirts, T-shirts and other things.  Through this she has been able earn the income necessary to support her whole family.  She comments that it has taken a while, but she has a well defined customer base.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of trousers, shirts, T-Shirts and other things for later sale.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it is giving to her micro-business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, T-shirts, and other things for later sale.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 33, married, and has two school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to generate income for the sake of their children. They aim to continue sending their children [to school] as they want them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. They work hard and endure hardships to attain their goals. 

Due to financial difficulties, Aileen is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help her to increase their product offerings and income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru: Сергею нужно закупить партию товара, так как он расширил свой бизнес и сейчас у него две торговых точки. Он поставил свего сына менеджером в отдел сумок в торговом центре в Новомосковске, а сам возобновил торговлю на рынке. Получив кредит Сергей планирует поехать на оптовый рынок в Одессу на своем Фолькваген КАДИ белого цвета, который он использует как для бизнеса, так и для семьи. Вместе со своей женой Еленой Сергей проживают в частном доме в пригороде. Вместе с ними живут их дети и внуки.
texts.en: Sergey needs to buy another inventory of merchandise because he expanded his business and now has two retail outlets.  He put his son in charge of the purses department in a Novomoskovsk wholesale center and resumed sales at a market.  Having received this loan, Sergey plans to go to a wholesale market in Odessa in his white Volkswagen Kadi, which he uses for his business and family.  Together with his wife Yelena, Sergey lives in a private house in a suburb.  Their children and grandchildren live with them as well.

loans.use: to purchase purses, backpacks and suitcases

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a married woman with four school aged children.  Her husband is a contractor, and financially they both help meet the family's basic needs. 

She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Florah has operated a grocery store for the past five years.  She is also a farmer.  Clients are local residents.  Florah says her major challenge is theft of goods.  She hopes to expand her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more vegetables for her grocery store.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her grocery.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. He is 51 years old, and he and his wife Margaret have four children who are all going to school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In future, Joshua hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a 41-year-old housewife who has seven sons and daughters. Two years ago, she opened an extended room from her house as a small food market to help her husband to support their large family. With the profits that she made during those two years, she was able to enhance her food market by adding more shelves and more food products.
Now Kefa wants to apply for a loan to buy new types of food products that she was not able to buy before.

loans.use: to buy new types of food products for her store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 59-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. Carmelita works hard to improve her business and support her family financially. She has applied for a loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Carmelita hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes to help send her nieces and nephews to school.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает  пятерых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Назгул начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 12,000 сом (KGS).   
Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков на откорм. Доходы Назгул планирует вложить в постройку нового удобного сарая для скота, и в будущем – в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nazgul is 35 years old, married and is raising five children.  In search of a source for financial support for her family, she started her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock ten years ago, using an initial sum of 12,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent work, Nazgul's business currently yields about 8,000 som per month from sale of milk and meat products.  In order to further grow her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls for fattening up.  Nazgul plans to invest the profits from this loan into building a new, comfortable barn for the livestock, and, in the future, further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in Kitale and she has 5 solid years of experience in farming. She currently produces vegetables and onions for the local market. Grace works as a food vendor in the local market and her food is sold mainly at construction sites in the local town.

Grace has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and  insure a dairy cow. She says this will improve her farming income and enable her to take better care of her children's basic needs, especially their education. She hopes to scale up her farming business; however, she says that farmers are facing a great challenge occasioned by animal diseases and poor infrastructure.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine aged 36 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 12 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers of maize and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers of maize and pay workers.

loans.name: Mohigul

texts.en: Mohigul is married.  She has two children. They are schoolboys. They are studying very well. Her husband works with her and helps her in farming business. Mohigul grows different kind of vegetables. She is thankful for MDO “Imon international” for their support in previous loan cycle. She wants to buy seeds and fertilizers for new season. She wants to enlarge her business.  She wants to get a good harvest and a good income. She is asking for a loan of 9500 with this aim. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for new season

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Glorious Fashion Home is owned by Miss Gifty A.. She is a fashion designer who also sells items such as earrings, ribbons, slippers, polyester materials etc. She lacks sewing machines and other equipment like scissors, threads, needles in her shop. She also has lots of customers. The lack of these machines cause delay in meeting the demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $775.00 from Kiva. Miss Gifty A. is a very hardworking lady and can pay back this loan.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 49 years old and a widow catering for the needs 4 children at various levels of education. She has been selling used clothes and bedding (bed spreads)for the past 6 years to maintain her family.

Gradually the business has grown over the years resulting in higher stocks. Her current need is to secure a structure (shop) in which the items would be safe from rain and theives.

As a beneficiary of the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN, she intends to use the KIVA loan to acquire a secured shop to sell her wares.

loans.use: Acquire a Structure[shop]

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: G. Antoinette a 44-year-old dynamic and ambitious woman. She has 4 children and lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in north of Abidjan. G. Antoinette sells salt and various aromatic products in the Yopougon-Selmer open market. Antoinette's third child will start grammar school in September and she wants to be able to pay the school fees. She wants to sieze a good business opportunity that consists of wholesale selling of aromatic products to a cooperative of tradeswomen near her market.

loans.use: Gbeyo Antoinette will use the loan to purchase a stock of aromatic products

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum S. is 50 years old and works as a seamstress in Phnom Penh, earning $1/day.  She lives with her husband, a bodyguard, who earns $4/day, and their 5 children.  Mrs. Soum S. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to help her business, and also to help the family cut down on transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
MARIA Mary Magdalene X., 34, began selling drinks and snack foods in her store called "Paola" after coming to the realization that her husband's income was not sufficient to support their growing family. Slowly but surely the word got around and the customers started to come. Now her corner store is firmly established but it is not quite enough to make ends meet so in the afternoons she sells sweet drinks made of corn called atol and also lunch food called tostados. She works hard from early morning to late at night caring for her family, preparing the food for the day and running the two businesses. She is one busy person.

Maria also cares for her oldest daughter (age 15), who suffers from cerebral palsy resulting in mental and physical disability as well as speech problems. The daughter no longer receives treatment at the Fundabien Institution so the burden falls on Maria's shoulders Sometime she gets depressed and feels overwhelmed. But she has 6 other children that need her love and care, so she carries on the best she can. Her dream is to make sure the rest of the children get an education so they can get a good start in life. So she tends the store in the morning and sells her prepared food in the afternoon and cares for her family. Every day is a struggle; but, for the sake of her family, she fights on knowing someday things will get better.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the store

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicita belongs to Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 75 years old and has 6 kids, her husband works at a sawmill, but his health is very bad, so Felicita decided to open a small place to sell typical food with her first loan from Manuela Ramos.

Currently she has a small space in the corner of her hose to sell food that she prepares (juanes, patarashca, smoked fish, and tacacho with steak). Every day she wakes up very early to take care of the household and from 5pm on she attends the business until mid night.

With the new loan of $/.2,500 ($833 approx.), which will be paid in 6 months, she will build a small ceiling so she won’t have difficulties when it rains, she will also buy 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, a bunch of plantains, 3 kilos of fish and 1 sack of charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.



La señora Felicita pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. B. Leguia 1098 del A. H. Nuevo Paraiso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero, pero su salud es delicada, es así que Felicita, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto de venta de comida regional. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño espacio en la esquina de su casa para vender la comida que prepara (juanes, patarashca, pescado ahumado y tacacho con cecina). Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender los quehaceres de la casa y a partir de las 5.00 pm atiende el negocio hasta la media noche. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, armará un pequeño techo para no tener dificultades cuando llueve, además comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, un racimo de plátanos, 3 kilos de pescado y 1 saco de carbón. Felicita esta muy contenta de tener este negocio por que así puede atender a su familia en las mañanas y en las noches vender su comida para generar ingreso para los gastos de la casa.

loans.use: To install ceilings and buy supplies.Instalación de calaminas (techo).  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Elimeness

texts.en:
This is Elimeness T., commonly known as Mama Joshua (in reference to her 1-year-old son, Joshua). In 2005 she established a business selling both Western clothing and African batik clothing. Mama Joshua now needs a loan of $450 to expand her colourful and interesting range. The business enables her to assist her husband Alpha to support their son, as well as Alpha’s daughter, Evelini, 12.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of Western and African clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nabweru South East 2036(I) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year and five months. Sarah is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells fresh foods in the market. She wants to start up a retail shop alongside her current business. Both Julian and Proscovia own beauty salons and they want to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the current business

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Hortencia is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Ricardo Palma #383, Calleria distric, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old and is a mother of 3 children; one of them is still a dependent. She is married and her husband is a machine operator. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the buying and selling of soft drinks. Currently she continues with the sale of cold drinks such as sodas and ice; she also sells carbon. She gets up early to prepare breakfast and at the same time lend her attention to her small business with much care and dedication. She will use the loan of $516 USD to buy 5 boxes of soft drinks, 5 bushels of carbon, and 2 boxes of beer. The loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Hortencia says everything is doing very well in her business since her first loan. She is also very grateful for the support provided to her by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 394, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años, es madre de 3 hijos y uno de ellos depende aún de ella, es casada y su esposo es operador de máquinas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la compra y venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, hielo, también vende carbón. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la atención de su pequeño negocio con mucho esmero y dedicación. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 cajas de gaseosas, 5 sacos de carbón, 2 cajas de cerveza. Hortencia nos dice que desde su primer préstamo todo le está saliendo muy bien en su negocio y también está muy agradecida por el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, carbon and beer.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 54 years old and is married with five grown children. Juliana owns a small food store, which she opened in 2000. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $15 from her sales.
She would like a loan of $150 to buy more food items to stock in her store.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her small grocery store

loans.name: Mwanahija

texts.en:
Mwanahija is 25 years old and is a singe woman with 1 child, who is 8 years old. Mwanahija is a fish seller, she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Tursunbibi

texts.en:
N. Tursunbibi is 54 years old. She is married, and she has 5 children. Tursunbibi sells clothing and shoes for kids in the local market. Her husband and elder sons help her with the business, which she has operated for the past 10 years. The goods she sells are purchased in the neighboring town, which is situated 100 km away from her town. As is the case with any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need, and her dream is for all of her children to receive higher education. 
Because there is always a strong demand for kids' clothing regardless of the season of the year, Tursunbibi's business is rather stable and generates a sufficient amount of income to support her large family. Currently Tursunbibi needs to increase her working capital in order to purchase new children's shoes for her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to be paid back over a 6-month term. Tursunbibi thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be promptly repay this loan.

loans.use: To increase her business' working capital in order to purchase additional kids' shoes

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng N. is a villager in Trapaing Ankrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a 48 year old mother of three children, one of whom is a white wine maker, while another is attending school. She owns a pig breeding business, but she does not have enough money to build a piggery during rainy season. She would like to ask for a loan to build it and use the rest of the money to buy more food to feed her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Chev Pheun, is a laborer in the local village. Previously, Mrs. Neng N. obtained a loan to buy pig food. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To build a piggery and buy more food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 28 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a hair designer for men. The low income generated by his business doesn't support Ahmad's dreams to drastically improve the living conditions of his family. However, he believes he can make a better life for his parents, brother and sisters by undertaking small steps. He now needs a loan of US$1,000 to make some house improvements including painting and sanitary work.

This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
For two years, Hilda has been dedicated to selling clothing and general merchandise by taking orders. She used to work as an employee in a flower shop. This is how Hilda started to deliver her flower arrangements that her neighbors ordered from her. They started to ask her for other products, and this is why she was motivated to dedicate herself to selling by taking orders.

She has used the loans she has requested to purchase the products that her customers order from her.

Hilda would like to have a stand in a market to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 2 años, Hilda se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos en general por pedidos. Antes ella trabajaba como empleada en una tienda de arreglos florales. Fue así que Hilda llevaba a repartir por su casa los arreglos que le encargaban sus vecinos. Ellos le empezaron a pedir otros productos y de esta manera se animó a dedicarse a la venta por pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos que le piden.

Hilda quisiera tener un puesto en el mercado y vender ropa.

loans.use: To purchase the products she sells by taking orders

loans.name: Siloe Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama SILOE, lo integramos tres personas las cuales somos: Dunia Y. que soy la cordinadora del grupo, tengo 31 años de edad cuento con un negocio de produccion y venta de tortillas y charamuscas, negocio que me ayuda a colaborarle a mi esposo para los gastos de nuestro hogar. Mis compañeras Lidia M. tiene 57 años de edad las cual se dedica a la venta de agua purificada, ya que nuestra colonia no tiene proyectos de agua, la otra compañera es Guillermina P. de 38 años de edad y cuenta con un negocio de zapatos el cual le ayuda a solventar varios problemas economicos en su hogar, tenemos mas de 10 años de conocernos y de trabajar juntos. 
es necesario solicitar una ayuda monetaria para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios, por tal razon necesitamos que nos den una mano para poder salir adelante y asi poder sobrevivir en nuestro pais que en estos momentos la situacion esta muy dificil, . gracias
texts.en:
Hello! Our group is called SILOE, it includes three people who are: Dunia Y., myself who is the coordinator of the group, I am 31 years old and have a business making and selling toritllas and desserts. This business has helped me collaborate with my husband to cover household costs. My companions are Lidia M., who is 57 and sells purified water, since out village does not have a water project; and Guillermina P., who is 38 years old and has a shoemaking business which helps her resolve various economic issues in her home. We have know each other and worked together more than 10 years. It is necessary for us to obtain a loan in order to be able to move forward with our businesses. For this reason, we need for you to give us a hand in order to push ahead and be able to survive in our country that is currently in a very difficult situation. Thank you!


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of merchandise and raw material to make prepared foods.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is a 38-year-old mother of four children who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband by taking care of their school-aged children. 

Beatrice has been operating a seamstress shop for the past seven years. She trains seven young ladies in sewing to equip them with her skills and experience for their future careers. She sews all types of female clothing in various styles, such as kaba and slit, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more sewing material and supplies, such as linen, thread, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children. 

Beatrice belongs to the Somui Se Trust Group. In this community group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material and supplies

loans.name: Kosar Khadim Hussain Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of K. H. and resides in the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn is famous among travelers for its holy places and tombs. Kosar baji owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 40 years. Kosar baji’s husband is a property dealer. She is the mother of six children: four daughters and two sons. Her four youngest children don’t currently have employment. Her eldest two daughters help her embroider dresses that she sells in a boutique. She has been in the clothing business for the past six years, and she is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, cloth, and colored thread) to increase her output and business profits.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wholesale candies to sell. Kalsoom Mai baji wants a loan to buy thread to knit clothing to sell. Khurhseed baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell, and Mukhtayar baji wants a loan to buy video cassettes to sell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en:
Besides his profession as a teacher, Leopold D. sells groundnuts, beans, rice, green grams, and peas, among other cereals, in a retail shop he runs in Kizinda trading center. Married with 6 children between the ages of 13 and 27, Leopold works tirelessly to ensure his family’s needs are meet. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of cereals, especially rice and groundnuts, to increase stock in this business which he has successfully been operating over a period of 8 years.

Opening up a private modern primary school is one of his great ambitions, as he plans on retirement from the government service.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cereals, especially rice and groundnuts

loans.name: Irshad Bashir Maish Group

texts.en:
Irshad Baji is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives in Kot Radha Kishan about a half hour away from Kasur, in Pakistan. She has no formal education because her parents couldn’t afford her tuition. Her husband, B. M., is a mason. They have two sons, who are also masons. Irshad Baji embroiders clothes at home. This activity gives her a good income, and she is happy to invest her income in her house. She is asking for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, which would help her embroider more dresses in less time.

She is the leader of a group of women who are also seeking loans. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy fabric for her clothing business. Zuhra Baji and Sugran Baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their dairy businesses. Hamidan Baji wants a loan to stock her grocery shop.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Claudia Esperanza

texts.es:
Claudia Esperanza S. Martínez tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Claudia no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida labora como carpintero y trabaja en un taller familiar, sus propósitos son mejorar sus condiciones económicas ya que este es el único medio de trabajo que le ha proporcionado lo necesario sus deseos son de establecer un salón de belleza con todas las condiciones adecuadas para que sus clientes estén satisfechos por el servicio brindado sus sueños son impartir clases de estética a personas con escasos recursos que no pueden optar por una carrera profesional y también en sus sueños esta concebir una hija para trasmitirles sus conocimientos como Madre y como una profesional en la materia de la estética.

Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y los servicios de estilista a domicilio, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Doña Claudia inicia esta actividad después de obtener los conocimientos de estilismo en el salón de una amiga, sintiendo la necesidad de echar a la practica los conocimientos adquiridos y surge la idea de realizar este tipo de actividad a domicilio en las casas de sus amigas que requerían del servicio, posteriormente una amiga da la familia que posee un local aledaño al mercado La Estación le brinda la oportunidad de trabajar con ella en este salón y esto da la muestra para  darse a conocer con otro tipo de clientes dedicándose en lleno a llevar a cabo las metas propuestas es así que Doña Claudia no es solo una microempresaria mas, si no una profesional que contribuye en la satisfacción y el buen gusto de muchas personas que gustan de conservar un porte agradable y siendo además un contribuyente mas del sustento diario de su hogar, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que su uso será para la compra de productos de bellezas para aprovechar la temporada escolar y de verano ya que necesita realizar las compras de diferentes pinturas para ofrecer una amplia variedad de servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia Esperanza S. Martínez is 39 years old and married without children. Her husband works as a carpenter in his own workshop-- his goals are to improve the family's financial situation through his work, as it is the only way he has been able to provide for his wife. Claudia would like to open a beauty salon with all of the necessary amenities to satisfy her clients. She additionally dreams of offering beauty-technician classes to those with limited resources who would otherwise not be able to pursue the career professionally. Also, Claudia would like to have a child with whom to share her life and professional experiences. Claudia sells cosmetic products and her services as a beauty technician. Her business is a traveling one, as she sells her products door-to-door and visits her clients at their homes. Claudia began this business 12 years ago after learning the trade of beauty technician. She began by visiting her clients at their homes, and later when offered the opportunity to work in a salon owned by a family friend she worked there as well. Working at the salon exposed Claudia to a greater flow of clients. Claudia is not only a micoentrepreneur, but also a professional who contributes to the satisfaction and happiness of others. She also contributes to supporting her family. The loan that she is requesting is to finance an investment in her inventory of beauty products so that she can have a wider variety of colors to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell

loans.name: Tae

texts.en:
Tae P., 46, is married with 7 children. She has 5 years of experience in the sewing and cattle businesses. She sells to the public 6 days per week. Her husband does all the farming work.

Tae has 4 previous loans with Kiva partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Tae’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used to purchase equipment for her sewing business and part will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her sewing business

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид Муйдинов  1966 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Он 9 лет как ухаживает за скотом. Но основная его деятельность  это транспортировка грузов по регионам. Животноводство приносит большой доход , но надо долго ждать , когда скот вырастит , только тогда его надо продавать. Поэтому Абдурашид  стал водителем  грузовой машины и развозит фрукты овощи и другие грузы. Он стал сотрудничать с Микроинвест несколько дней назад. Если условия позволят расширять его  бизнес он будет кредитоваться и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Abdurashid M., born in 1966, has a wife and three children. He has been raising animals for 9 years, but his primary work is transporting cargo between regions. Animal husbandry produces a good income, but there is a long wait for the animal to grow to marketable size. Because of that Abdurashid became a truck driver and started carrying fruits, vegetables and other freight. He began to work with Microinvest a few days ago. If conditions allow him to expand his business he will continue to request loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel L. is one of the hard-working farmers who contributes to food productivity in her village. She has grown rice since she was just four years old. Her parents taught her about farming and how to have a good yield. Rocel cares for her family and especially for her seven children. Her husband is also a farmer. Both of them know the entire process of planting and growing rice, because they both came from the same village. 

Rocel is asking for a loan of $225 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fertilizer to improve the soil of their farm. "Harvest depends on the type of soil you have," she said. "Fertilizers are one way to achieve a better yield," she added. 

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to sustain their livelihood. They give all their clients training and insurance coverage in addition to credit.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando tiene 36 años de edad, por más de 13 años vive con la madre de sus 5 hijos. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas en terrenos alquilados ubicados de 35 a 40 minutos de su casa en carro, pero los días que no ingresan los autos, camina de 90 a 100 minutos hasta llegar a su chacra. Para Armando, tanto la siembra de plátanos, como de café, son igual de rentables, porque la producción del primero le genera ingresos cada 15 días, mientras que el otro es una vez al año, pero acumula muy buenas ganancias que al dividirlas entre 12 meses resulta igual de ingresos que los plátanos. Por ello, estos dos cultivos son indispensables en sus chacras y se dedica a abonarlos y quitar las malezas las veces que requiera. Armando se siente muy motivado porque tiene una esposa muy trabajadora que lo apoya en cada uno de sus labores; y sus planes a futuro son de sembrar alternadamente diversos productos, hasta convertirse en latifundistas, para que sus hijos puedan tener y contar con todos los bienes necesarios, en aras de mejorar su calidad de vida. Armando es una persona muy inquieta y bromista con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP donde viene trabajando responsablemente con cada uno de sus obligaciones. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a limpiar cada uno de sus cultivos, que por cada cuadra, cobran entre 350 a 400 soles.
texts.en:
Armando is 36 years old and has lived with his common law wife for the past 13 years. They have 5 children together. Since he was young he has worked in agriculture, working on rented land that is located 35-40 minutes driving distance from his home. On days that cars cannot pass through, he walks 90 or 100 minutes to get to his fields. For Armando, raising both bananas and coffee are both profitable, because the production of the bananas generates income every 15 days, while coffee gives a profit once a year. His coffee crop provides enough earnings that when he divides it out over 12 months, it ends up giving the same profit as his bananas. Because of this, these two crops are indispensable for his fields and he works hard to fertilize them and protect them from harm. Armando is very motivated because he has a wife who is also very hardworking, who supports him in his work. His plans for the future are to alternate planting different crops and to eventually become landowners, so his children can count on having what they need, and to improve their quality of life. Armando is a restless person and likes to joke around with the other members of his community bank. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he has been responsible with all of his commitments. The loan money will be used to clean his fields, because for each block he is charged 350-400 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cleaning up his fields

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Leonora es casada, tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Leonora tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual D. sus hijos.
Leonora necesita un préstamo D. 2100 dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Leonora son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the Microfinance Institute called Amaquella, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua.

Leonora is a 49-year-old married mother of 4. She has her own store in a rented business space in which she sells groceries, which she does every day with the temporary help of her children.

Leonora needs a 2,100.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

Leonora dreams of providing her children with an education and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La venta de verduras es un negocio que requiere de mucha inversión porque los productos son perecederos y por tal razón se debe de estar rotando el almacén de dichos productos. 

En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Karla H. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras ubicándose en un establecimiento propio donde a diario vende sus productos a sus clientes.
Ha llegado a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para comprar las verduras y así continuar ofreciéndolas en su negocio en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua.
texts.en:
Vegetable sales is a business that requires a lot of investment because the products are perishable. For this reason, one must rotate the inventory of products. In the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua, Karla Hernandez sells vegetables to customers everyday from her own stall. She has come to Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a loan to buy vegetables so that she can continue offering them at her business in Managua’s Wholesale Market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Massandjie's Group

texts.en:
Massandjie, a single mother of three, has owned her own beauty salon since 1999. She learned how to braid hair from family members in Africa and later went to school to obtain formal training. Her work has inspired many of her younger family members to pursue the profession. 

She was successful with a small loan through ACCION USA to build her credit, and is now using a new loan to purchase more inventory. She specializes in hair braiding and extensions and plans to use her loan from ACCION USA to purchase more human and synthetic hair at wholesale, which she will sell to other salons for a higher profit.

Business is going well overall; there are expected ups and downs but Massandjie always perseveres. Like many entrepreneurs she works very hard and is always trying to grow and expand her business. She would even like to open a second location.

loans.use: Purchase human and synthetic hair for extensions

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona R. tiene la edad de 48 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos y ambos estudian y laboran con ella. La actividad económica de Lucia es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente vendía cosméticos, pero no pudo seguir con este negocio por que algunos clientes no le daban los pagos de sus productos, pero por ayuda de una amiga que le conseguía ropa de manera favorable le propone que ofrezca ropa a sus clientes. Con el dinero que solicita será invertido en capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva como camisas para niños, faldas, shorts, pantalones entre otras cosas. Su deseo es tener un negocio estable para proporcionarle estabilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia Ramona R. is 48 years old, married, and has two children who both study and help their mother. Lucia has made a living selling clothing for more than 20 years. She used to sell cosmetics, but had to give that business up because clients didn’t always pay for the products they bought. A friend of hers helped her start her current business buy helping her find clothing to sell. The money requested will be used for working capital to buy new clothing such as: children’s shirts, skirts, shorts, pants and other items. She would like her business to be stable so she can offer her children stability.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan B. is from the village of Yahong,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In January 2008, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Susan is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rashida Muhammad Maqbool Group

texts.en:
My name is Rashida, and I am 45 years old. I have been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 15 years. I am an uneducated lady because my parents couldn’t send me to school due to the conservative environment of the community. I was married to M. M., but he died because of an accident 4 years ago. I was very much attached to him and it was difficult to stay strong. But I made myself strong for my kids.

I operate a sewing business to run my house, and my elder son is a rickshaw driver and helps me with the finances. Now my second son wants to be a driver like his elder brother. I have successfully completed a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy another auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle) for my second son.

This loan consists of 3 additional people: Amna wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Zainab wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell. Sharifan wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Rashida is seated second from the left in this photo.

loans.use: To buy another auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Dumaa

texts.en:
Dumaa B. is 56 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Kharkorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her sons are all well educated, with the youngest currently attending university and the older two having already graduated. Her older sons currently work in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city, as engineers.

Dumaa has been operating a felt production business in Kharkhorin since 2002. She produces a variety of felt products, such as slippers, bags, jackets, etc. She has improved her skills and gained much experience since starting, and her business has grown as 2-3 other producers have joined her.

Dumaa used profits from her business to build her family a warm and cozy winter home. Her future business goals are to introduce her handicraft products to as many customers as possible throughout her community and also target the many foreign people that visit during the tourist season. She is requesting an 840,000 tugrug (approx. $580 USD) loan to purchase wool-processing equipment, which is essential for her to improve her product's quality and make her production process more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase wool-processing equipment

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 52-year-old widow with eight children between the ages of 17 and 36 years. She sells goods from a shop. She has been in this business for the last 30 years.

Rebecca lives and works seven days a week in a semi-urban area. She rents a three-room house where she lives with some of her children. There is electricity but no piped water in her home. Her major monthly expense is food. The family gets three meals a day. Four of her children go to school.

The major challenges Rebecca faces in her business are transport costs and competition. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Rebecca has been with MCDT for 10 years working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock to be able to serve more customers. Rebecca hopes to see her business grow so she can build herself a house.

loans.use: To buy boxes of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia O. is from the village of Brgy. 26, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Lydia is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Lydia operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $63) a month for these activities.

In September 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa R. and her husband have four children, ages 25-35, all of whom are married and live on their own. Teresa's husband has been a fisherman for 20 years, while Teresa runs a general store as a way to provide a second income for her family. This loan will go towards the purchase of food and grains to sell, as well as cosmetics and other popular products. This isn’t the first loan that she has received; other loans have helped her to augment her inventory. With each loan, Teresa dreams of growing and improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre D. seis hijos, todos mayores D. edad,  se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y bebidas, pues tiene una bodega que funciona en su casa, su esposo trabaja con ella en esta bodega. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desD. hace seis años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra D. bebidas, tales como gaseosas, néctar y jugos. Ahora Susana necesita un crédito D. 2300 soles que le permitirá invertir en productos para su bodega como gaseosas, fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc.. La meta D. Susana es ampliar su negocio y seguir surtiendo para ofrecer mayores  productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 53 years old and the mother of six children, all of which are older. She is involved in the sale of groceries and beverages. She has a grocery store in her house, and her husband works with her in this store. Susana has been a part of the “Las Solteritas” communal bank for the past six years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in the purchase of beverages such as sodas, nectars, and juices.

Now, Susana needs a loan of 2300 PEN that will allow her to invest in products for her grocery store such as beverages, pasta, rice, sugar, oils, etc. Susana’s goal is to expand her business and to continue stocking to be able to offer more products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her grocery store such as sodas, pasta, rice, sugar, oils, etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married with four children and she is 36 years old. She is an energetic woman and puts in long hours selling to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her family members.

Patience sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira C. est une femme de 51 ans, elle mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle développe un commerce de poisson, de légumes et de savons. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité et les bénéfices lui permettront de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Sira C. is a 51 year old woman who is married and is the mother of 8 children. She is expanding a business selling fish, vegetables and soaps. This loan will help her to strengthen her business and the profits will allow her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her revenue generating activity

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Don Enrique M. comercializa ropa, zapatos, juguetes con una pequeña tienda que tiene en un mercado llamado Roberto Huembes donde puede encontrar lo que necesita. Al comienzo trabajaba de fontanero luego nació la necesidad de poner su propio negocio. Lo cual lo hizo con su propio dinero pero luego iba creciendo  la demanda de venta de ropa lo cual iba dando su negocio poco a paco comenzó a surtirla lo cual podía apoyar a sus cuatro hijos con los estudios, durantes años ha logrado estabilizarse pero en los últimos meses las ventas han bajado lo que gasta mas que lo que vende es por eso quiere invertir en otros producto que le genere mejores ventas como cosméticos, perfumenes, billeteras y mas ropa para la temporada de navidad ya que sale nueva moda y los padres queremos agradar a nuestros hijos en la compra de juguetes lo cual espera poder superar la crisis. Y Salir adelante en su venta. Da las gracias Afodenic por apoyar al pequeño comerciante que solo mediante los créditos se puede superar la economía.
texts.en:
Enrique M. sells clothing, shoes, and toys in a small shop he has in a market called Roberto Huembes where you can find whatever you need. He used to work as a plumber but decided to start his own business. He started by investing his own money but demand for his wares started to grow and he was able to increase his stock little by little. With his earnings he supported his four children providing for their education. As time has gone by he has managed to break even but in the last few months sales have dropped to the extent that his expenses are more than his earnings. For this reason he needs to diversify his products and invest in something that will be more profitable like cosmetics, perfumes, billfolds, and more clothing for the Christmas season since new styles come out then and parents want to please their children buying them toys; he hopes to overcome the economic crisis this way and come out ahead in his sales. He thanks Afodenic for helping small businessmen that can only survive in this economy with the help of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing, wallets, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is sixty-years-old. She is married and has six children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Aba is a trader. She trades in printed fabrics. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for four years and wishes to give her business a facelift. She therefore wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabrics in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna I. is married with three children. She is 40 years-old. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She is a fashion designer and she makes lovely designs for her customers. She also sells colorful sarongs and kerosene in gallons.  She has been in this business for a long time. Anna says she hopes to transform her fashion business into a high class fashion house in order to get more customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase more kerosene and tailoring materials. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and kerosene

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky, 32, is living in Norala, South Cotabato. She’s married to Efril and has three children. She has a rice field, which is her family's source of income. She started her business in August 2007.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to buy farm supplies and fertilizers necessary for the farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es:
Yngrid es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Yngrid es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Ingrid vende ropa variada que reparte a amigos y familiares, además junto a su esposo tiene 2 carros que realizan transporte a la provincia de Vilcas.
Ingrid necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Ingrid sueña con comprar mas carros y construir su departamento.
texts.en:
Yngrid, 24, is a member of the Florecer communal bank. Yngrid lives with her life partner and their son. Yngrid sells assorted clothing among her friends and relatives. In addition, together with her husband, she has two autos with which they provide transportation services in Vilcas province. Yngrid needs 1200 soles to buy assorted clothing. Yngrid dreams with buying more cars and to build her apartment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel B.  C., tiene la edad de 58 años, está casado, y tiene 5 hijos que  son mayor prioridad. Ellos tiene 30,26,25,22 y 10 años. Vive con su esposa y con el hijo menor.El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche . La idea es tener ganado con producción de leche para consumo propio y para venderla  en la comunidad y así maximizar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Daniel trabaja desde hace muchos años a la agricultura, pero sobre todo con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y sobre todo como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Daniel B. C. is 58, is married, and has 5 children, who are his biggest priority. They are 30, 26, 25, 22, and 10. He lives with his wife and his youngest son. He will use this loan to buy a milking cow. His idea is to have cattle that produce milk for his own consumption and to sell in the community so he can maximize his profits. This is the first loan he has had with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms they have offered him. Don Daniel has worked in agriculture for many years, but with cattle more than anything. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells groceries and drinks at the front of her house to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Elizabeth is married with three children and she is 36 years old. Her eldest child is 13 years old. All her children attend school and this gives her great joy. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 47 year-old married man living in western Kenya, near the town of Kisii. He has five children, ranging in age from 7 to 17 years old.  All of them currently attend school.

David has been running his farm for over twenty years.  He sells a wide variety of products at the local market including milk, cereals, chickens and eggs.  He also buys and sells cattle on occasion.  David says his main challenge is the lack of sufficient capital to take advantage of business opportunities.  He also noted fluctuating market prices for farm produce as a cause for concern.

David has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of Kes. 45,000 and Kes. 60,000.  He now requests a loan of Kes. 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow.  He says the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children, and will allow him to provide proper nutrition for his family. 

David has plans for expansion in the next five to 10 years.  His main goal is to acquire a pickup truck to transport his produce.  He also wants to use it to get cattle to and from the market.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ata

texts.en:
Ata T. is a young man from Nablus. In the picture above, he is shown in his shop. Ata started this business four years ago in the old city of Nablus. He sells CDs, records, DVDs, accessories and gift items, and he provides the service of burning CDs or DVDs of materials provided by his customers, such as research material or wedding party images.

Ata wanted to provide his customers with professional services, so he took a loan from FATEN in order to purchase a CD-cover printing machine. Ata hopes to increase his income and be able to expand and improve his business. His shop is in a very good location and he has a good number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase a printing machine

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es:
Henry de 44 años de edad es casado con la profesora Ginna Montiel con quien tiene un hijo de nombre Jerry de 16 años de edad el cual esta estudiando su primer año de la carrera Ingenieria en Sistemas. Henry trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC con el proposito de cercar su propiedad, pues tanto el y su esposa trabajan todo el dia y la casa permanece sola, entonces desean brindar mayor seguridad a la propiedad.  Pretende hacer los arranques con piedra cantera y el resto con malla, pues es un poco mas economico.  

El mayor deseo de Henry es poder tener su casa bonita, con las condiciones necesarias y brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Henry is 44 years old and is married to a teacher, Ginna Montiel. They have one son, Jerry, who is 16 years old and is in is first year of course work for Systems Engineering. Henry has been working for the mayor's office of Juigalpa for 1 year. He is requesting his 1st credit with AFODENIC for the purpose of fencing in his property. Both he and his wife work all day while the house is empty. They want more security for their property. He plans to start with quarried rock and then do the rest with mesh, which is a little less expensive. Henry's greatest desire to to have a nice home, with the proper conditions, and to offer his family more security.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fence in property

loans.name: Jonjib

texts.en: 28-year-old Jonjib P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has no children yet but plans to have one hopefully soon. Jonjib owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years now. In 2007, Jonjib joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jonjib is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his seventh from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sope Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE MOHAMED est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 13 femmes issues toutes du même village et âgées entre la trentaine et la soixantaine d'années. Elles sont mères d'au moins de 2 enfants. Le village héberge un grand marché hebdomadaire d'un renommé régional, ce qui favorise une bonne commercialisation de leurs produits. Cette circonstance a fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue à l'accroissement de l'économie dans le village et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses initiatives économiques et de diversifier ses activités commerciales.
