Leurs activités tournent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

La présidente du groupe, Madame Mbène S., à l’extrême droit de la photo en tenue blanche raillée de trais croisés en marron, est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont une fille de 14 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce depuis plus de 20 ans, elle vend divers produits culinaires sur table au marché du village et au jour de marché hebdomadaire, les lundis, elle en profite pour s’approvisionner en marchandises pour la semaine suivante. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra à renforcer sa capacité d’autofinancement. Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The SOPE MOHAMED group came into being six months ago and is composed of 13 women who all come from the same village and are between the ages of 30 and 60. They are mothers of at least two children each. The village is home to a big weekly market which is regionally known, and this allows them to sell their products easily. This circumstance permits commercial activities in the village to be permanent and contributes to the expansion of the economy of the village and that of the surrounding area. The new solidarity group loan will allow its members to bolster their economic initiatives and diversify their businesses. Their businesses mostly involve selling local cereals, seafood, peanuts, and ice cream, in the case of those who have refrigerators. The president of the group, Madame Mbène S., on the far right in the photo wearing a white and beige-striped dress, is 50, married, and the mother of four children, including one daughter of 14. She has been selling foodstuffs on the top of a table at the village marketplace for more than 20 years and on weekly market days (Mondays) she buys her inventory for the following week there. Her new loan will permit her to increase her working capital. With the profit she makes, she helps her husband support their family in terms of food and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her working capital

loans.name: Mma

texts.en: Mma H. cooks 'banku' (a local dish made from corn dough) and serves it with okra soup, palm nut and groundnut soup at Abura.  Mma has no educational background.  She is divorced and takes care of three children. She has been cooking 'banku' for sale for four years. She is responsible for the well-being of her children. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to prepare 'banku' and to sell raw to those who might want to buy it. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy extra bags of maize to prepare 'banku' or to sell raw

loans.name: Kosar Parveen

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen lives in Lahore Pakistan with her husband and five children. Her husband has been making pouches (small bags) and doing printing work for 13 years. Kosar assists him in his business by making pouches (small bags) and by staying at home. Her two elder children also help their parents in their business after they return from school.

Kosar wants to help her husband expand his business and so is requesting a loan from Asasah worth 80,000 PKRs to purchase the raw materials needed for pouches and printing.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for printing and for pouch-making (small bags) business

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon R. owns and operates a store buying and selling different kinds of vegetables in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Sharon has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Sharon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina María S. Agüero, tiene la edad de 32 años, está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la reparación de un Trapiche. La idea es comprar materiales para la reconstrucción del galerón para el trapiche. Con esto  se espera poder contar con una estructura donde puedan realizar los trabajos de  sacar el dulce. Cuenta con un trapiche donde realizan el proceso de sacar el dulce. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Reina  tiene algunos años dedicada a este negocio. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Reina María S. Agüero is 32 years old and single, with no children. She lives with her parents and siblings. She is requesting this loan to repair a sugar cane mill. She plans to buy materials to rebuild the mill shed. Once done she hopes to own a structure where to carry out the tasks required to extract the raw sugar. She already owns a sugar cane crusher to extract the raw sugar. This is the first time she requests a loan through FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the support received. Reina has been in this line of business for a few years. In future she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair sugar cane mill.

loans.name: Talvesuin Afghian Group

texts.en:
Khadeja is a member of Talvesuin Afghian group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, in a household of nine members.

Khadeja is tailor and sews all kinds of clothes. She needs the loan to purchase a sewing machine plus other essential materials such as different kinds and colors of thread, small and big sizes of scissors and so on. She is glad that though this loan process she can develop her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, different kinds and colors of thread, large and small scissors, etc.

loans.name: God With Us Group

texts.en:
David K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God With Us'.  He is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is seven years old. He was only able to attend school through eleventh grade due to financial constraints. 

For seven years, he has been selling used clothes on Mechlin Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. He describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is not married and lives with his parents. He uses his car to offer taxi services in his city and between neighboring cities as well. Suhrob has been in this business for 2 years. Using the phone to get client’s orders, he always has plenty of clients. This business is the main source of income for his family. 

Suhrob would like to borrow 1500 USD to fix his car engine and other parts. As he makes more profit, he hopes to improve his family’s living conditions. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new grinder machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more metallic material for welding

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry G. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old. Jerry is married and has three school-age children. 

Jerry owns a business which provides barber shop services to local community members. Jerry has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jerry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerry is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jerry from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to help improve his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino I. M. tiene de 58 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo que depende de el, los demas hijos viven en los estados unidos, Faustino se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tambien se dedica a destazar cerdos los fines de semana.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y tambien para comprar cerdos, se aproxima la navidad y la carne de cerdo es muy buscada por las personas para la cena de navidad.
tambien quiere tener surtida su pulperia porque es cuando las personas compran mas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Faustino I. M. is 58 years old, single, and has 1 son who depends on him.  The rest of his children are married.  Faustino dedicates himself to selling popular consumer goods, and has a grocery store in his home.  He also butchers pigs on weekends.  

The loan will be used to buy merchandise to better supply his business, and also to buy pigs.  Christmas is approaching, and pork is in high demand by people for their holiday meals.  

He would also like to supply his store, because customers purchase more items during this season.  He will use his profits to help himself and his son get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, rice, beans, sugar, lard, cornmeal, oil, margarine, soups, pastas, cereal, soaps, toilet paper, toothpaste, sanitary napkins, bread, cookies, churros, sardines, juices, dairy products, razors, condiments, salt.

loans.name: Dervina

texts.en:
Dervina P. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 37 years old. Dervina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dervina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap,  toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Dervina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dervina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dervina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dervina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & detergents. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Dervina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & detergents

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar ovejas en algunos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Elmer desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más ovejas y alimento balanceado de modo que la crianza de sus animales mejore y estos puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elmer, 26, is married living with his family in the Muy Finca sector of Mochumí district, a farming zone located in Lambayeque region.

He works in farming, especially raising small farm animals.  He tends to raise sheep in some corrals in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to come by the area where he lives.  The business is an important source of income for the family so he strives to keep it the best way possible.

Elmer wants to expand the business acquiring more sheep and nutritionally balanced feed so that their development will improve and they will be sold at a better price.

To reach this goal, therefore, he has seen fit to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy sheep and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su último hijo de 17 años en el caserío Pomape, una zona rural dedicada básicamente a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a labores de ganadería, ella cría vacas y aprovecha la leche que producen para venderla a un acopiador de la zona que provee de este producto a una empresa procesadora de lácteos, esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que trata de esforzarse para mantener el negocio. Para optimizar su producción ella suele alimentar a sus animales con pastos naturales que adquiere a los agricultores del lugar.

Santos desea adquirir alimento balanceado para ayudar a sus vacas a seguir mejorando la calidad de la leche que producen. Esta inversión es bastante importante para su negocio ya que en esta temporada los pastos y forrajes con los que usualmente alimenta a sus animales se ha vuelto escaso, por ello Santos ha querido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Santos ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa a través de Edpyme Alternativa y del producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad pudo adquirir alimento balanceado y complementó la alimentación que solía darle a sus animales. Ello la ayudó a obtener una buena producción y por eso se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Santos is a 60-year-old mother who lives with her husband  and youngest child, age 17, in the Pomape hamlet. Pomape is a rural zone dedicated mainly to agricultural labour and located in the Monsefú district, known on the national level for its tourist and religious festivities. It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked in livestock from a very young age. She raises cows and sells the milk that they produce to a local collector who provides this product to a milk processing company. This is an important source of income for her family, so she tries to work hard to maintain the business. In order to optimize her production, she normally feeds her animals natural grass that she acquires from the local farmers. Santos wants to acquire balanced food to help her cows continue to improve the quality of their milk. This investment is very important for her business, since in this season the grass and fodder that she normally feeds them is scarce. Thus, Santos has decided to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will allow her to achieve her goal. Santos has already had a loan financed on Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and Capital Semilla. With that loan, she was able to acquire balanced food to complement the food that she normally gives her animals. It helped her to obtain a good production, an so she is very happy and grateful to the people who are working with her through Kiva.

loans.use: to acquire balanced food for her cows, to improve the quality of the milk that they produce.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in Multan, which is a big city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives here in the area of Samejabad with her family in a 2 room brick house. She came here 6 years ago with her family.
 
She is 34 years old, married to M. R., and has 6 children. Her elder son works in a hotel for a low income while the others stay at home and don’t do anything. Zarina couldn’t provide them education facilities due to financial constraints.
 
Her husband also works in a Punjabi food hotel. His income is not very satisfactory, and that’s why Zarina helps her family financially by operating an embroidery business. She started this business a few years ago. In Multan, this is a very common and demanding business because people from other cities come to buy embroidered dresses and other clothes from here due to their cheap rates and good quality. She collects orders from her neighborhood clients and finishes the orders on time to earn an income. She is very good at it and wants to expand her business on larger scale.  

That’s why she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches which help her to make the embroidered dresses in good quantity and in contact with different cloth shops and boutiques. 

She hopes that it will bring positive results for her business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Zarina”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: John Kimisik

texts.en:
John Kimisik R. is fifty years old, married and a father of four children.  His family lives in Cheplaskei in the outskirts of Eldoret Town, and John operates a butcher shop where he buys cows, slaughers, and sell the meat.  He has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be John's first loans from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy two cows, with the income he is going to get he wants to save and open another butcher in Eldoret town. 

In the future he wants to open a different kind of business and provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 1 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando. 

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos (comida típica de la zona) en el centro de la Ciudad, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Sus ventas las realiza diariamente  a partir de las 5:30pm. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.  
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.

Elenita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día, ya que con este negocio hizo profesionales a sus cinco hijos y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the "Noche de Luna II" (Moonlit Night II) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province.  Elena is 48 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children, one of whom is still dependent on her and in school.

Elena's fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead on her own resources helped her set up her own business selling kebabs (a typical local food) in the city center.  She has gradually become very well known amongst her customers and today she tells us that her business is doing very well.  She makes her sales every day from 5.30pm.  She has been in this line of business for several years and she feels very happy with what she does.

Elena will use this loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy supplies such as bag of rice, eggs and creole chickens for making 'juanes' (a traditional chicken and rice meal) and eviscerated chickens for making kebabs.  She will also buy cooking utensils so that she can provide a high-quality service to her customers.

Elenita, as she is affectionately known, feels very proud of the work that she does every day since, through her business, her five children have become professionals.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as bags of rice, eggs and creole chickens for making 'juanes'.  To buy eviscerated chickens for making kebabs.  To buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo is 54 years old and she is married to Mr. Kun. They have three children: One is a boat-taxi driver, one is a farmer, and the other is studying in local public school. 

Mrs. Keo is a Khmer cake maker, while her husband is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he can plant rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part he keeps to support his family. 

She wants to start a new business, so she needs capital to support it. To achieve this purpose, Mrs. Keo is asking for a loan to buy a mother pig for breeding. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide. 

Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Jay, who is 35 years old, works as a painter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 7 and 14 years old. Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy stock for her sari-sari (general) store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Analyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Choem M. is a 57-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. She always uses her own farmland to grow rice crops at least two times per year. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works drivinga  motortaxi in and around his community, Kompong Chhnang province. They are blessed with three children; two are students in the local school while one is employed as a sewing worker and has a formal salary. Choem M. will take her loan to pay for harvesting costs as she hired a few domestic laborers to assist her this time.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting costs as she hired a few domestic laborers to assist her

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Jeneba B. is a 41-year-old business woman.  She is also a widow with 3 children: 2 boys and a girl.  She has 1 additional dependent in her elderly mother. 

In 2005, Jeneba established a cosmetics and provisions business.   She is very determined to conscientiously improve her business. She opens her business 7 days a week from 8:30 am to 11:30pm. 

Jeneba needs a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy assorted cosmetics and provisions such as sugar, milk, sardines, butter, etc. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and provisions to resell

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa earns a living through farming. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns 3,000 PHP per month from her business. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Milagrosa is 45 years old and is a married woman. She has 3 children, the oldest of whom is 28 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Deen

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Deen. He is married and has three children, aged 14, 5, and 2 years. He has one additional dependent in his younger brother, who helps him in the business. 

In 1996, Deen established his pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics business. He began his business because he was unable to continue school; he started up a small-scale business that he has developed over this period. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,100,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000.000. Deen requires a loan in order to buy pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Deen plans to restructure his drug store to standard levels and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and toiletries for his business.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is 46 years old, a housewife as well as a business woman. She does clothes sewing and decorative embroidery at her home. She is very skillful in both of these arts and earns a reasonably good income from her skills. She is also a very good housewife and performs her routine tasks very well. 

Her husband is a driver. He drives a rickshaw and provides transport services to the passengers. Alia has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons started work at an early age. The eldest one operates a lathe machine while the second one is a motorbike mechanic. Alia’s other children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a rickshaw. He is currently driving a rented rickshaw which doesn’t allow him to drive in the evening. By purchasing his own rickshaw, he will be able to drive it without any time limitations and for longer routes also.  
He has been doing this business for the past 30 years and Alia is hopeful that an investment will help him make more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for her husband's transport business.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 37 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a driver. In 2009, she created a store to sell food and beverages in the local community. 

She plans to get a loan to partly invest capital in her business by purchasing more foods and beverages for resale and partly to use as school fees for their children. 

She and her husband hope that the loan will assist them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food and beverages for resale and to invest in the education of her children

loans.name: Yhayhannee

texts.en:
Yhayhannee is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Yhayhannee has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Yhayhannee is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Yhayhannee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Khariton

texts.ru:
26 летний Харитон проживает в городе Севане вместе с родителями, женой и ребенком. Отец Харитона не работает из-за состояния здоровья, мать Харитона преподает в школе, а жена находиться в декретном отпуске. 
Харитон окончил индустриально-технологический техникум и по профессии он бухгалтер. С 2008 года он работал дистрибьютором в частной фирме, а с февраля 2011 года он сам зарегистрировался как частный предприниматель. Харитон арендовал небольшой магазин и организовал в нем торговлю продовольственными товарами. Т.к. зарплата матери Харитона не велика, почти вся прибыль от магазина идет на содержание семьи.
Харитону необходим кредит на сумму 1,000,000 драм на покупку макаронных изделий, круп, кофе, чая, кондитерских изделий, соков и т.д. для своего магазина.
texts.en:
Khariton is twenty six years old and lives in the town of Sevan together with parents, his wife and child. Khariton's father does not work due to his health condition and Khariton's mother is a teacher in school. His wife is now on a leave of absence.

Khariton graduated from an industrial-technical college and is an accountant by profession. Since 2008 he has been working as a distributor in a private firm and since February of 2011 he had registered as a business owner. Khariton rented out a small store and organized selling of groceries. Because Khariton's salary is not big almost all the income from the business goes towards supporting the family.

Khariton needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to buy pasta products, cereals, coffee, tea, confections, juices and other items for his store.

loans.use: to buy pasta products, cereals, coffee, tea, confectionery, juices, and other items for his store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 27 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. She is separated from her husband and lives with her parents. Yolanda has two children aged seven and six. 

Yolanda is a person of strong character; she is very responsible, and is dedicated to her activities. Yolanda works selling "Yanbal", a cosmetics brand selling make-up, cologne, and perfumes. This is Yolanda’s first loan and she will use it to invest in "Yanbal" cosmetics. She believes her loan will help her with her income and with the well-being of her family. 

Yolanda’s future goal is to have her own "Yanbal" store. She also dreams that her children will get a better education than she did and that their education will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in "Yanbal" brand cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Libertad se localiza en un lugar que se caracteriza por ser montañoso con mucha vegetacion y arboles frutales como el aguacate, durazno etc.  está conformado por la señora Ana Bertha va a comprar con su crédito carnes frías, verduras, bolsas, la señora Alma Rosa va a comprar catálogos para vender lencería y cosméticos, la señora Mayra Nayeli va a comprar catálogos de temporada y zapatos, la señora Aleida va a comprar dulces,  la señora Leonor va a comprar un extractor, una sombrilla, naranjas, zanahorias, betabel para elaborar jugos. La señora Mayra Nayeli tiene 31 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo tienen 4 hijos tres mujeres y un hombre los dos más grandes estudian, ella vende zapatos por catalogo ella solicito su crédito para comprar los catálogos nuevos y zapatos de dama, caballero y niño para surtir sus pedidos, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años ella aprendió sola, su negocio es ambulante sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinas, amistades y familiares, este negocio es importante porque le ayuda en el ingreso económico a adquirir zapatos para sus hijos, ella recuerda que en una ocasión tuvo buenas ganancias y con eso pago las colegiaturas de sus hijos por eso está muy contenta con su trabajo, ella está planeando vender ropa por cataloga y ofrecer sus productos por tandas para que no se les haga pesado a sus clientes, ella se siente orgullosa de poder darles a sus clientes facilidades en los pagos de los zapatos y se siente feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque va a tener dinero para surtir sus pedidos y crecer su negocio. Las ganancias las distribuye en los gastos de la familia, para la escuela de sus hijos y otra parte para  volver a invertir, sus sueños y esperanzas son tener un local bien establecido donde tenga zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes y atender amablemente a los clientes mostrarles los catálogos y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos y que continúen con esta labor porque benefician a las familias a tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
This group is called “Libertad” (Liberty) and is located in a place that’s mountainous and has lots of vegetation and fruit trees like avocadoes, peaches, etc.  

It’s members are Ana Bertha who will use her loan to buy cold cuts, vegetables and bags; Alma Rosa, who will buy catalogues to sell lingerie and cosmetics; Mayra Nayeli, who will buy seasonal catalogues and shoe catalogues; Aleida, who will buy candy; Leonor, who will by a juicer, an umbrella, oranges, carrots and beets to make juice.

Mayra Nayeli is 31 years old.  She’s in a common law relationship and she and her husband have four children; three girls and one boy.  The two oldest are in school.  She sells shoes via catalogue.  She requested her loan to buy new catalogues and women’s, men’s and children’s shoes to fill her pending orders.  She started the business four years ago learning it on her own.  She’s a street vendor.  She goes out to offer her wares to neighbors, friends and family members.  

This business is important because it helps her earn income and acquire shoes for her children.  She recalls that on one occasion she had good profits and was able to pay her children’s school tuition; this is why she’s happy with her work.  She’s planning to sell clothes via catalogue and to sell on credit so that it won’t be so taxing on her customers.  She feels proud to be able to offer easy payment plans to her customers to pay for their shoes and she’s happy with this loan that she’s going to get because she’ll have money to fill her orders and help her business to grow.

She uses profits to pay family expenses, to pay for her children’s schooling and part of it to reinvest.  Her dreams and hopes are to have a well-established locale where she can have shoes to offer her customers and to take care of them kindly, to show them the catalogues and that her children have good educations.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thank for your loans and please continue with this labor because you benefit families to have their own business.”

loans.use: to buy catalogues and women's, men's and children's shoes to fill her orders.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 42 years old and married and with two children in school. For the past five years, he has run a photography business and he works as a cameraman. Previously, he earned a living as a farmer. He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to save his money.

Francis is requesting a 70,000 KES to buy cameras. In the future, he hopes to venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to buy camera

loans.name: Justa Rufina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Justa, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos,  tres mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años que estudia en el colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta que su esposo sale todos los días muy temprano a la ciudad de Portoviejo a proveerse de los mejores productos que encuentra en los mercados  mayoristas y también recorre los campos para comprar directamente a los agricultores, luego en su carro recorrer por toda la localidad y sitios cercanos vendiendo sus productos. Lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y con esto  han podido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda que le dan y así ella puede ayudar a su esposo en su negocio.
 
Su sueño  tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The 'María Auxiliadora' community bank meets in Sequita parish, in Montecristi.  This is a prosperous canton in Manabí which is full of hard-working, committed people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and devote themselves to their families.

Here we meet 43-year-old Justa who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are grown up but her youngest son is 17 years old and in high school.  All her children still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.

Our friend is requesting this loan for her husband's business selling fruit and vegetables.  She tells us that her husband goes out very early every morning to the city of Portoviejo to stock up with the best produce that is to be found in the wholesale markets.  He also travels through the countryside and buys directly from farmers.  He then travels through the town and nearby places selling his products.  He has been in this business for more than ten years and it has enabled him to get ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables.  Just has been a member of her community bank since it was created.  She likes the help that she receives which enables her to help her husband in his business.

Justa's dream is to own a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Irma vive en la comunidad de Pampa el Coscal distante a 40 km de el Torno, convive con el sr. Víctor  tiene 6 hijos ya grandes, ellos viven y trabajan  en su misma parcela, ellos se dedican a la agricultura, siembran maíz, sandia, etc. El crédito que ha solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y maíz y todo lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, toda la familia trabaja junta en la agricultura, todo lo que ellos siembran  la Sra. Irma lo sacan a vender al mercado de el torno, directamente del productor a l consumidor, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora, la Sra. Irma esta muy orgullosa de sus hijos ya que le ayudan en esta actividad muy sacrificada.
texts.en: Señora Irma lives in the community of Pampa el Coscal, 40 km from Torno.  She lives together with Víctor.  They have 6 children who are already grown. They live and work their own plot of land. They are dedicated to agriculture, growing corn, watermelon, etc.  The loan that she has requested is for sowing watermelon and corn and everything that is needed to prepare the land.  The whole family works together in agriculture.  Señora Irma takes everything that they sow to sell in the market of Torno directly from producer to consumer.  They are a hard-working and very united family.  Señora Irma is very proud of their children that they sacrifice to help her in this activity.

loans.use: to grow watermelons.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
The 45 year old mother, Huda, has 8 daughters and 1 son. Her husband has already retired. In order to support this big family, Huda has worked in many fields with her husband, such as private teacher (home schooling), selling blankets, olive oil cans and cheese, each by its season.

Besides all her previous endeavors, Huda has been working as a tailor for 6 years, now at her house. She has applied for a loan to buy more material that will help her increase her productivity so that she can open her own tailoring workshop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more material and fabric to increase her productivity so she can open her own tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Erdenesuh

texts.en:
Erdenesuh is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in an apartment in Suhbaatar province in Mongolia. His 9-year-old daughter is a student in elementary school and his 5-year-old son stays at home with his mother. 

Erdenesuh started his transportation business in 2000 using his own truck. Now he has a contract with the mining company and he is very well experienced in his business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that the mining industry is booming in Mongolia, my business is going very well and I have a very bright future for my business." He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy new engine to replace his old truck engine.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his truck.

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en: Bathuyag is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His two older kids are in school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. He started his photography business in 2001 with 100,000 MNT. He has built his assets to 1,000,000 MNT. His business has been profitable since 2001. Because of his old camera, his photography quality is poor. He is a creative and hardworking man who says, "I have a mission to become the province's largest photography studio owner." He is requesting 1,500,000 to buy a new camera and accessories.

loans.use: To buy a new camera and accessories.

loans.name: Shamsan

texts.en:
Shamsan is a 30-year-old man living in Sana'a. He is married and a father of two young children. He attended high school but could not study at the university because he didn't have anyone to support his studies.

Having worked in his friend's salon as a barber for a couple of years in order to feed his family, it was his dream to establish his own independent business (a Barber Shop) but due to financial challenges, he could not make his dream a reality. With income he collected from his past work in his friend's salon,  Shamsan started his independent business a year ago and called two of his friends to work with him. Currently he is in need of support to purchase beauty supplies that he needs in his salon.
 
Shamsan looked for financial support here and there but in vain. Finally, he was guided by one of his friends to apply for a loan from AMB. Shamsan visited one of AMB's branches recently opened in the street near his shop and took a loan of 80,000 Rials in order to purchase all the supplies needed for his salon.

In the future, Shamsan hopes to expand his business and attract new clients. He also hopes to open another salon on another street and make it possible for other free young people to work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Kamkata S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kamkata Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Getrude is the facilitator of the Kamkata SHG group. She takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Getrude had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Getrude was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Getrude and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Getrude will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Kamkata SHG group will each plant between half and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Gerges

texts.en:
Gerges is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. Two of the children are working, while two others are still attending school. Gerges is the main source of income in the family and he has big and serious responsibilities. 

Gerges has been working as a farmer for the past eleven years; he really loves farming and wishes to spend the rest of his life working on his land. Today, he needs to borrow $2000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a mini van, which will help him transport his products in the fastest way. In the future, he plans to work with high tech materials in order to grow up his land.

loans.use: to purchase a mini van.

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Кумри имеет троих детей, муж работает преподавателем в художественном колледже. Зарплата у мужа небольшая. Чтобы поддержать мужа и создать хорошие условия для воспитания детей она занимается купле продажей женской и детской одежды. У нее свои постоянные клиенты. Ее товар требуется большим спросом. Она хочет пополнить ассортимент товара с добавлением зимней одежды и праздничными детскими костюмами к Новому году. Она  хочет получить займ в размере 2000 долларов США для покупки товара. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие. Спасибо за оказанную помощь
texts.en: Kumri has three children and her husband works as an instructor in the art academy. Since her husband's salary is small, Kumri is helping him support the family by operating a clothing store. She sells clothes for women and children and has a number of regular clients, as her clothes are popular. Kumri would like to purchase additional garments for the winter season and children carnaval costumes for the upcoming New Year parties. She wants to take out a loan of 2000 US dollars to purchase these goods. Kumri is hoping for your support and charity. Thanks you for your help!

loans.use: To buy clothing for winter season

loans.name: Nicolas Nolberto

texts.es:
El señor Nicolas Nolberto es casado, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, inició este trabajo como trabajadora para otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo  de su esposa quien se dedica a la confección de tejidos.

solicita un prestamos que le servirá para la compra de hilos, de diferentes clases y colores para producir mas, espera en el futuro contar con un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicolas Nolberto is 36 years old, married, and completed six years of his primary school education. He has two children, one of whom is studying. Nicolas weaves traditional dresses. He started out working for another business and now has 20 years of experience. Nicolas has the support of his wife who also engages in weaving.

He is requesting a loan to buy thread of different types and colors so that he can produce more. In the future, he hopes to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy thread in different types and colors.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a 35 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes being sold. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes. Fridah's business goal is to run a boutique in her town area within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Efipania

texts.en:
Efipania is 61 years old and married. She is from Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She has 5 children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas farm. They been in raising bananas for 20 years and earns PHP 5,000 a month. 

In 2011, Efipania joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for weeding

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE est composé de trois personnes qui résident  dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Bénédicte (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31 ans a arrêté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Bénédicte est mariée a un entrepreneur du nom de Rémi. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bénédicte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Bénédicte vend des pommades, des pâtes alimentaires et des plastiques depuis cinq ans à son domicile. Bénédicte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Bénédicte ensemble avec les membres du groupe MISSIMIDE sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques, des savons et des conserves.

loans.name: Bellancille

texts.en:
Bellancille aged 41 years. She is married with 6 children aged between 5 and 19 year. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 27 year old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop as her main source of income and also practices crop farming to earn an extra income for her family.
She started the business with the proceeds from her farming business. Her business has grown and is worthy expansion so she now dreams of having a wholesale store though her capital is still not enough. 
Annet is requesting a loan to buy more stock like crates of soda, soap, sugar, rice and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like crates of soda, soap, sugar, rice and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spraying machine

loans.name: Hagigat

texts.en:
Hagigat is 49 years old and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan.  She has settled in the Khirdalan settlement.  She is now married with two children.

With a loan of $500 she bought a printing machine. Hagigat also rented a paper mill.  She requests a loan of $1000 to repair the paper mill.

loans.use: to repair a paper mill which she rents

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa O. is a dynamic 46-year-old woman. Yaa O. has 5 children and lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in north of Abidjan. Yaa O. sells aromatic products and palm oil in the Yopougon-Sicogi open market. She wants to purchase a stock of palm oil in bulk. Yaa O. got her first loan from AE&I  in December, 2004 and has always reimbursed her loans in a very good manner. Yaa is the main financial resource provider for her family as her retired husband does not have enough income to cover family expenses.

loans.use: Yaa Ouattara will use the loan to purchase aromatic products and palm oil.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mr. Phen C. is 59 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their two children. He works producing and selling brooms, a business that gives him $8 per day. His wife is a landlord, and can earn about $2/day. Mr. Phen would like this loan so he can buy bulks of grass that will eventually be made into brooms. His business is succesful now, and with access to this loan, he will be able to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: Phen would like to puchase bulks of grass to produce brooms to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: I am Nazia N. from Pakistan. My husband died a year and a half ago and since then I have been having a very hard time financially. I am the mother of three children and want to secure their future. Since my husband’s death, my mother has been helping me financially but she cannot be there forever. Therefore, I have started my own business selling wood for cooking fuel. Since I am selling from home, I am able to offer women in my neighborhood the convenience of buying wood at their doorstep. To continue this business and purchase more wood, I need a loan of around $175.  The income that this business will generate will help me to meet the  needs of me and my children.

loans.use: To buy wood for her business

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Maria Lucrecia is a single mother with three children, one of who is studying in a university and the other two of whom will soon be in school as well. She is a hard-working woman in search of the best for her children, as she wants to ensure that they have a future filled with good opportunities.

12 years ago, Lucrecia began her business in the Ivan Montenegro market with 3,000 Cordobas as her starting capital. She didn't have a place at the market and had to sell from a table and her inventory was small. Now she has her own spot in the market in good condition.

CEPRODEL has helped support Lucrecia. The help that it has given her has made it easier for her to purchase products and increase her working capital, which, in turn, allowed her to expand her business and increase her standard of living.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years now and has very good credit.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Lucrecia es madre soltera con tres hijos bajo su cargo, uno de ellos es estudiante de universidad y los otros dos se encuentran en el colegio aun. Ella ha sido una mujer luchadora en busca de lo mejor para sus hijos, tratando de que ellos tengan un futuro mejor y buenas oportunidades en la vida.

Hace 12 años Lucrecia inicio su negocio en el mercado Ivan Montenegro con un capital de C$3,000 (cordobas), no tenia un local sino que vendia en una mesa al detalle y su inventario era poco. Hoy en dia su local esta bien abastecido y presta buenas condiciones.

Para Lucreacia, CEPRODEL le ha servido de apoyo y ayuda ya que le ha brindado la facilidad de comprar productos y aumentar su capital de trabajo, mejorando asi sus condiciones de vida en conjunto con su negocio que prospera a un ritmo excelente.

Ella es clienta de CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y su record es de 6 creditos con una calificacion excelente.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
I need a loan of $350 for my husband’s woolen items business that includes blankets, rugs, and bed sheets. He is able to make a profit of $100 a month out of this business. Previously, we took out loans and invested in our business and hence managed to raise our income which enabled us to marry one of our sons. 
I am a mother of five: two sons and three daughters and live with my family in Lahore, a city with great history and traditions in Pakistan.

loans.use: Buy blankets for the winter season in bulk

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49 year-old man who lives and works in the region of Saida in south Lebanon. Ahmad is the father of 10 children.

In order to support himself and his family, he runs a grocery store. At this time, Ahman needs a loan to buy additional merchandise for his business. To increase his revenues, Ahmad also grows beans. This is the third time Ahmad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Mrs. Olga is part of the Second Friends Communal Bank, located at AA HH Sagrado Corazon de Jesus, Mz  G Lt, 2, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali.  She is 42 years old and has two children, although only one is dependant on her. She is married and her husband is a mechanic.  With the first loan that she recieved from Manuel Ramos, of 300 soles, she decided to invest in purchase and sales of second hand goods. 
Currently, she is committed to the sales and repairs of all types of goods. She gets up early in the morning to do her work around the house, and at the same time, she and her husband run their business. 
With a loan ot 2500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she plans to invest in the purchase of second hand goods, like radios, televisions, irons, etc... 
Olga is very calm and hs likes working with Manuela Ramos, as she feels that her needs are understood and a great help is provided to her family. 

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal De La Amistad 2, ubicado en el AA. HH. Sagrado Corazón de Jesús Mz. G Lt. 2, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años, es madre de 2 hijos, uno aún depende de ella, es casada  y su esposo es mecánico. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de artefactos de segunda. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta y reparación de todo tipo de artefactos. Se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a las labores del hogar y simultáneamente ella y su esposo atiende en el negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de artefactos de segunda, como radios, televisores, planchas, etc.

Olga se siente muy tranquila, le gusta trabajar con Manuela Ramos  porque siente que le entienden sus necesidades y es un gran apoyo para ella y su familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of used electrical goods
Compra de artefactos eléctricos de segunda mano

loans.name: Safarkul

texts.ru:
Safarkul B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 41 years old , married and has four children. He has secondary education. His is in agriculture and has his own piece of land where he cultivates wheat, flax and other crops. He sells the crops to wholesalers which use the wheat for flour. He keeps the smaller part of a yearly supply of wheat for his family's use. Because wheat is a very important dietary product it is in very high demand. This helps develop the business with full confidence and sow large areas of land with wheat. Safarkul has been in the agriculture for the past three years. He now needs financing for buying of seeds, fertilizer and ploughing (the use of fuel and renting of equipment). He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоеров Сафаркул проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 41 лет , женат, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием . Имеет участок земли , засеивает который пшеницей , льном и другими сельхоз культурами.Получаемый урожай продает оптовикам, которые используют пшеницу под муку. Меньшую часть пшеницы оставляет для своей семьи запасом на один год. Так как мука является важным продуктом питания у населения , она пользуется большим спросом. Это позволяет развивать данный бизнес и с уверенностью засеивать большие участки земли пшеницей. Занимается земледелием клиент около 3 лет.Клиент нуждается в дополнительном финансировании для покупки зерна, удобрений и для вспашки земли( топливо, аренда трактора) . Погасить кредит клиент плнирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam S. (pictured with his mother) and his wife got married in 2005. They have one daughter. Mr. Sam and his wife live with his mother who is a farmer and sells lotus flowers. Mr. Sam's father is a monk. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sam and his wife have been selling groceries for three years. They buy grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh for resale in front of their house. Beside of grocery store, the couple also has a lotus wholesale business in the village.

Sam is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items for resale

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie is 37 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a primary police officer whose income is insufficient to meet the family income needs. Abie supplements the family income by producing and selling Gara tie-dyed materials in the market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone.

Some of her children are preparing to go to college and Abie needs to work hard to generate income for their school requirements. She is therefore requesting a loan of $300 (Le.800,000) to increase her fabric production and also to diversify her business.

loans.use: To expand production of tie-dyed materials and to purchase 40 gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap P., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Mak, 33, who live along National Road Number Six, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1996 and have two children, one daughter, who is in school, and one son.

Mr. Sopheap has been an electrician in a factory since 1996, while Mrs. Kunthea used to be a garment factory worker for many years as well but now she has stopped for a while to take care of their little son. Currently, the couple lives with their parents and are in the process of building their own house (shown in the picture) and lack some money to finish it. So, Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$800 to add to his own money to finish his house.

loans.use: Sopheap would like to finish building their new house.

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Zangilan region, and he settled in Baku city. This man was born in 1977 and is single. He has run this business for 8 years. Now he needs a loan of $625 to improve his internet cafe.

loans.use: To improve his internet cafe

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old. She is a married with 7 children between 9 and 20. She has owned a small cafe since 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Rosa Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en Jr. 2 de Mayo Nº 634, distrito de San Fernando, departamento de Ucayali. Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, 3 hijos, su esposo es Profesor y tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal Manuela Ramos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad, Rosa, cuenta con un puesto de comida y golosinas en una Institución Educativa. También cuenta con una bodega en su propia casa y en la cual atiende con la ayuda de sus hijas y su esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de golosinas y alimentos de primera necesidad para que pueda cocinar sus deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos que vende en la Institución Educativa.

Rosa se siente realizada y a pesar de las muchas dificultades puede llevar adelante el negocio y así mismo puede darle estudios a sus hijos y tener una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa belongs to the Talented Women Communal Bank, located at 2 de Mayo Nº 634, district of San Fernando, in department of Ucayali. Rosa is 35 years old, she has 3 children and her husband is a Teacher. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for 4 years. With the first loan of $125, she decided to invest it in selling food.

At present, Rosa has a food and candy stand at an Educational Institution. She also has a grocery store at her own house that she runs with help of her daughters and her husband.

With this loan of $1025, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will use it to buy candies and essential foods, so she can cook her delicious breakfasts and lunches that she sells at the Educational Institution. Rose feels fulfilled and in spite of many difficulties she has been able to make her business work. She wants her children to go to school and have a better economic solvency.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candies and essential foods.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of A. L. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 10 years. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son has a garments business. Her daughter reads in the 7th standard grade. Zubaida baji's husband works in agriculture. Zubaida baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to expand her son's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy flour to make breads (Nan). Maryam baji wants a loan to buy garments to resell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy materials such ascooking oil, flour, and lentils for her food business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies for her sanitary business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more garments to resell

loans.name: Yom

texts.en: Mrs. Yom L. was born in 1952 and now lives in the Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Lunh Leng, have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another one works as a construction worker, while the other three are attending a local school. Mrs. Yom L. and her husband are both farmers who cultivate rice and vegetables on a plot of land that they own. With the combined revenue, however, they still cannot cover the family's basic expenses, especially now that one of their children is sick. Therefore, Mrs. Yom L. is asking for a loan to be able to buy medicine for her child.

loans.use: Purchase of medicine

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 37 años, es soltero, vive en al casa que sus padres le dejaron. Es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 4 años a la construcción, es albañil de profesión y ha trabajado en diversidad de obras, las cuales muestra orgulloso. A Raúl siempre le ha gustado construir, tiene todo un equipo a su mando con los cuales se encarga de construir por contrato casas, oficinas, etc.  Gracias a la experiencia que ha ganado es muy solicitado por las diferentes personas que requieren de sus servicios, quedando satisfechos con el acabado final. Lo más difícil es el tener que construir solamente con las herramientas básicas, teniendo que pasar algunos inconvenientes por este motivo. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar herramientas nuevas y más eficaces para la elaboración de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Raúl is 37 years old, single, and he lives in a house left to him by his parents. Hi is a hard working man who has worked in construction for 4 years as a bricklayer. He has completed a variety of projects and is very proud of his work. Raúl has always liked construction, he has a team of workers with whom he builds, on contract, houses, offices, etc. Thanks to this experience he is sought after by different people who require his services and they are satisfied with the final products. The most difficult thing about the work is having to build with only basic tools, and he has had to turn down some work because of this. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan he wants to buy new, more efficient masonry tools.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new masonry tools

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 36-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mhammad has sold fish since he was young. He is asking for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua  to purchase fish. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan. 
 
Mhammad expects that the loan will help him purchase more and better quality fish. He is respected by everyone  because of his honesty. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough capital, so he had to take a partner who wasn’t really helpful. He has been in this business since his childhood.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Desde que tenia diecisiete años, luego de haber estudiado corte y confección Rosa empezó a trabajar en una galería para otra persona. Una vez que se comprometió con su esposo y tuvo su primer hijo a la edad de veintiún años, empezó a ofrecer el servicio de confección y compostura de ropa.

Poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo mas clientes. No necesita ofrecer sus servicios de puerta en puerta pues ya la mayoría de personas por su casa la conoce. Ahora, el pequeño estudio donde atiende a sus clientes se ha convertido también en una tienda donde vende juguetes y también gaseosas y cerveza.

Gracias a su trabajo y al trabajo de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero en una imprenta, han podido comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
When she was 17 years old and learning to be a seamstress, Rosa started working in someone's shop. Then she got engaged to her husband and had her first child at the age of 21, when she started to offer tailoring services and clothing repair. Little by little, she started gaining more clients. She did not have to go door to door to solicit her services because she already knew most of the people. Now, her son studies where she does her business, where she also sells little toys, sodas, and beer. Thanks to her job and the work of her husband, who works at a printing press, they have been able to buy land and build their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for her job

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun S., 53, is a widowed farmer who lives with her daughter in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She earns about $3 per day. Her daughter works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh, making about $3 every day, and contributes to the family's income.

To make more money to help support her family, Hun S. has an idea to create another business. She is requesting a loan to purchase a horse and a cart to operate a transportation business.

loans.use: Purchase a horse and a cart to start a transportation service

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa A., une mariée de 30 ans et mère de trois enfants. Elle est une coiffeuse et exerce aussi le commerce de pagnes et de plastiques devant son atelier de coiffure. Cette activité est sa principale source de revenu. Elle habite Lomé la capitale togolaise.Elle exerce ses activités durant plus de cinq ans. Avec ce crédit de 600000fr, elle espère accroître  ses activités et son chiffre d’affaire
texts.en:
Yawa A. is a married woman, 30 years old, and the mother of three. She is a hairdresser, and she also does commerce in front of her salon selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and goods made of plastic. She lives in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been working in these fields for over five years. With this loan of 600,000 francs, she hopes to expand and to increase her sales figures.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hair extensions and cloth, to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is 26 years old. She is not married yet. For almost seven years, Umeda has owned a beauty salon. Everyday she services many brides. In general, she offers bride-dresses, manicures, pedicures, make-up and hairstyles. Her salon is always full of clients because she does her job professionally. She wants to take a loan to extend her business. She wants to buy additional equipment and goods for her beauty shop. Umeda likes her job very much, because she likes to see the smiles of happy brides every day.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the Fourth millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods for her beauty shop

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Flor es casada tiene 47 años dos hijos D. 26 y  14 años, este último está en la escuela  estatal.
Flor siempre se ha dedicado a la venta  D. productos D. belleza  por catalogo y ventas D. ropa por pedidos a crédito. 
Flor necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles, para la compra D. mercadería, maletas D. viajes para venderlas. 
DesD. que está en Finca, su capital ha aumentado, antes no podía cumplir con todos sus pedidos, ahora si,  pueD. compra vestidos D. fiesta que le piden, ha podido construir parte D. su casa, con sus ganancias.     
El sueño D. Flor es terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Flor is a partner of the community bank El Triunfo. Flor is married, is 47 years old and has two children aged 26 and 14 years, the latter being at state school. Flor has always sold beauty products through a catalogue and sold clothes on credit. Flor needs a loan of 2,400 Peruvian soles to buy merchandise and backpacks to sell. Since she has been with Finca her capital has increased, before she would not have been able to fulfil all of her orders but now she can, being able to buy party dresses that are ordered.
