She has been able to build part of her house with her income. Flor’s dream is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flor needs a loan of 2,400 Peruvian soles to buy backpacks to sell

loans.name: Katty

texts.es:
Katy es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Katy es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Katy tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, en donde también tiene 3 locutorios. Además Katy tiene 2 locutorios en lugares distintos en donde tiene 2 empleados.
Katy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Los sueños de Katy es mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio, una flota de taxi y sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Magnolia community bank. Katy, 27, is in a common law marriage and has 2 children. She rents a local space where she has a shop. She sells vegetables, groceries, and she also has 3 calling booths. Katy has 2 calling booths in different locations where she has 2 employees. Katy needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy beer. Katy’s dreams are to improve her business, have her own capital, have a taxi fleet, and that her children go to school and get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer

loans.name: Jonatan

texts.es: Jonatan tiene 20 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, es muy atento y preocupado, además, tiene muchas ganas de forjarse un buen futuro. Se dedica al tejido artesanal, actividad que aprendió desde muy niño de su padre, y es muy feliz realizando este trabajo, puesto que es una actividad que le trae muchos beneficios y con la cual ha podido pagar sus gastos. Jonatan disfruta mucho de trabajar en su máquina de tejer, donde con mucha dedicación coloca los ovillos de lana para la elaboración de sus diversas prendas. Lleva 7 años en esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y pueda tener más máquinas para aumentar su producción, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo, es tejer durante todo el día sin descanso, ya que si no lo hace su producción puede disminuir y sus ganancias bajarían. Jonatan sabe que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero está dispuesto a trabajar duro para mejorar su vida. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y está muy contento por la oportunidad, ya que piensa invertirlo bien, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre es muy respetuoso y responsable. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Jonatan is 20 years old, he is single and lives at home with his parents. He is very interested and involved, and he wants so much to forge a good future for himself. He is an artesan, having learned knitting as a small child from his father. He is very happy carrying out his work and it has brought him very many benefits, in addition to being able to cover his expenses. Jonatan enjoys sitting at his knitting machine, lovingly setting the spools of wool to create his diverse items of clothing. He has been working at his business for the past 7 years and he hopes that it will grow and later have more knitting machines to increase production. He says the most difficult part of his work is to have to knit an entire day without rest, something he is forced to do so that his production and earnings will not suffer. Jonatan knows his work is very difficult but he is ready to work hard to improve his life. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is very grateful for the opportunity. He plans to invest it the funds. The community bank to which he belongs has high regards for him, always being very respectful and responsible. With the two thousand five hundred neuvos soles he is requesting, he will purchase more wool to increase the quantities of items he creates.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 30 años, vive en su casa propia que hace poco tiempo terminó de construir con su esposo, tienen un solo hijo de nombre Javier. La actividad que realiza es la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, por lo que desde las 6.00am es posible encontrarla realizando la limpieza y arreglo de su local con mucho esmero, además de conversar con cada uno de sus clientes y vecinos que pasan por su bodega, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos genera ingresos para su hogar. Los 3 años que lleva en este negocio le han dado la experiencia y paciencia de cómo tratar a sus clientes, y espera en adelante incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece. Maritza considera que lo más dificultoso de su trabajo es cuando llega la fecha del vencimiento de algún producto que no terminó de vender, y esto le ocasionan pérdidas, pese a ello, aprecia mucho su negocio, y aunque no adquiere muchas ganancias por el momento, ya ha obtenido varias amistades con las que puede conversar, que es lo que más le gusta. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado tuvo voluntad de pago y nunca cayó en mora, debido a que ella previene con anticipación sus cuotas señaladas, asimismo, se siente muy feliz y a gusto con la organización de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de primera necesidad de su bodega
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 and lives in her own house that she and her husband recently finished building. She has only one son, Javier. She earns her living selling basic food items, so she can be seen at 6:00AM cleaning and fixing up her shop with great care. In addition, she talks with each and every customer and neighbor that passes through her grocery store, since she knows that it's thanks to them she can earn the income for her household. Maritza treats her customers with the experience and patience she has gained in her three years in this business. She hopes to increase her inventory in the future. The hardest part for Maritza is when a product has not been sold by its expiration date, resulting in losses that she regrets. She really appreciates her business, and even though she's not earning too much right now, she has made a number of friends to talk to, which is what pleases her most. This will be Maritza's second loan with MFP. With her last loan, she had the will to pay and prevented herself from ever falling behind by making payments in advance. She is very happy and comfortable with her village bank. She plans to use her loan to increase the number of basic food items in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. is a baker who bakes bread for distribution in Hohoe. Martha has been baking since 2004. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour and other ingredients to bake varieties of cookies to sell. 
Martha is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She has received a junior high school education. She is responsible for all the financial needs of the entire family. She hopes to save the new profit from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients for cookies

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane T. is a 38-year-old hard-working and devoted lady. She has four children and she cares for seven dependants. She has had a drug shop for 12 years. Her lending group has helped her learn how to stock more drugs for her shop. At the moment, Jane is able to make monthly profits of 140,000/= because of the quality drugs and her good reputation. She dreams of seeing all her children educated and this is why she works hard and ensures that she saves. Jane needs a loan to help purchase more drugs for her store. She is the member of Tusooka Kwavula group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Restocking her drug shop with more medicines.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
For the past two years Grace F. has been a member of Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), the first Grameen replicator in the Philippines that has given poor women the opportunity to discover their God-given skills in running a business by providing them with loans. Supported by her husband, a farmer, Grace took the opportunity in 2007 to borrow from the organization to start her rice production/planting business.

Although still small, the business has gone well for Grace and her husband, allowing them to frequently provide necessities for their children. Furthermore, Grace was able to pay back the loan on time, thereby qualifying for a larger loan from ASHI.

Happy to have been thus approved for a larger loan, Grace will use the funds to enhance her rice production business. Fortunate to have family-owned land upon which to farm, Grace believes that someday she will achieve her dreams for her children – a high level of education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers, pesticides, and to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Hotamdjon

texts.en:
D. Hotamdjon is 41 years old. He is married and has three children. Hotamdjon is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Hotamdjon requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his livestock and thereby increase his household income, in addition to being solvent in order to continue working on buying and selling animals.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International"

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny has been 15 years engage in his transportation business. This is the main source of his family’s daily income and he is hoping that his business will survive as long as he has the strength to operate his passenger tricycle. Danny would like to ask for financial assistance to finance the needed maintenance of his motorcycle thus he is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000.00 to KIVA lenders. Aside from driving his passenger tricycle, Danny is also raising hogs in order to have an extra source of income. He has a big family and he is hoping to sustain their needs especially the studies of his children.


Danny is already 42 years old and he already has six children who are all studying. She is married to Sonia, who helps him in supporting the needs of their children. Danny hopes to provide the educational needs of her children because they also have dreams to finish their degrees in college. He is now currently sending three of his children in college that is why he uses his time wisely in his business just to provide them with sufficient financial support.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en: Robelyn N. is from the village of P-5, San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Robelyn owns and operates a sari-sari store, selling a variety of items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Robelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven irma de 29 años de edad, reside en Tipitapa  en la colonia los maestros, tiene tres hijos de 9,11 y 13 años de edad, estudiantes de la primaria, su esposo vende en un mercado de la capital mariscos, su negocio es la venta de tortillas, discos de películas y canciones desde hace ocho años se dedica a administrar su negocio, sus deseos es poder ver a sus hijos con una carrera que le ayude en la vida. Este es su séptimo ciclo en cual comprara maíz, leña, frijoles, lácteos para mejorar las ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias. Agradece a la institución por el financiamiento que ha hecho de muchos beneficios para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Comprar leña, maiz, frijoles

loans.name: Camila

texts.es: Camila es una socia perseverante y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre de un pequeño, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, este negocio funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de pescado en el puerto de la ciudad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles  que le permitió  invertir en golosinas para vender, en la actualidad Camila necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles que será utilizado para comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, jabón, aceites y otros productos de primera necesidad para vender. La meta de Camila es tener una tienda bien surtida y comprarse su casita.
texts.en:
Camila is a persevering, hardworking member who lives in Pucallpa city in the Ucayali region. She is 28 years old and the mother of a young son. She sells groceries from her house. Camila is supported by her husband, who sells fish in the city's port. She has been part of the "Loreto" community bank for two years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which enabled her to invest in candy to sell. Currently, Camila needs a loan of 2,800 PEN that will be used to buy sacks of rice and sugar, cartons of milk, soap, oil and other basic goods for the store. Camila's goal is to have a well-stocked store and to one day buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and sugar, cartons of milk, soap, oil, etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hard working woman and sells local gin popularly known as “ogogoro” in Nigeria. Patience sells her products from the front of her house. The demands for her local gin are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Local gin “ogogoro” is produced from fermented palm wine that has been processed locally.  She is requesting for a loan amount of 50, 000 NGN to purchase more supplies of local gin to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of local gin to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de muebles hechos de cuero, los cuales fabrica en el taller que implementó en su casa. Para este negocio tiene dos ayudantes y 3 personas más que realizan el tallado del cuero. Sus ventas las realiza a pedido, y en muchas ocasiones utiliza el internet para ello.
A José le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es propio y además puede generar trabajo para otras personas, pues así progresan juntos con miras al crecimiento de su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cuero, madera, y otros materiales necesaR. para elaborar los muebles solicitados.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He lives in his own home next door to his mother. For the past 5 years, José has been manufacturing and selling leather furniture. His workshop is located in his home. For his business, José has two assistants and three additional employees who design the leather carvings. His sales are completed through orders, and he receives several through the Internet. José enjoys his work because he owns the business and is able to provide employment for other people. He also like watching the progress he has made as production has increased.

This is his first loan with MFP. José commits to making all of his payments on time. The money he requested will be used to purchase leather, wood, and other necessary materials for producing furniture by request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, wood, and other materials

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.en:
The Munay Tika communal bank is part of the Asociación Arariwa. The group is made up of twelve members, with two sisters and just two men in the group. Many of the members make their living running small grocery stores or selling fruits and vegetables in markets, though some have jobs in other industries as well. 

Most of the group members live in Urubamba, a small town that sits at the base of the snow-capped Chicon Mountain, near a number of significant ruins of the Incan Empire. The members of Munay Tika work in various locales in the sacred valley. Some sell their goods in Urubamba, while others work in Oyallantaytambo, a small town twenty minutes from Urubamba where many tourists catch the train to Machu Picchu.

Emiliano, a member of the group, owns a small grocery store but also holds a job in construction. He is 45-years old, married, and has four children. Emiliano now lives with his family in Urubamba, but was born in the region of Quillabamba. He plans to use his Kiva loan to better his grocery store. 

The members of Munay Tika will use the loan from Kiva to further their businesses in the grocery sector. All of the members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to pay the monthly payments on time.  

Sonia is not pictured in the video.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is twenty-six years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Gifty works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a baker. She bakes bread and sells it to retailers. She also prepares and supplies pastries to other retailers in her community. Gifty has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad owns a farm tractor. He works on a freelance basis at the request of his customers. He's 45 years old, married, and has three children. Mohamad wants to perform maintenance on his tractor, so he is requesting a loan of $1000 to cover the maintenance costs.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his tractor

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Bagong Silang in Iligan City. She is 53 years old. Edna is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Edna runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food, soft drinks, and daily-use products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Edna's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa Candelaria L. D. tiene 51 años de edad y vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, ella es madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad y una hija la cual está bajo su responsabilidad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en un conocido mercado de la capital. Su esposo trabaja como jefe de seguridad en el Ministerio de Transporte e Infraestructura.

La mayor aspiración de la familia está el terminar de criar a su hija y darle todos los estudios profesionales para un futuro prospero, así como también el culminar la construcción de la casa y mejorar el local del negocio para poner una tienda de ropa, para este último propósito es que solicitaron este préstamo, con el crédito compraran los materiales de construcción necesarios para remodelar el local en donde instalaran el nuevo negocio, ella espera se le brinde un apoyo, pues le beneficiaria económicamente a toda la familia en el mejoramiento continuo del nivel de vida.

Este es el segundo prestamo que tienen con Afodenic, en el pasado pudo realizar la compra de mercaderia, ahora que le ha sido factible es que estan planificando la apertura de la tienda, se hace una énfasis del progreso de la familia, gracias a los fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Candelaria L. D. is 51 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, has two grown sons and a daughter who still lives at home. Nicolasa sells second-hand clothing in a popular market in the capital. Her husband works as security manager at the Transportation and Infrastructure Ministry. The family's highest aspiration is to finish raising their daughter and to give her every professional opportunity to ensure her success in the future. They also want to finish their home and to improve the appearance of the new clothing store. For this, they are requesting this loan: to buy construction materials to improve the store to which they will be moving their business. Nicolasa hopes the support for this will come through, since the whole family will benefit financially from the improvements. This is the second loan Nicolasa requests from Kiva partner Afodenic. The previous loan was used to buy supplies, and now that they're opening a new store, Nicolasa and her family's progress emphasizes the importance of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to open a new store

loans.name: Dina Magda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 47 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. Dina alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su botica “Cristo San Salvador” de la ciudad de Izcuchaca de la provincia de Anta del Departamento del Cusco. La socia nos cuenta que ya es un  año que participa en el banco comunal y para este nuevo ciclo, ella requiere el crédito para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pastillas y antibióticos.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the communal bank "Qory Orcco," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 47 years old, lives with a partner and has 4 children. Dina alternates her activities in the home with attending to her pharmacy "Christo San Salvador" in the city of Izcuchaca in the Anta province of the department of Cusco. She tells us that she has already participated in the communal bank for a year. For this new loan cycle, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as, for example, pills and antibiotics. Dina is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and likewise pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule. (The members of this communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Pucyura in the Anta district of the department of Cusco. Pucyura is located 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise including pills and antibiotics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife and their child, who is five years old.  He has been selling clinic equipments since 2008.  He was previously employed in a pharmacy before he started this business.   

His wife is a business lady and together they share their family expenses.  Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has grown because he can access loans.  He hopes to increase his income in the future.  He has requested a loan of kes 20,000 to add a stock of gloves and medicine. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Buy clinical gloves and medicine.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia S. is from the village of Salimpuno, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Eulalia is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Eulalia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Eulalia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Eulalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Eulalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Eulalia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Eulalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, primarily health and medicinal items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Djiguiya (4femmes mariées  et 1 célibataire) avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, ont en moyenne  5 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles polygames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits alimentaires tels la pomme de terre avec Maïmouna C., le bois de  chauffe,les vêtements pour  enfants.etc.
Maïmouna compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  10 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, au grand marché du quartier Médine et dans les vergers des villages avoisinants.  Elle les revend au  marché de Ouayerma II et en famille, à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Djiguiya group (four married women and one single woman), average 30 years of age, have five children each on average and live in polygamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their seventh loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which which they aim to be able to satisfy the needs of their customers; all their past loans have been fully repaid. This group of women buy and sell food products, such as potatoes (as is the case for Maïmouna C.), firewood, children's clothes etc. Maïmouna is planning to use her loan to buy ten 100kg sacks of potatoes at the large market in the Médine district and in the orchards in surrounding villages. She resells them at the market in Ouayerma II and within the family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, of which part will be used for household expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 64 años, está felizmente casado con Marcelina de 55 años, la compañera de toda su vida, ellos tienen 8 hijos pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Orgulloso, siembra café, plátano, palta, y piña, en sus terrenos propios,  junto a su amada esposa y con la ayuda de sus hijos, cada día labora con mucho esfuerzo y ahínco desde muy temprano hasta al anochecer, como se lo enseñaron sus padres. Lleva 40 años trabajando en la agricultura y en memoria de su padre y por su familia siente que debe trabajar muy duro para producir en cantidad y en calidad. Lo que más le gusta es dedicarse a trabajar la tierra, pues siente la tranquilidad del campo. Con el tiempo espera construir una casa en la ciudad de Pichanaki, para instalar un negocio de comestibles pues las fuerzas para seguir cultivando se le esta acabando, por eso viene comprando chacras donde cultivar los productos naturales que crecen en esta zona, para heredárselos a sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está contento de laborar en su grupo comunal, porque es muy apreciado por los socios y eso le hace sentir muy bien. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios quienes tendrán que traspasar las plantas de café de su vivero hacía sus terrenos agrícolas, además comprará sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Sixto is 64 years old and happily married to Marcelina, who is 55 years old and his companion for life. They have eight children, but only three still live with them in their own home. He is proud to be growing coffee, bananas, avocados, and pineapple on his own land. Together with his loving wife and the help of his children, Sixto works each day with great effort. He begins very early in the morning and works until late afternoon, just as he learned from his parents. Sixto has been farming for 40 years. To honor his family and the memory of his father, he feels he must work extremely hard to produce in both quantity and quality. What he enjoys most is working on his land because he feels the peacefulness of the countryside. In the future, he hopes to build a house in the city of Pichanaki and start a grocery business for when he no longer has the strength to continue farming. Yet he continues to buy land for cultivating natural products grown in the region so that he can leave an inheritance for his children.

This is his third loan with MFP. Sixto is happy with the work of his Communal Bank. The other members appreciate him, which makes him feel good. With the loan he requested, Sixto will hire workers to transplant coffee seedlings from the nursery to the fields. He will also buy sacks of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & hire workers to transplant coffee seedings

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida B. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Aida is married and has five adult children. Aida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used expand the business.

Aida is now requesting her second loan from HSPFI, for 8,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase even more products to sell.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Chay

texts.en: Chay C. is a 46-year-old woman, married to Noun Heang, age 51. They have four married children who have already started new homes. Chay C. currently plants crops, which she will harvest and collect when they are mature. In order to help alleviate the hard physical labor of farming, Chay C. is taking out her first loan to purchase a cow that she will use to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria E. is from the village of Patag, Bagontaas, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Gloria is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood and charcoal to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es: Por favor, escribe pequeña historia con la información arriba (en el orden del resumen): Avelino solicito 1200 $us, para la compra de ganado, ya que aparte de la agricultura se dedica a la producción de leche, la cual la vende a Pil Andina, planta industrializadota de leche, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su comunidad denominada POKE que se encuentra situada  dos horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Avelino is asking for a loan of US$1200 to buy cows. As well as being a farmer, he also raises cows for milk which he sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. Avelino lives with his wife and son in the community of Poke which is located two hours from the city of La Paz. This is his first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold A. is 32 years old and lives with his wife in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Ganbold operates a retail meat business in his town. He began his business in 2007 with the help of his wife at a local food market and after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community. Ganbold purchases stock from the neighboring sub-provinces and resells it at a local market at retail prices. He seems good at his business accounting and wishes to expand his business by buying more livestock at wholesale prices. 

Ganbold is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase a number of livestock to slaughter, which he will use for his meat business.

loans.use: To purchase a number of livestock

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La Señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”,  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene  02 hijos,   la señora estudió  hasta 5to de  educación secundaria.

La señora Paula esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y en la actualidad como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al M.M. R.  fue de S/. 400.00  nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de artefactos electrodomésticos,  también cuenta que vende papa y chuño y artículos diversos en forma ambulatoria.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo   crédito S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar papa, chuño y chifleria  (artículos diversos), para que  crezca el  negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener capital propio y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las capacitaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the “Las Perlas II” (The Pearls II) communal bank, located in the district and province of Huancané, within the Puno department. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She has a junior high school education. Paula has been working with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Manuela Ramos Movement), now a communal bank, for eight months. She tells us that her first loan through MMR was for 400 PEN, which she used as working capital for her small domestic appliance business. She also tells us that she also sells potatoes and other tubers and different other things on foot. She is asking for a new loan of 500 PEN ($200) which she will use to buy potatoes, tubers and natural medicines (various items) in order to grow her business. Her dream is to have her own capital and improve her business in the future. What she enjoys most about her communal bank are the meetings with her fellow members and the training they give one another.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D., 45, is from the town of Banga. Elvira is married and is the mother of a 27-year-old. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises chicken layers to produce and sell eggs. 

Elvira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP that will be used to purchase farm inputs and feeds for the chickens. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and feeds for the chickens

loans.name: Las Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
Las Cariñositas es grupo conformado por trece integrantes que llevan una buena amistad entre todos y algo curioso de este grupo es que hay únicamente un integrante varón al cual le pusieron “El Cariñosito”. Ellos radican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco, Estado de México.

María D. tiene 29 años,  es integrante del grupo, y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Hace seis meses decidió comenzar con una actividad que no implicara descuidar a sus hijos y que fuera rentable, así que decidió comenzar con la venta de ropa interior, blusas, mallones, etc. Hasta el día de hoy se encuentra muy satisfecha con ella misma de haber comenzado algo que le trajera un buen beneficio y sobre todo algo que le gusta, ya que tiene mucha facilidad de palabra y trato hacia la gente, sale a ofrecer su mercancía cada tercer día con los vecinos y ellos la recomiendan con más gente así es como puede incrementar sus ventas. María va a invertir la mitad del crédito para la compra de mas mercancía y la otra mitad para poder adquirir un triciclo ya que para ella es algo pesado ir cargando las bolsas de ropa y sobre todo cuando llueve tendrá mas facilidad de cubrir su mercancía. Sus planes son poder comprar un puesto y así poder estar fija en algún lugar y sobre todo poder darles un buen futuros a sus hijos.

Los demás integrantes son: 
Micaela R. M. (Venta de batas)
Verónica R. F. (Lencería y zapatos por catalogo)
Pedro A. M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres)
Concepción A. C. (Taller Mecánico)
Rocío A. V. (Arreglos Florales)
Delfina A. García (Venta de Lencería)
Aurora López C. (Venta de Cosméticos y Fragancias)
Brenda Tania A. Martínez (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)
Janeth Araceli Hernández López (Venta de Ropa)
Juana P. Hernández (Venta de Zapatos)
Elsa González O. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)
Ana Ramírez R. (Venta de Antojitos)
texts.en:
Las Cariñositas is a group made up of thirteen members who all share a great friendship. One strange thing about this group is that there is only one male member who they call “El Cariñosito” (the caring one). They live in Valle de Chalco, Mexico State.

María D. is 29 years old, is a group member and she has two school age children. Six months ago, she decided to start a business that would not involve leaving her children and that would be profitable. She decided to start selling undergarments, blouses and other clothing items. She has been very pleased with herself for having started something that has been beneficial and more than anything, something she likes. She is easy to talk to and approachable. She shows her merchandise to her neighbors every three days. Then, they recommend other people, so she can increase her sales. María is going to purchase more merchandise with half of the loan.With the other half, she will purchase a three wheeled vehicle, since it’s heavy to carry the bags of clothing. More than that, she wants one, so when it rains, it’s easier to cover her merchandise. Her plans are to buy a stand, so she can stay in one place and more than anything, to give her children a better future.

The other members are: Micaela R. M. (robe/apron sales) Verónica R. F. (catalog lingerie and shoes sales) Pedro A. M. (fruit and vegetable sales) Concepción A. C. (auto workshop) Rocío A. V. (flower arranger) Delfina A. García (lingerie sales) Aurora López C. (cosmetics and fragrance sales) Brenda Tania A. Martínez (catalog shoe sales) Janeth Araceli Hernández López (clothing sales) Juana P. Hernández (shoe sales) Elsa González O. (catalog shoe sales) Ana Ramírez R. (street snack sales)

loans.use: to buy undergarments, blouses, other clothing, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una madre de familia de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de frutas en el interior del mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece a sus clientes frutas frescas de estación, el negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que este centro de abastos es el principal de la localidad, Miguelina siempre atiende a sus clientes con un trato amable, por lo que cuenta siempre con un grupo de clientes fidelizados.

Miguelina ya ha trabajado con un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva que le sirvió para adquirir mas frutas con lo cual pudo ampliar su negocio, aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias, la demanda por su negocio ha ido creciendo y actualmente ella ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en una nueva ampliación de su negocio.

Miguelina se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del programa Kiva. Diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder percibir mayores ganancias y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 61, is a mother living with her husband and children in San Pedro de Lloc district, part of Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sold fruit in her local market for the last 10 years.  She stocks fresh, seasonal fruit.  The business is well received because this is the city’s main foodstuffs market.  Miguelina always treats her customers with kindness so she can always count on a group of regular customers.

Miguelina has worked with a Kiva financed loan in the past that helped her buy more fruit thus expanding her business, improving her sales and earning higher profits.  Demand has increased so she needs to request another 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a new expansion of her business.

Miguelina is very grateful to all the people who collaborated with her through the Kiva program.  She exerts the maximum effort daily to earn higher profits and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Dinara Chilpakbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Every country in the world is unique in its own way. Kyrgyzstan is no exception. It’s famous for its colorful culture and traditions. Many women are talented in designing clothing and accessories. Handmade souvenirs, carpets and national costumes cannot leave anyone indifferent. Small sewing businesses have turned into big fashion industries, which bring profit both to Kyrgyz entrepreneurs and foreign buyers.
Dinara C., 32, is a unique designer of national souvenirs. Dinara, her husband and their two children are residents of Tokmok, a small town in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. Since her early childhood, she watched her mother make these Kyrgyz traditional handmade souvenirs. Now she works in a small firm “Kiyal”, where she has an opportunity to sell her products. Dinara’s husband is involved in construction and repairing buildings. Her mother helps her out with taking care of the children while she is at work. If the family is fortunate enough to get this loan, they plan to purchase a computer. They would also like to broaden their business by opening their own workshop.
Mirlan C., 35, earns a living by reselling livestock. He is married and his wife helps him in taking care of the livestock. The purpose of his loan is to purchase additional livestock.
Paktagul J., 50, owns a sauna. This business has helped her for many years. She is requesting a loan to buy coal and heat the sauna to attract more customers.
Saadat O., 18, sells jeans clothing in the nearby town of Almaty, Kazakhstan. She plans to spend this loan on additional goods and improving her newly bought apartment.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Dmytro

texts.en:
Dmytro is married with 3 children. He lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Dmytro sells furniture, i.e. couches, armchairs, tables, etc. His store is located in a busy part of town. As Dmytro has been in the market for over 6 years, he has gained loyal customers. People know he sells quality furniture pieces and come to buy necessary items from him.  

Dmytro has already invested 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His monthly net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. Dmytro is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for his little store. He is friends with his suppliers who manufacture furniture. He always buys from them, knowing they have not let him down a single time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar L. is a 40-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her son live together in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older child, a daughter, is a university student and her son currently attends a local secondary school. 

Mendbayar operates a meat trading business in her town. She started her business in 2003 after living and working as a herder in the countryside till 1990. Her business is very important both for her and her family because it is the only source of her family income. In addition, she plants and grows vegetables in their 5 hectare field. 

For the future, Mendbayar hopes to expand her business. She is a talkative and open-minded woman and her dream is to open her own grocery shop in her yard. Mendbayar is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat at wholesale prices and sell it as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Chark

texts.en: Chark S. is looking for a loan to rebuild parts of her house. She is married to Chea Nhor who is the same age as her, 31, and earns a living as a local motor-driver. They lately had one little child. Chark S. wants become a grocery seller, live in a better and taller house, and send her child to university.

loans.use: To rebuild parts of her house.

loans.name: Shasta Daisy Group

texts.en:
Nancy R. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. She is 37 years old. Nancy is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shasta Daisy.

Nancy is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, spices, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nancy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell and acquire working capital.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet L. is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Janet is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Lavender".

Janet is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making dried fish for sale in the community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP from the business.

In 2010, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Janet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Shibel

texts.ar:
شبل في عمر 31 سنة يعمل في عمل فني النحت له في عمله 18 سنة يحب عمله ويتطور به دائما حيث انه شغفه يريد دائما التطور والتجدد له زبائن كثر من محيطه وهو مقصود في عمله له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى
شراء صخور لعمله يجد صعوبة في اثبات عمله في السوق حيث يجد منافسة عالية
texts.en: Shibel, 31, has been working in sculpture for 18 years. He has a passion for his work and always seeks to develop it. His many clients are from his circle of acquaintances. Shibel has many clients thanks to his good work.  He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy stones for his work. He finds it hard to make a name for himself due to fierce competition.

loans.use: To buy stones for his work

loans.name: Ingrith

texts.es:
La Sra. Ingrith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, del Distrito de Tarapto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Ingrith es una mujer emprendedora y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios la ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes y prendas de vestir (Bazar),  ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de su Ciudad, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas las realiza diariamente  a partir de las 9:00 am. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con su trabajo.

Con este crédito  de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará Mercaderías como: Ropas, batas, pantalones, blusas, snikers, todo esto tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Parte del dinero también invertirá comprando: paquetes de adornos, jaboncillos, pasta Kolinos, sandalias y productos para la higiene personal.

Ingrith se siente muy tranquila y feliz.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ingrith belongs to the communal bank “Maria Auxiliadora”, in Tarapto, San Martin Province. She is 28, partnered, and has a dependent child.

Ingrith is very entrepreneurial and has opened her own business selling household goods and clothing (Bazar).  She has a shop in the local market in her city, where she has gained a following among her clients and prospered in her business activities.  She opens the shop at 9:00 am. every day. Ingrith has now had her shop for some years and feels very content with the results of her efforts.

With a credit of S/ 2,000.00, Ingrith plans to buy clothes, ties, pants, blouses, shoes, and other items for women, men and children. She will also use part of the credit to buy: decorations, soap, sandals and hygiene products.

Ingrith is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for assisting her in realizing her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy clothing, accessories and personal hygiene products for re-sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M. is married and has one child.  She and her family live along National Road Number Six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Sok and her husband are vegetable farmers. She is requesting a loan for $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman who lives in the island of Cebu. She earns her living by buying and selling herbal products.  Her husband Vicente, who is 57 years old, works as a driver to earn his living.  They have three children who are between 21 and 33 years old. 

Avelina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Avelina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy herbal products to sell to customers so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Avelina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase herbal products to sell

loans.name: Tembo Mgwaza Group

texts.en:
Mary K., who is in her early thirties, is married with five children.  She has had a chicken business for 12 years. She works from 5:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the chicken business, sold fabrics and also bought a plot of land.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to buy chicken feed.  Her dream is to have a big space where she can have a good number of chickens.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "Tembo Mgwaza", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mary is in front, 1st on the right, with a flowered dress.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. She established 25 years ago a tailoring business in her home. With this large experience, she became well known in her town and its surroundings. She produces women's clothes such as robes and skirts and delivers her products to the clothing stores she deals with.  She helps her husband with the household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase textiles and pearls in order to expand her business operation and earn more profit. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and pearls

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze, a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Kanze has operated a coconut business, selling both wholesale and retail at the market. Another source of income is farming. Kanze faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to hire a tractor to cultivate her farm, pay labor costs, and purchase three sacks of coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to hire tractor to cultivate her farm, pay labor  and buy three sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Maria Fe is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $140 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a motorcycle side car to provide better service. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle side car to provide better service.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 34-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

Lilia has run a retail business for two years. This business earns 4,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She also tills a small parcel of land where she grows rice. Some of the harvest is used for consumption and the rest is sold at the market.

This loan will be used to buy items to sell, such as shoes, clothes, and other ready-to-wear products.

In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shoes, clothes, and other ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is a 41-year-old single woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has owned a general store that sells a lot of basic commodities in her local community for nearly 15 years. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by buying more goods for resale. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née en 1976 au Bénin, Madeleine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Sosthène. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. Madeleine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Madeleine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Madeleine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Madeleine vend des épices (oignon, ail, poivron etc.) et de l'huile végétale. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit,  Madeleine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Madeleine was born in Benin in 1976. She is married to Sosthène, a merchant. The spouses have four children, all attending school and in their care. Madeleine lives with her husband and her children. She shares household expenses with her husband. Madeleine never attended school.

To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells spices (onions, garlic, peppers, etc.) and vegetable oil. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. Thanks to her income from this activity, she pays for the various family expenses. In order to continuously strengthen her activity level and increase her profit, Madeleine came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy spices and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria, 53, lives with her three children in Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. Her husband helps her in their farming business. According to them, helping each other is one of the ways they show how they love each other, and despite problems that come to them, they know how to face things. 

Hilaria is dedicated to planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She earns a net income of PHP 5,000 monthly.

She requests the loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and corn seeds to grow. Support from the loan will help her economically to improve production and meet her needs. 

Her dream is to have a house of her own in five years and to continue moving forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Margot

texts.en: Margot is 39 years old and lives with her partner. She has one daughter and one son, both of whom are still in school and living with her. She is the owner of a store in which she makes and sells curtains. Margot is asking for an $800 loan to buy more materials to make curtains. Specifically, she plans to purchase different kinds of fabric, cloth, and string. She is very proud of her business and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cloth, and string to make curtains

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
At 47, Patricio has been engaged in the rice farming business for almost 20 years. He is married and has three school-aged children. Patricio's wife is his only partner in managing the business. They need to work harder to send their three children to school. 

Patricio is asking for a loan of P 20,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for rice production. He hopes that he will reap a large volume of rice to increase their income that will be used for food and their children's studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr:
Rachidatou est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est veuve et a 02 enfants en charge.
Rachidatou travaille comme revendeuse des objets de prières musulmanes depuis 2005. Elle vend avec une personne à ADOBOUKOME et achète les produits à Lomé. Rachidatou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de prières.
texts.en:
Rachidatou is a 38 years old woman. She is widowed and has two children in her care.
Rachidatou has been working as a retailer of Muslim devotional objects since 2005. She sells with another person in Adoboukome and purchases the products in Lome. Rachidatou has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase devotional objects.

loans.use: to buy Muslim devotional objects.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor de 28 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia.Flor con el apoyo de sus padres abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar mayores consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, ya  lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien y gracias a ello apoya en los gastos de alimentación de sus padres, con el dinero del crédito comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega.Este será su primer crédito de Flor  y esta muy contenta de saber que contara con el apoyo crediticio de los financistas y a la vez agradece a las socias de su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar con ellas.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mercaderías como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.
texts.en:
Flor, 28, is a young, single, cheerful, hardworking woman who wants to succeed in life.  She lives in her own house and what she most wants is to earn better income to provide her future family with economic stability.  

With help from her parents, Flor opened a grocery store where she offers basic need items.  Her stand generates good profits.  She opens up for business very early in the morning awaiting her first buyers.  She mentions that the key to securing more consumers is providing kind service and to help them with their purchases.  

What she enjoys about her work the most is pleasing her customers.  She’s been in this business for four years now and considers the most difficult part having to remain on foot all day.  She does well in her store and thanks to this she’s able to help pay for her parents’ food.  She will use the money from the loan to buy large amounts of stock merchandise for her sales stand.  In time, she hopes to be able to enlarge her house and thus enlarge her store too.

This will be Flor’s first loan and she’s very happy to know that she will have financial support.  At the same time, she thanks her fellow communal bank members for allowing her to work with them.  She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise like: sacks of rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juana Aracely

texts.es:
Juana, vive con una hija de 4 años de edad y una hermana, ella administra una tienda donde ofrece productos domésticos, el negocio es propio y lo tiene en su casa, lo atiende de 6:00am a 7:00pm desde hace 17 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, harina, azúcar y arroz, la compra le ayudara mucho, para crecer con el inventario del negocio,  y ofrecer a los clientes lo mejor y productos que sean demandados.
Ella quiere tener el negocio bien establecido, que los préstamos le ayuden a crecer, para tener una mejor atención a los clientes y que sus ventas también aumenten.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her 4-year-old daughter and a sister and she runs a store that sells household products.  This is her own business and she has had it in her house for 17 years where she works from 6 am to 7 pm.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy oil, flour, sugar and rice; purchases that will help her increase the inventory of the business, and offer her customers the best quality, and products that are popular.

She would like to have a well-established business.  The loans help her business grow and give her clients better service so that her sales increase.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Alegria” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas comentan que se unieron con el propósito de poder generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ana, ella se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Este trabajo lo realiza hace ya un buen tiempo, dice que esto no es tarea fácil, pues debe de estar siempre pendiente de sus animales para que no les pase nada ni les falte nada, pero comenta que es muy gratificante para ella que por medio de este trabajo logra mantener a sus familiares, pues desea darles a ellos una vida sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo cual podrá asegurar el alimento de los mismos.
texts.en:
The “La Alegria” committee was created by several neighbors from the community of Santaní.  They created a very united group whose members are capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.  They tell us that they came together with the goal of making more income for their families.

One of the members of this committee is Ana, whose business is raising and selling animals.  She has been in this line of work for a long time now.  She tells us that it is not easy work because she always needs to be alert to her animals' needs, so that nothing happens to them and so that there is nothing they lack.  However, she tells us that it is also rewarding because, through this work, she manages to support her family members who she would like to offer a life without hardship.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals, to ensure that they are well fed.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and one school-aged child. 7 years ago, he started to work in selling shaving tools and supplies to multiple customers and barbershops located in different areas and villages. He works on a freelance basis. With his requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase more merchandise in order to augment his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he hopes to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single, 25 year-old, enterprising businessman. He has been operating a bicycle transport service for the past three years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy a motorbike to facilitate his transportation. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will save and open a retail shop. His hopes and dreams are to own a private service vehicle which will help improve his living standard and his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to facilitate his transportation

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена решила взять кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку  макаронных изделий и сахара, круп, новых сортов чая, которые пользуються сросом в холодное время. Предыдущий использовала для увеличения ассортимента, планирует открыть еще одну точку на рынке. Елена приобрела домой новый холодильник, а старый использует в бизнесе. Основное конкурентное приемущество бизнеса Елены - самый большой выбор чаев и кофе самых разных марок, для требовательного покупателя.
texts.en: Yelena decided to obtain a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase pasta, sugar, grains and new varieties of tea that are in demand during the cold season.  She used her previous loan to increase her product assortment because she plans to open another retail outlet at the market.  Yelena bought a new refrigerator for her home and uses an old one for her business.  Yelena's main business advantage over her competition is the largest selection of tea and coffee of various brands, to satisfy the most demanding customer.

loans.use: to purchase pasta, sugar, grains and new varieties of tea

loans.name: Luis
