texts.es: El señor Luís es rentista jubilado del sector militar. El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de pisos en su garaje, pues con el tiempo se ha desgastado completamente. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; es viudo y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, pero sus ingresos le permiten fácilmente efectuar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Sr. Luís is a retired military pensioner. The loan he is requesting will be used to refurbish the floor of his garage which has completely worn out over time. He lives in his own home in the District of Alto Sopacachi in the city of La Paz. Luís is a widower and has three children.

This is the first time he has requested a loan. His income enables him to easily make the monthly payments.

loans.use: to refurbish the floor of his garage.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children who are all working. Unlike other women in her place, she’s the one responsible for her family and is their main income source. Amina strives to work really hard and doesn't hesitate to offer help whenever anyone needs it. Since 2003, she has owned a mini market where she also sells vegetables. Her business has succeeded, especially after being very welcoming and friendly. Today, she wants to borrow $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy supplementary products to be able to grow her business. In the future, she plans to open a snack shop next to her mini market.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a 24-year-old lady from the Musanda area of Mumias in Western Kenya. She is married to Boniface, and they have two children.

Risper operates a retail shop in the Musanda area, a business she has been doing for the last five years. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar and other goods requested by her clientele.

Her dream is to open many shop outlets in Musanda.

loans.use: To buy stock of cooking oil, flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro, está casado y vive con su hijo y su esposo que es son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar cerdos para su posterior engorde y producción de carne. El  cuenta ya con la experiencia desarrollada para el buen manejo de su proyecto. El cuenta con las instalaciones ya y lo que quiere es ponerlas a funcionar  y sacarle provecho a sus locales. El tienen como meta tener los cerdos para tiempo de venta y poder venderlos a un muy buen precio para generar el máximo de las ganancias para mejorar su  bienestar familiar y su estabilidad económica.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leandro is married and lives with his wife and child, who are his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy pigs that he will eventually fatten for producing meat. Leandro has already developed experience so that he can manage this project well. He has the facilities for this type of venture, so he wants to put them to good use. His goal is to have pigs to sell at a good price so that he can generate as much income as possible to improve his family’s well-being and to provide them with financial stability.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Leandro has not received any prior loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary still runs a retail shop with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help her improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar and rice to her shop.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 24-year-old woman. She has a one-year-old son. She describes herself as a hardworking and determined woman. 

Stella does dairy farming and sells milk in an area conducive to the general public. She has been in this business for one year. In addition, Stella  also provides rental housing services to increase her income. She works hard to support her family. 

Stella is facing a challenge of inadequate funds to expand her business. She plans to and will use the loan of KES 20,000 to pay for the renovation of her rental houses.  Stella's dream and hope is to expand her business in the next five years.

loans.use: renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 23 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and they cooperates together in order to fulfill their needs.  She has been working as a private teacher since 2013. She adores her profession because she helps the students to get the needed education. She has organized a special room at her domicile where she receives students and has outfitted it with the necessary materials. Today, she is applying for a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills and therefore increase her income. She said that this will facilitate her work preparation and wishes to receive more students.

loans.use: to purchase a encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock her shop

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Ms. Silvia is a very active woman, responsible and hardworking. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer, and given the conditions of his work, his income is seasonal and they have lacked many of the necessities. For this reason, twenty years ago Silvia started selling shoes. She started out selling to neighbors and relatives, but today she has many customers and the orders for her products have increased.

Silvia wants to offer her children a better life, and the wants them to finish their studies. She needs a loan in the amount of $250.00, which she will use to buy merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and to obtain greater income. Your support will be very helpful to this family, without a doubt. Today is the day to help. Silvia and her family thank you sincerely.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm T. is 30 years old and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband and their 3 children.  Morm T. runs two businesses--running a watermelon plantation, and operating a small fishery with her husband.  This loan will be used to invest in the plantation and improve the fishery so they can raise more fish.  In the future, Morm T. wants to increase the size of the plantation so that she can afford to send her children to university.

loans.use: Investing in watermelon plantation, and improving fishery

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba and her husband make a living by preparing and selling shish kebab. They have been doing this for 4 years. They have no other permanent jobs and their business is the only source of income. Mahbuba and her husband travel among all markets in the region, so they have to work every day of the week. Selling at a single market brings them $150-200 in earnings. Mahbuba became a MicroInvest client 6 months ago. Now, she plans to take another loan to increase the volume of goods sold. The Juraevs are on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махбуба и ее муж занимаются изготовлением и продажей шашлыка. Опыт в этой деятельности 4 года. Постоянной работы нету и бизнес является основным источником семейного дохода. Для их бизнеса каждый день является рабочим, так как они посещают все базары региона. За один базар реализуют шашлыка на $150-200. Клиентом Микроинвест Махбуба стала 6 месяцев назад. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для увеличения товарооборота. На фото Вы видите супругов Джураевых.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Phut

texts.en: Mrs. Phut S., age 40, is a housewife. Her husband, also 40, is employed as a bus driver earning $5 per day. The couple has 4 children, 2 of whom are students. Mrs. Phut is requesting a $1,000 loan to finance the purchase of a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel owns a shoe sales business in the Ivan Montenegro Market. She has been able to do this with the help of her husband and their two children, who are students at the elementary level.

Mabel started her business about 22 years ago after seeing the need to obtain daily means to support her family. After starting her family, her interests were centered around her children's education, being that her husband's salary did not cover all their necessities.

Today, she has been able to excel thanks to the support that CEPRODEL has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

Mabel es propietaria de un negocio de venta de zapatos en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro. Asi mismo con su esposo a conformado un hogar con dos hijos, mismos que son estudiantes en edad escolar.

Mabel inicia hace alrededor de 22 años su negocio a partir de la necesidad de buscar una ayuda al sustento diario de su hogar. Luego al formar una familia sus interese se basaron en la educacion de sus hijos, ya que el salario del esposo no cubria todas las necesidades.

Hoy en dia su negocio ha crecido gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado CEPRODEL.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Zarniyar

texts.en: Zarniyar (her son is pictured) is a widow with 3 children. She was born in 1953. This woman lives with her 3 children in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. 15 years ago Zarniyar started a farming business to meet the demands of her family. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Catia Libeth

texts.en:
Catia Libeth is an ambitious young woman from San Juan, district La banda de Shilcayo, province and department San Martin.  Two years ago Catia started an internet café to help her family earn more money.  She started the business with one computer and a table in the front space of her house.  She now has four computers and a little stand where she sells candy, phone cards, and computer accessories.  

Catia is 24 years old, married, and has two young children.  Her husband is very supportive and helps run the business when she is busy.  Being a mother, wife, and business woman can often be difficult but she organizes her time and works very hard.  Catia never had the opportunity to study to become a professional so she is very happy to have her business.  She especially enjoys working from home where she gets to spend time with her children.  When her children are old enough Catia hopes to send her children to University.

Catia’s internet café is popular and in high demand.  She is requesting a loan of s/ 1,400 to invest into her business and to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she will buy a transformer and an electrical facilities. The more services she provides, the more success she experience.  She would one day like to have ten computers, some printers, and scanners.  Catia is a member of the Las Margaritas community bank who also supports her decision to request this loan.

loans.use: Buy transformer and an electrical facilities

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila works in a Center for orphaned children, realized through the collective activity of volunteers who wish to work together to sustain and maintain the Center, as well as through the sons and brothers, who are working for minimum wage. Her husband works in the center of Bolivia as a construction worker, and is also responsible for the family's earnings and expenses. Lucila's home is in the Zona de Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

The loan requested in order to purchase a computer, an tool that would help in the education of her two brothers who are studying in the state university.

This is the fourth time that she is askig for a loan from Impro, each previous instance her loan application was approved.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Lucila trabaja en un centro de acogimiento de niños sin familia. Realiza cobranza a voluntarios que quieran colaborar para el sustento de dicho centro, cubre su manutención, así como la de sus dos hijos y dos hermanos con el salario mínimo. Su esposo trabaja en el interior de Bolivia como albañil, también se ocupa de los gastos familiares. El domicilio de Lucila está ubicado en la Zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requerido es para la compra de una computadora, instrumento que ayudará en la educación de sus dos hermanos, los cuales estudian en la universidad estatal. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito a Impro, debido a tales antecedentes se aprobó la solicitud de la prestataria.

loans.use: acquisition of a computer

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru:
Tavarali S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 48 years old, married and has eight children. Tavarali has a high school degree. For the last 15 years he has been raising cattle for meat sales. He purchases calves at the market, feeds the animals for 40-45 days to fatten them up then sells at the same market for a higher price.This business is the sole source of income for the family and expanding his business will allow Tavarali to increase his profits and improve the living conditions of his family. Tavarali's business also provides the local market with a source of fresh meat. Tavarali is planning to use the loan money to purchase several young bulls and he is hoping to pay back the money in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шомахмадов Таварали Сафаралиевич проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо . Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 15 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы , тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 54 years old man, the father of two children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Hassan is a taxi driver. This is the third time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to do some maintenance to his house.

loans.use: To do house maintenance.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 39 years old and married with four children. She works as a secretary for the SOS Children's Village. Her husband is an electrician but his irregular income doesn't enable the family to renovate their old house.

With the coming of the rainy season, the family needs a good warm house to live in. Veronica is therefore requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1000000) to renovate their family home. She will repay the loan in installments from her salary.

loans.use: Purchase material to renovate family house

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Nai B. is an unmarried woman who lives in Sundhara, located in Lalitpur district. The majority of people in this locality are engaged in their own small businesses. Nai B. lives with her father, mother and two brothers. Her father is a tailor. Both of her brothers and herself are engaged in making brass religious statues. They make different types of brass religious statues. They make statues according to the demand of their customers. In this business they need a lot of investment to fulfill the demand of their customers so Ms. Nai B. is requesting for a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for their work.

loans.use: Nai would like to buy raw materials for her work making brass religious statues.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Rose M.. She is married and has six children, aged between 10 and 23. In 2004, Rose established her crops business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $90 every month from this business. Rose has already received, and successfully repaid, two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $17. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is 51 years old,  is married, and has two children.  He is settled in the town of Khirdalan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. Four years ago he started a business selling cisterns. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the materials for making  more cisterns to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the materials for making the cisterns

loans.name: Filena

texts.es: Doña Filena de 51 años, habita en el Barrio Villa Reconciliación Sur, esta casada y su esposo es dueño de una unidad de Taxi  conduciéndolo el mismo y ayudando para los gastos de la casa, tienen 4 hijos ya mayores de edad y trabajan independiente. Doña Filena se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo específicamente productos de cosmetología tiene 5 años de ejercer esta actividad, lo inicio con apoyo de su esposo y su anhelo es poder ampliar este pequeño negocio, Solicita el crédito para inversión del mismo y compra de Ropa, Zapatos y artículos del hogar para ofrecerlos a sus clientes en esta temporada y poder obtener mejores ganancias para el incremento del negocio y apoyo a sus gastos.
texts.en:
Doña Filena is 51 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación Sur neighborhood. She is married and her husband owns a taxi, which he drives himself, to help with household expenses. They have 4 children, all are adults and work on their own. Doña Filena sells products by catalog, specifically cosmetics. She has been doing this for 5 years and started the business with the help of her husband. Her wish is to be able to expand this small business. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy clothing, shoes and home goods to offer to her customers so she can make more profit, expand the business and help out with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and home goods.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina M. is a 30-year-old woman who comes from Soko, a pretty village near Gračanica. She is the mother of two small children; one is only two months old.

Sabina sells clothes at home now, because she has a little baby, but she usually sells them at the market. She was not so active the last few months because of her pregnancy and she wants to be prepared for the winter season. She is requesting a loan through WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to buy winter clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy  clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Sueto

texts.fr: Sueto D. est une dynamique commerçante. Elle est revendeuse de produits génériques depuis 3 ans. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Avec ce crédit, Sueto espère relancer son commerce en augmentant ses achats et en louant un magasin pour l’exposition de ses marchandises. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Sueto D. is an energetic shopkeeper, a retailer of generic pharmaceutical products for three years. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are all in school. With this loan, Sueto hopes to reinvigorate her business by increasing her purchases and leasing a store for showing her products. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and lease a store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria I. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells provisions and drinks in small quantities. She hopes to purchase provisions and drinks to sell to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more products. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Abdushukur

texts.en:
Abdushukur is a 39-year-old man, married with 4 children who drives a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on a microbus for his public transport business, which he drives personally. Abdushukur has about 7 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business even though there are so many people who need it. He requests a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) for the term of 6 months.so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. With the loan he’ll purchase the spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Abdushukur will continue to progress. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his microbus

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
La señora Santos Paula M. es una dama muy trabajadora ya que desde la madrugada a muy tempranas horas del día, ella se levanta e inicia a elaborar tortillas que posteriormente son vendidas por ella misma en todo el mercado la Estación en la ciudad de León.

Con vasta experiencia en este negocio ella se ha destacado por elaborar deliciosas tortillas y es por este motivo que tiene varios clientes que le visitan para la compra de dichas tortillas. La situación que ella atraviesa en este momento es que requiere de la compra de la leña y el maíz y por esto es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Paula M. is a very hard working woman that wakes up in the wee hours of the morning to start preparing tortillas that she later sells herself in the Estacion market in the city of Léon. With extensive experience in this area, she has distinguished herself by baking delicious tortillas that have brought about a large number of clients that, faithfully, go to her to enjoy her famous dish. At this time, she is faced with the need to purchase additional wood and corn; therefore, she has sought the support from Cepodrel in order to be awarded with a credit line that will keep her business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood and corn.

loans.name: Mrs. Khen An Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA., which consists of eleven people, is located in Peam Tonlea village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Khen A. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In her second plantation, she grows beans; unfortunately, she now faces a problem because her crop has been damaged by insects. To deal with this problem, she has decided to request a loA. to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects and she hopes to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Real Kon, helps her on the plantation. Mrs. Khen A. is 60 years old and the mother of two children one of whom helps her while the other is attending the local school.

All members in this village bank loA. are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides to kill all kinds of insects on the plantation.

loans.name: Giovana,

texts.es:
Con dos hijos de cinco y cuatro años, Giovana maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de frituras como ambulante en la puerta del mercado más cercano de su casa. Hace tres años que empezó este negocio, pues anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como pastelera en una pastelería. 

No obstante, cuando aún no tenía hijos ha tenido trabajos variados, como vendedora de baterías para carros o ayudante de venta en un puesto de abarrotes. Una vez que tuvo sus hijos decidió establecerse y tener un negocio propio.

Más adelante, Giovana asegura que abrirá una fuente de soda en su propia casa. Hoy se dedica a vender, no solo frituras, por ser temporada de verano también prepara jugos. Eventualmente trabaja cocinando bajo pedidos, para algún evento especial u otras actividades.
texts.en:
Giovana has two children (ages four and five), and manages a small fried-foods stall at the market nearest to her house. Before starting her business three years ago, Giovana worked as a baker at a pastry shop. Nevertheless, Giovana had to hold various jobs -- like selling car batteries or working in a grocery store -- even before having children. Once she had children, she decided to settle and start her own business. Later, Giovana opened a soda fountain in her own house; these days she is not only selling fried-foods, but also, but preparing and selling juices in the summertime. She may soon begin to take small orders for special events or other activities.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies for her two children

loans.name: Wema Group

texts.en:
Zarina has been a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for five years. She belongs to Wema group (Group code: 2008). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $350. She works at her business for 10 hours daily.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more clothes "vitenge" for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zarina is 45 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 30, 27, 25, 21, 18, 17, 15 and 7. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Valentina who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: Buy more clothes (vitenge) for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
ulia  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo.
Julia es casada tiene 46 años, un hijo de 22 años que estudia en un instituto superior.
Julia tiene estudios técnicos de  cosmetología y sus clientas siempre le pedían ropa, ella empezó a comprar ropa para vender a sus clientas, se dedica por años a la venta de ropa.   
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para invertirlo en la compra de ropa.
Desde que está en Finca, es más responsable, tiene más cuidado con el dinero que saca prestado, y como lo va invertir; le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal son muy familiares.
El sueño de Julia es tener una boutique o un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the El Triunfo community bank. She is married, 46 years old and has a 22 year old son who is studying at an "instituto superior". Julia studied cosmetology and her customers were always ordering clothing from her. She started to buy clothes to sell to her customers and, for years, has earned a living selling clothing. Julia needs a 1200 soles loan which she will use to buy clothes. Since being with Finca, she's become more responsible, taking more care with the money that she borrows and how she invests it. She likes the community bank meetings because they're like family gatherings. Julia's dream is to own a shop or a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Justina es separada tiene 39 años, tres hijos de 21, 18 y 7 años este ultimo estudia en la escuela estatal.
Justina tiene una bodega en su casa, empezó vendiendo cerveza, ella estudio computación y le ayuda a organizar mejor su negocio, tener todo en orden.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles. para la compra  de cerveza, va poner piso a su negocio.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ha desarrollarse mas en el negocio, aprende de las socias que son muy trabajadoras, son solidarias, cuando alguna socia tiene problemas están dispuestas a apoyarles.    
El sueño de Justina es contratar una persona que le ayude en su negocio de bodega, para que ella descanse.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Virgin of Mercedes Community Bank. She is 39 years old and has three children ages 21, 18 and 7, the youngest of which attends a state school. She is separated from her husband. Justina runs a bodega out of her home. She started out selling beer. She studied computation and that helped her better organize her business. Now everything is in order. Justina is requesting a loan of 2,400 soles for the purchase of beer and to put a floor on her business. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she learned to better develop her business, and learned from the hard-working, united group members. When any member has a problem, the others are there for support. Justina's dream is to hire a worker to help her with her bodega business, so she can relax.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer for her bodega and put in a floor

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men M. was born in 1939 and his wife, Ouk Ry (shown in the photo) is aged 59. The family earn their daily revenue by growing different kinds of crops on their own farmland. They inherited the farmland from their grandparents who have been dead for a long time. Besides their current farm work, Men M. is also a domestic building worker in the village.

In the past, the family always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to plow their plot of land for growing crops. They want to own a cow and that is why Men M. is applying for a loan to buy a cow so they can use it to plow a field as well as raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: María Argentina

texts.es:
La señora María Argentina A. es una dama muy alegre y esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de venta de alimentos en su localidad.

Las personas le visitan mucho porque ella se ha destacado elaborando deliciosos alimentos que son del agrado de muchas personas. La señora María ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos y así salir adelante en el negocio de venta de alimentos.
texts.en:
María Argentina A. is a very happy and hardworking woman that dedicates herself to her business in the sale of food in her neighborhood. People visit her often because she is well known for making delicious dishes that are well liked by many people. Maria has requested a loan to purchase basic materials to make her aforementioned dishes and in that way get ahead in her food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet O. trades in maize. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors. Harriet buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for seven years.

Harriet is 36 years old, married and has three children: one son and two daughters. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Harriet wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Jofrey

texts.en:
Jofrey K. runs a food shop business at Kisiwani ward in Dar es Salaam. Food shop businesses are very common in Dar es Salaam.

K. sells different types of food crop products such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, beans, groundnuts (peanuts) and cooking oil. He purchases his business goods from the retail and wholesale shops; others items are purchased direct from the producers. He sells in retail to his customers.

K. has been in the business for three years and the business income has helped him to meet his family’s daily needs and school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Хосият 50 лет. Вдова и мать 3-х детей. Хосият потеряла мужа несколько лет назад. Теперь она воспитывает детей одна. После смерти мужа Хосият стало трудно. Она должна много работать чтобы прокормить и обучать своих детей. Старший сын помогает матери по мере возможности, но у него своя семья. Хосият занимается продажей женской и детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Так как наступает школьный сезон, Хосият просит займ для закупки школьной формы для мальчиков и девочек.
texts.en:
Hosiyat is 50 years old. She is a widow and is a mother of 3 children. Hosiyat lost her husband several years ago. Now she raises her children alone. It has become difficult for Hosiyat after the death of her husband. She has to work a lot in order to feed and school her children. Her oldest son helps his mother as much as possible, but he has his own family. Hosiyat sells women's and children's clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Due to the beginning of the school season, Hosiyat is requesting a loan in order to purchase school uniforms for boys and girls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old and she resides in the village of Antagan, Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Rodante S., 50 years old, whose occupation is farming. They are blessed with a child named Exequil. Lolita is wishing to send him to college someday by patiently maintaining her store to earn a daily income.

Lolita also manages a hog-raising business aside from her store. Her son is now a high school student. To further meet their needs, she would like to borrow an additional capital of PHP 7,000 that she can use in her store.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mansa

texts.en: Mansa E. sells gari; she buys raw cassava and processes it into a dough, then fries it to get it dry. She sells her product at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi. Mansa has no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Mansa has been selling gari since 2004. She pays the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to use as dough for the gari she sells. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to increase her income and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to use as dough for gari

loans.name: Jomie

texts.en:
Jomie D., 32, owns and tills a 1 and a 1/2 hectare farm. He has two children, who are studying. The rice field is his only way to support his family since this is the only job that he is familiar with.

He is doing his best to support his family's everyday needs. Now, he would like to request a loan of PHP 12,000 from Communty Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to make his rice plants grow healthy, and to buy other farming necessities.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Edilberta es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Edilberta tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Edilberta sueña con mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old, and is married with four children. Three of her children are currently in school while the other is learning a trade. Janet lives with her family in a rented apartment. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Janet is a petty trader, selling beef, groundnuts, vegetable oil, etc. on a table top in the community market.

Janet wants to use her loan to buy a supply of beef, groundnuts, vegetable oil, and assorted spices, in bulk, in order to expand her business. She hopes to make a good income from her expanded business, enabling her and her husband to support their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs (beef, groundnuts, vegetable oil, assorted spices) in bulk

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr: Faty S. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée sans enfants elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" depuis un an et demi et y a eu des performances remarquables. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires pour hommes et femmes, de chaussures, d'effets de toilette et des sacs à main pour dames. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter sa capacité d'autofinancement, générer des bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge quotidienne de la maison.
texts.en:
Faty S. is a 29-year-old woman who is married and without children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" for 1½ years and has performed remarkably.  Her loan is allowing her to develop a small business selling clothing for men and women, footwear, toiletries, and women's handbags.  She wishes to bolster her business in order to be able to increase her profits and to support her husband with day-to-day household expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her small-scale business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 38 años, vive con sus 2 hijos; Cristian de 14 y Henry de 9, todos ellos viven en su casa propia, junto a su esposo (Narciso) quien viaja constantemente por trabajo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, para ello se levanta desde tempranas horas para poder cocinar los ricos bocaditos y postres que le piden sus clientes.
A Marisol le gusta mucho la cocina y es por ello que se toma tanto tiempo y dedicación en realizar estos entremeses. Ella considera rentable su trabajo porque siempre tiene los pedidos suficientes para obtener ganancias satisfactorias, es por ello que para el futuro piensa aprovechar esto para implementar un negocio más grande y más estable.
Pero adicionalmente, cuando su esposo está de viaje Marisol atiende su pequeña ferretería instalada en su vivienda, donde también vende balones de gas doméstico.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de estos bocadillos.
texts.en:
Marisol, 38, lives with her husband, Narciso, who constantly travels due to work, and their two sons: Cristian, 14, and Henry, 9, in their own home. She sells prepared food for which she rises very early in the morning to cook the delicious snacks and desserts her customers request. Marisol loves to cook and this is why she takes all the time necessary to prepare these delicious dishes. She feels that her work is profitable because she always has enough orders to produce satisfactory profits and this inspires her to aim for a larger, more stable establishment in the future. In addition, when her husband is away on his trips, she tends to his small hardware store that is set up in their home where she also sells gas tanks for home use. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time. With the funds requested she plans to buy larger quantities of ingredients needed to prepare her food.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her snacks.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 32 years old. He owns an electronics shop located at Majestic Plaza in Kampala, and he has been operating his shop more than six years. He is a hardworking businessman using the loan to add to his capital in order to expand his business inventory. He expects to own a much bigger electronic shop to create new opportunities.

loans.use: To add electronic accessories to his inventory

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Sarah is a trader. She trades in jewels. She hawks locally and travels to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants to expand her business. Sarah wants the loan to procure many kinds of jewels – earrings, necklaces, etc. in bulk.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne M. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis deux et a bénéficié de 04 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de développer une petite unité d'élevage de poulets et fait du petit commerce de tissus et de chaussures. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Jeanne M. is a 36 year-old married mother of four. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for two years and has received four loans which have been well managed and repaid. Her loan would help her to set up a small chicken-rearing unit, and a small fabric and shoes business. She is actively involved in looking after her family's welfare.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her investment funds

loans.name: Abdull Monir

texts.en:
Abdull Monir is 34 years old. He is educated. He is one of the staff of the Army Hospital of Afghanistan. He has been involved in this career for more than 15 years. He needs a 30,000 Afghani loan for his personal use, but no one is available to lend him this much money. After so many problems, he found the AFS office.

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis to solve his family problems. He is happy with this loan process. Since he found AFS and applied for his first loan, he hasn't faced any difficulties; therefore, he would like to thank lenders around the world who help those who really want to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Los Dinamicos De San Isidro De Chicon Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON está formado por 18 socios que son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon de la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. La cuidad San Isidro de Chicon se encuentra ubicado a 10 minutos de la Ciudad de Urubamba. 

Francisca es socia del banco comunal los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas que depende todavía de ella (Elvis y Ofelia). Francisca se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y patos, ella es una mujer emprendedora pues desde que recibió la capacitación de crianza de animales por parte de la municipalidad comenzó su negocio. Ya es un año que la socia pertenece al banco comunal y el crédito que reciba es para comprar mas cuyes y alimento para los animales.

Los otros socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, venta de comestibles, agricultura, venta de productos secos, construcción de casas y Raúl hacen servicios de transporte urbano.       

Los socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a que los compradores trabajaban directamente con el turismo. Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que turistas cancelaron sus reservaciones de viaja a la ciudad del Cusco. El turismo ha decaído considerablemente.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON” Community Bank is comprised of 18 members. They are workers that are looking every moment for a way to progress. With their daily efforts they hope to achieve a better future for their children. The members live in the San Isidro de Chicon Community near the city of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. This area is known for its beautiful countryside, its agriculture and its ranches. The city of San Isidro de Chicon is located ten minutes from the city of Urubamba. Francisca is a member of the LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON Community Bank. She is 42 years old, is married and has two children (Elvis and Ofelia) that still depend on her for support. Francisca raises small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and ducks. She is an enterprising woman. Since she has obtained her permit from the city to raise animals she has begun this business. This woman has been a member of the Community Bank for the past year. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more guinea pigs and for animal food. The other members also raise young animals or they sell groceries, work in agriculture, sell dry goods or build houses. Raul works as a driver in the city. The members are worried because sales are down because their buyers work directly in the tourist industry. The heavy rains that fell for three days in the city of Cusco caused tourists to cancel their reservations for trips to Cusco. Tourism has fallen quite a bit. The members are thankful for the opportunity that is available and promise to pay their individual payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena Q. is a 47-year old married woman who lives in Binucot Pob, Sta. Catalina Negros Orriental. She earns her living by running a general store and also from hog-raising.

Elena’s husband, Fernando, is a 48-year-old truck driver who does his best  to provide for his wife and any children that they might have in the near future. Elena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and hog-raising business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her business activities.

Elena is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund the operations of her general store and her hog-raising business. The loan process had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 11th cycle loan, amounting to PHP 19,500. She also intends to use this loan towards her general store and hog-raising businesses. Elena is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy yam buds

loans.name: Clarah Jeptanui

texts.en:
Clarah K. is a woman of 38. She is married and has four children, who are all in primary school. She lives in Kipsangui in Eldoret, where she plants maize and wheat for resale on her 2 acres of land. Most of her clients are her neighbors. Clarah has been farming for three years now.

Clarah came to know about KADET, a Kiva partner, through another existing client and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers and pay her employees. 

Her goal is to add 3 acres of land in the near future so that she can increase the family's income and hence, increase their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, maize seedlings

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio O. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena. He is 58 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products such as rice, tomato sauce, canned goods etc. in the local community. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Antonio joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijas mujeres , la cuales estudian y ayudan a sus padres con los quehaceres del hogar, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en la finca que ellos poseen y asume  los gastos del hogar; Juana trabaja como docente desde hace 23 años  en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea en la colonia Nuevo Leòn, se caracteriza por ser  muy sencilla, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo.  

Está solicitando su 6to crèdito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, cambiando el zinc a su casa ya que se encuentra en mal estado, y como se acerca el invierno quiere cambiarlo con urgencia para evitar se le deterioren sus cosas.  Expresa sentirse agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado poco a poco la vivienda donde ella vive junto a su familia.  

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijas estudien y puedan obtener un trabajo que les permita tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 39, is married and has two daughters who go to school and help their parents with household chores. Her husband farms their own lands and takes care of household expenses. Juana has been a teacher for 23 years in the Nuevo León neighborhood of the city of Nueva Guinea; she is known for being very unassuming, honest, hard-working and highly thought of by her coworkers. She is asking for her 6th loan to invest in home improvements. She wants to replace the zinc metal roof which is in poor condition; it’s urgent she does so because winter is approaching and she doesn’t want her belongings to be damaged. She expresses her gratitude towards AFODENIC because previous loans have made it possible for her to buy home appliances and to gradually improve her home where she lives together with her family. Her greatest wish is that her daughters can study so that they can get a job that will permit them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en: Kochkor village is located in Kochkor valley, surrounded by mountain chains in the south and the north. People of this area are used to harsh winds and frosty winters. The main occupation of majority is cattle breeding. Our group is not an exception. Damira B., the leader of this group, is the mother of three children. She is 48 and, for a living, she raises livestock for sale. At present, she is raising five sheep for sale. Her husband works in a rayon (district) electricity station. One of her sons works in a pastry shop while the other son and her husband help Damira look after the cattle. The little daughter has been fortunate enough, as her parents sent her to university in the capital. Damira strives to provide a good life for her family. Therefore she is doing her best to increase the total population of her livestock. Now, her monthly income is around $110. It is not much money but Damira is an optimistic person and believes that she will manage to improve her family’s living conditions. Besides, recently they have made a major repair to their house. Now, Damira needs a loan to purchase two sheep and fuel for farming. Damira’s partners: B. Aiymbubu, 60, is a widow who has raised three children. Her two sons are now farmers and actively support their mother. As for Aiymbubu, she is engaged in reselling livestock and manages to earn $85 a month. Now she needs a loan to purchase more sheep. S. Mairamkul, 49, has three children and the whole family is occupied with cattle breeding. They started this business three years ago by means of a loan and their life has greatly improved since then. Now they again need a loan to invest in increasing the total population of their livestock. T. Ishen, 56, is a widow and has three children: two daughters are married and a son is a college student. To make a living Ishen built a shop and started raising cattle. Now, she has a stable business and two sources of income. She needs this loan to purchase more sheep and a cow. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase two sheep and fuel needed for farming

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline Pate¤o is from the village of Tipan. She is 30 years old. Joseline is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Joseline owns & operates a business venture selling bamboo products in the local community, specifically Sun Breaker. Joseline has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Joseline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joseline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Joseline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Joseline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is 51 years old. She is married with 6 children who are all adults. She looks after her grandchild who is attending school.

She is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. Hilder has been farming for 5 years and has been employing several people on a temporary basis. Her main products are milk and eggs which she sells at the local market. Her biggest challenge is diseases which are costly to treat.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30,000 to expand her poultry project. She says that the proceeds from this project will go towards the education of her grandchild.

In future, she would like to construct some rental houses on her plot of land that will boost her revenue.

She appreciates the fact that Juhudi has assisted her obtain a loan which she had applied for in other areas but failed to receive.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a member of the Keen Ventures group of Faulu Kenya. She runs "Zena Salon" to earn a living and her business, which has been running for six years, has really grown. Therefore, she has employed two people.

Zena is a married lady with one child and she works hard to support her family financially. She hopes to get more customers for a better income. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to renovate her salon which will help to attract more customers.

Zena hopes to start a hairdressing school in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her salon

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung Cagayan. She is 59 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson, es portero en una empresa, tiene una hija de 11 años. Wilson es casado; esta postulando en la universidad donde quiere estudia agronomía. Vive en la ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como portero en una empresa de productos lácteos. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado en la compra de una computadora que le será muy útil cuando ingrese a la Universidad.

Es el Cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en:
Wilson is a security guard at a private company. He has a daughter who is 11 years old. He is married and he is going to university where he is studying agriculture. He lives in the city of El Alto. He works as a security guard for a milk products company. The loan he is requesting is to purchase a computer to use for his university studies. This is his fourth loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer to use while in University.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity S. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts, fish and bags of maize at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts and dried fish to sell.  Charity is 46 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 8 children and 4 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more groundnuts and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan F. y su esposa María de Jesús, tienen una muy bonita familia, solo tiene un hijo adolescente, que estudia. El señor Juan trabaja todo el día y la Señora María trabaja en una estancia infantil. Los dos quieren lo mejor para su hijo y es por eso que necesitan este crédito para construir un cuarto mas en su vivienda. Ellos han logrado reunir un dinero de sus ahorros pero no es suficiente para toda la construcción. La familia del Señor Juan les agradece el apoyo.
texts.en:
Juan F. and his wife Maria de Jesus have a beautiful family. They have only a teenage boy who is going to school. Juan works all day and Maria works in a daycare. They both want only the best for their son, for which reason they need a loan to build a room in their house. They have managed to save some money from their own earnings but it is not enough to complete the project. Juan and his family are grateful for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Cleofe; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de ropa para niños y adultos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria y también envía a la ciudadela de Machupicchu para que alla lo venda su hermana que también se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, su esposo es chofer de servicio de taxi y juntos sacan adelante a su familia, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cleofe belongs to the community bank “Madres Trabajadoras.” The bank is located in the district of Santiago, belonging to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Cleofe is 38 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Cleofe balances her daily activities with her business selling clothing for children and adults. She sells in the street and also sends them to the area of Machupicchu to be sold by her sister who also has a business in clothing sales. Her husband is a taxi driver and together they are moving ahead with their family. Cleofe wants to have a store selling clothes. She wants the loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, jackets and polos.

Cleofe is thankful to those who make up this dream and promises to complete the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as pants, blouses, jackets and polos.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento antiguo  que se encuentra en su 3er ciclo integrado por 8 Integrantes los cuales todos viven en la zona de la Guardia  pero en distintos barrios, como Victoria, San Jorge, la Chiripina  y 3 demayo.                                                                                                       Presidenta: la Sra. Primitiva o de  29 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de la guardia b/ 3 de mayo, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes  en la localidad la Guardia en el mercado central hace 19 años. Su Estado civil: concubina con el señor Néstor su  actividad motocierrista y trabaja en la zona Guenda  hace 8  años, los señores cuentan con 1 hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería al por mayor, como azúcar, fideo por quintales.                                                                                   
Secretaria: Yaneth de edad 23 años vive en la localidad  de la guardia  Barrio la Chiripina,            su negocio es la  venta de refrigerio  en la zona de la guardia hace 2 años.
                                                                                                         Su estado civil: concubina  con el señor Manuel, su  actividad medico su lugar de trabajo hospital hace 2años, los señores cuentan con 1 hija pequeña, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Comprara insumos para la preparación de sus productos.
                                                                                                    Tesorera: Maricela  de 24 años de edad vive en la zona de la guardia barrio Victoria el negocio actividad: supervisora de un snack en el tercer anillo.
                                                                                            Estado civil: concubina hace 3 años con el señor David que se dedica a la actividad de ingeniero geógrafo  los señores cuentan con 1 hijo a su cargo.
                                                                                                        Los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por depositarles la confianza a su personas. Y haberles abierto las puertas cuando ellos mas lo necesitaban.
texts.en:
The community bank Antiguo is currently in its third loan cycle. The group is made up of 8 members and they are all originally from the La Guardia region but from various districts, such  as Victoria, San Jorge, La Chiripina, and 3 De Mayo. The leader of the group is Mrs. Primitiva.  She is 29 years old and she lives in the district of La Guardia. She has had a grocery store in the same community, in the central market, for the past 19 years.  She lives with her partner, Nestor. He is a lumberjack and has worked in the community of Guenda for the past 8 years. They have a school-aged son together. The funds from the loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise in wholesale, such as sugar and pastas. 

The secretary of the group is Yaneth. She is 23 years old and she lives in the district of La Guardia. She has been a caterer in the same community for the past 2 years. She lives with her partner Manuel. He is a doctor and he has worked in the hospital for the past 2 years. They have a little girl together. The funds from the loan will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to use in her catering business. 

The treasurer of the group is Maricela. She is 24 years old and she lives in the district of La Victoria. She is the supervisor of a snack bar. She lives with her partner, David. He is a civil engineer and they are both very grateful for the trust imparted upon them in the form of a loan. Doors where opened for them when they were most in need.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat L. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three children attend a local school, while his wife operates a clothes trading business in a rented stall at the Ayanchin market. He operates a taxi service using his own car. He and his family used to live in the countryside, leading a nomadic lifestyle, but unfortunately they lost all their livestock during a harsh winter and moved to his current town where he started his transportation business in 2000 after purchasing his own small car.

After several successful years driving a taxi, he was able to save up money to start another business by selling a variety of clothing items, imported from China, in a rented stall at the local market, in 2006. Today, both businesses have become stable. Erdenebat is a talkative and open-minded man. He will save enough money to purchase an apartment with 2-3 rooms for his family, in the future. Erdenebat is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Joy is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Joy owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid her previous loan  from GDMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignments of drugs

loans.name: Dau's Group

texts.en:
Dau T. N. is 47 years old. She lives in Xuan Trach village, Xuan Canh commune. She has two children. She sells goods in the market. She has this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 2.204.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 4.142.000 VND to small business.
  About other borrowers in her group:
  Ha T. D. is 46 years old. She raises chicken. She would like to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy food for chicken.
  Soi T. N. is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to small business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino M. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 40 years old. Marcelino is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelino owns and operates a farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Marcelino has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Marcelino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marcelino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya where she has been farming for 18 years. She employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her small-scale business. 

Agnes is 48 years old and married with four children. Two of the children are adults and two attend school.

She has requested this loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an insured cow and construct a dairy unit. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase her income through the sale of milk.  In future, she hopes to construct a good zero grazing unit that will enable her to increase the number of dairy cows from one to five.

loans.use: To purchase an insured cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Damaris Mukii

texts.en:
Damaris, 50, is married to Mwanzia, who contributes to the family income. She has six children aged between 10 and 26. She has been running her farm for the past four years with a profit of about 30,000 KES.  

This is her third loan from KADET Ltd after successfully repaying the previous ones well and in good time. She hopes to grow variety of crops and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fence the farm.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي في عمر 37 سنة يعمل اكثر من 9 سنوات في النقل العام متزوج ولهاربع اولاد يحب عمله ويريد التجدد والتطور
وقد تعرض مؤخرا الى حادث وقد تضرر فان بشكل كبير ولكن بالمثابرة استطاع ان يكمل عمله ولكنه يريد قرض من المجموعة 
بهدف صيانة فان وإعادة عمله بشكل طبيعي له زبائن من السواح والناس التي تقصده للنقل يلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة
فهو محب لعمله وعائلته
texts.en: Ali is 37 years old. For nine years, he has been working in public transportation. Ali is married with four children. He loves his job and seeks development and innovation. Ali was recently involved in an accident that caused him great loss. However, his perseverance won out and he was able to resume work. He would like to obtain a loan from Al Majmoua to maintain his van and restore his business. Ali’s customers are mainly tourists and the general public seeking transportation. He has constant support from his family as he loves his job and his family.

loans.use: Minivan maintenance

loans.name: Libia

texts.en:
Libia, a native of northern Peru, was a school teacher for 25 years before moving to the United States with her grown children in 1995.
