Suddenly, she was unsure of what she could do for a living in her new home. “There are so many opportunities in this country, but not knowing English was a huge barrier. Where could I work if I didn’t speak the language?” 
 
Eager to continue working with children, Libia began volunteering with preschool and afterschool programs in San Francisco as a childcare provider and Spanish teacher. A coworker, noticing Libia’s expertise, soon suggested she open her own in-home childcare business. “I didn’t even know such a thing existed!”, Libia recalled. 
 
Libia’s in-home childcare center, called "Nest Garden Heart", has now been in business for nearly 15 years and Libia is a pillar in her community. “It is amazing to work with children and to be able to watch them grow,” says Libia. “Many of them first come to my home when they’re as young as 2 months old, and stay until they are ready to go to preschool. I’m there as they take their first steps and get their first teeth.” 
 
Nest Garden Heart offers a wide variety of activities and resources to help the children learn and grow, including areas dedicated to reading, music, theater and costumes, and art. This encouraging educational environment is particularly important given that many of the children in her care are special needs or at-risk youth who come to Nest Garden Heart via San Francisco family service agencies. Libia also offers overnight childcare to parents who work the night-shift and need a safe space to leave their children.  
 
Since Libia received her first loan from Opportunity Fund in 2006, she has used two microloans to renovate her backyard and set up a garden and play space. Now, with a loan Libia will be able to purchase new equipment and furniture designed for special needs children, replace worn-out and missing educational supplies, and ensure that her small business continues to be a success.

loans.use: For equipment and furniture for special needs children, and to replace missing or damaged educational materials

loans.name: Mayra Evelyn

texts.es: Mayra Evelyn R. D. V. D. 25 años D. edad, es una joven que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y responsable, quien vive junto a su esposo, su padre y un hijo D. un año D. edad, con quienes resiD. en Jocoaitique, en el departamento D. Morazán. Mayra posee una pequeña sala D. belleza, en la cual se encarga D. cortar el cabello a hombres y mujeres, a pesar que su negocio es bastante humilD., cuenta con muchos clientes que residen en los alrededores del hogar D. Mayra que es donD. está ubicada la peluquería. Con el enorme deseo D. poder mejorar en la vida, Mayra solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar nuevos juegos D. tijeras, así mismo para comprar espejos, una mesa y silla más apropiadas para el negocio, y D. esta forma mejorar su apariencia,  con la esperanza D. obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mayra is 25 years old and is a young woman who stands out as being very hardworking and responsible. She lives in Jocoaitique, in the Morazán department, with her husband, her father, and a one year old son. Mayra has a small beauty salon where she cuts hair for men and women. Although her business is quite humble, she has many customers who live in the area around her home, which is where she has her hairdressing business. She has an enormous desire to improve her life, and so she is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can buy new scissors, and also buy new mirrors, a table, and a chair that is more appropriate for the business, and in this way to improve the look of the business with the hope of gaining better profits.

loans.use: To buy new scissors, tables, and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Rhenilan

texts.en:
Rhenilan G. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Rhenilan is married and has three school-aged children. Rhenilan owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice per kilogram in the local community. She is also providing multi purpose cab or pedicab as her husband as the driver. Rhenilan has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Rhenilan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

Rhenilan is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional sacks of rice & working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice & working capital

loans.name: Margaret Wanjiru

texts.en: Margaret is 42 years old and a single mother of four children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 31,500 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Margaret hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business, cooking chapati and maandazi (flat bread and dumplings) for sale. Her customers are neighbors and schoolchildren. Mejumaa faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and beans

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 41 years old. Jose is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily buying and raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. 

Jose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 26-year-old fisherman who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his family. He is married and has two young children. 

Noel works hard to provide the needs of his family. He also wants to save for his children's future. 

Noel requested a loan to repair his pump boat (an outrigger canoe with a small engine). This will help Noel continue his business and feed his family.

loans.use: to repair his pump boat.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana comes from the village of Sartichala, Gardabani District. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband, two adult sons and daughter-in-law. Manana’s husband is a worker in the village, mainly in house construction and renovation work.
Manana is heading the family's dairy farm. She has three cows and produces approximately 70kg of Georgian cheese per month. Twice a week Manana takes the cheese to Tbilisi (the capital city) and sells it on the Tbilisi open market. The family's total income is 400 Laris. Though Manana works hard, it is hardly enough to meet the family's daily expenses and they are unable to make savings for investing in the expansion of the farm. Because of this, Manana is requesting credit to purchase one more dairy cow. When she has four cows she will be able to sell approximately 30 per cent more cheese and thus increase the family's income by 15 to 20 per cent.
With the increased income, Manana will purchase household goods/appliances in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, et mère de 05 enfants, Amah est revendeuse d’huile rouge et de la farine de blé depuis 2006. Elle veut renforcer son activité en répondant plus à la demande de ses clients et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: 47 years old and mother of 5 children, Amah has been a reseller of red oil and wheat flour since 2006.  She wants to strengthen her business by responding more to the needs of her customers.  She also wants to see her children grow up under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Majorie is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Majorie has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Majorie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Majorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 39 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Efraín de 40 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Sofía de 09 y Jairo de 07 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio al que se dedica Norma es la venta de productos naturales, aprovechando que tiene ya hace muchos años una tienda de abarrotes muy conocida en la ciudad de San Francisco, a puesto un stand dentro de esta, donde ofrece a sus clientes todos  sus productos, los cuales son rápidamente comprados, ya que ella sabe muy bien como convencerlos y alentarlos a que se lleven más de un solo producto natural. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que mejor efecto tendrá en sus males, lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es convencer a sus clientes sobre la importancia de sus productos, aun así ella sigue adelante muy firme en sus metas. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitará a sus proveedores que la dejen mayor cantidad de productos naturales. Con el tiempo, desea abrir una tienda exclusivamente para sus productos naturales. Este será su 13avo crédito con MFP, espera contar con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo y en sus aportes se compromete ser puntual como en sus anteriores prestamos, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos naturales, con lo cual espera implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Norma, 39, is an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Efraín, 40, and her two beloved children, Sofía, 9, and Jairo, 7, who are the main motivators of all her efforts.  

Norma’s business is natural products sales.  Taking advantage of the fact that she’s had a well known grocery store in the city of San Francisco for many years she set up a stand inside it where she offers her customers all her product which are bought up quickly because she knows how to convince them and encourage them to take more than one natural product.  What she enjoys the most about her work is advising her customers about the products that will have the best effects on their maladies.  She’s been in business four years and considers the most difficult part convincing her customers about the importance of her products.  Even so, she continues firm in her goals.

With support from the loan, she’ll ask her suppliers to leave a larger volume of natural products.  In time, she’d like to open a store exclusively dedicated to the natural products.

This will be her 13th loan with MFP.  She hopes to have support from lenders to continue growing and commits to be punctual with her installment payments like she’s been in prior loans because she wants to be able to access future loans.  She is very participative in the communal bank.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more natural products that she hopes to use to better stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy more natural products to stock her store.

loans.name: Kisanga Group

texts.en:
Hamdan, who is in his mid 50s, is married and has four children who go to school and college. He has also two grandchildren who are still very young.  

He has had a tailoring business since 1979. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more fabrics and sewing equipment and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy a modern electrical sewing machine. He has been using a manual sewing machine with which it takes a lot of time to make a dress and has to use a lot of energy. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kisanga," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

(For these two days the weather has not been good for photos.)

loans.use: To buy a modern electrical sewing machine.

loans.name: Gladys Azucena

texts.es:
Gladys Azucena  tiene 37 años de edad  es soltera vive con dos hijos de 14 y 10 años en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

 Gladys Azucena se dedica al cultivo de cacao, maíz, arroz y naranja. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir cultivando y dar a los hijos la mejor educación para que tengan un buen futuro.
Le gusta  en los momentos libres conversar con los hijos y ayudar hacer las tareas de la escuela.
texts.en:
Gladys Azucena, 37, is single living with her two children who are 14 and 10 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueva Unión” (New Union) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas and coffee.

Gladys Azucena grows cocoa beans, corn, rice and oranges.  She makes her purchases and her sales at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

She requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizers and manure, for her crops.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her farming activities.  She faces challenges like the drop in price of the products she sells as well as dealing with middlemen.  

Her dream is to buy land to continue farming and provide her children with the best education so that they will have a good future.  In her free time she enjoys chatting with her children and helping them do their homework.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Gulbarshin

texts.en:
Gulbarshin is 45 years old and lives with her two children in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her two children are both college students. 

Gulbarshin started to sell clothes in 1999 at the local market. From 2002, she diversified her business and started to operate a grocery shop business. She has gained much business experience in her field. With her profits earned from the business, Gulbarshin pays the college tuition fee of her children. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says "I will devote my everything to my children." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothes and more grocery products from Tashkent due to the start of the school new year.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and more grocery products

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raúl le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar la materia que es cemento, arena, pintura especial para el exterior y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder mejorar la vivienda de su familia y así estar mas seguros, protegidos y evitar enfermedades. 
Don Raúl es empleado de un taller que se dedican a realizar trabajos de herrería, como soldador, con una parte de este sueldo planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene su familia, su esposa la señora  Sandra de dedica al cuidado de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Raul is having the outside of his house finished off.

He has requested a loan to buy cement, sand and special paint for the exterior, and to pay the person who will be doing the work. With the money needed to improve the family home, his family will be safer, better protected and better able to avoid illnesses.

Raul works as a welder in a blacksmith's workshop.  He will use part of his salary to pay back the loan, as he is the breadwinner for his family. His wife, Sandra, looks after their young child.

loans.use: to finish off the outside of his house.

loans.name: 03.08.85 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Chiến works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Chiến is 44 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 85 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives with one dependent, and works in the Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chiến has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Chiến hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 34 years old, married and has three children who attend school.  

She makes detergents so as to earn a living. She has been running the business for over ten years. Besides this, she also operates a cafeteria.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management skills. This has helped her to improve the business.

Susan hopes to expand her business within five years. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy chemicals for making detergents.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for making detergents.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela Minayo is 27 years, married to Elijah who is a businessman, and they have two young children.

Pamela operates a cereal business in Kakamega town and has been doing so for the last five years with success since she makes a monthly income of KES 17,400. She joined KADET LTD, and she has applied for a  loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy more cereals like maize and beans  for sale.

She will use the profits to buy still more cereals for sale and her long-term dream is to be the best business lady in Kakamega and own several cereal outlets.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals to stock for the business.

loans.name: Bayanmunh

texts.en: Bayanmunh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps him with the business and his daughter is a school student. He started his shoe retail business in 2009 by renting a counter in a market. He has a good eye for fashion. He is a sharp and hard working man who says, "at first, It was difficult to run a business but now that I am experienced and successful on my current business, I want to broaden a range of products to sale". He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more shoes and clothes from Beijing.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and clothes from Beijing
